Event Name: The Next Evolution of Marketing | AWE Nite Chicago
Location: 222 West Merchandise Mart Plaza #1212, Chicago, IL 60654
Description: Details: 08/02/2023In the future, Immersive Technologies like Augmented and Virtual Reality are likely to become even more integrated into marketing strategies. Advancements in technology, such as improved hardware, better tracking capabilities, and more sophisticated content creation tools, will further enhance the immersive experiences. As these technologies become more accessible and affordable, we can expect to see a wider adoption across industries. AR and VR will continue to play a vital role in shaping the future of marketing by providing brands with powerful tools to connect with consumers on a deeper level, create memorable experiences, and differentiate themselves in a crowded marketplace.Join us on August 2nd to hear from experts on The Next Evolution of Marketing through the use of immersive technologies.What's The Format:We begin with informal networking and then start the stage portion promptly at 6:15pm CDT. There will be a handful of presentations before we move on to answer audience questions and then finish with more networking. We keep it simple and informal - this program is about you, our members, and not the host or presenters. Come and get your questions answered, take your next step into immersive technology.We will be serving the Revolution (Beer), cold!5:30-6:00 PM Technology Demonstrations & Networking6:15-6:30 PM Introductions & Welcome Message6:30-7:10 PM Panelist Presentations7:10-7:45 PM Panel Discussion with Q&A7:45-8:30 PM More Networking & Technology DemosPhysical & Virtual Venues:1871 | 222 W Merchandise Mart Plz | Suite 1212For our Physical Venue, 1871 can be found in Suite 1212 on the 12th floor of theMART, which is located on the North side of the river between Wells and Orleans. For easy access, enter through the Orleans entrance on the west side of theMART and take those elevators to the 12th floor. Virbela | Virtual Environment | virbela.com/downloadFor our Virtual Venue, we will be using Virbela's Open Campus to host the program. We suggest that you download, set-up, get familiar with the Virbela program and environment prior to the program, as we will be unable to provide support during the event. The virtual environment resembles a physical space, so you will be able to talk with other attendees during open networking both before and after the presentations. The sound is spatialized, so if at any point it feels too loud, feel free to move your conversation to another part of the room where there are less people. Primary Live Stream | https://awe.live/sessionsPeople can join by watching the scheduled live stream where we will field questions from!Host:Matt Wren - In-Person Host - Founder & CTO of BUNDLARCaroline Dennis - Virtual Host - Two-Degrees.io and XRWomenMatt Wren will be moderating the discussion in person while Caroline Dennis will be hosting the virtual portion in Virbela. Matt is the CTO for BUNDLAR and founder of The Next Evolution event series and VRAR Chicago. Caroline is entrepreneur, startup advisor, and advocate from Two-Degrees.io and XRWomen. Panelists:Lauren Lemieux - Mostly MisfitsTerry Proto - Virtual Reality MarketingKeith Soljacich - Publicis Media Content & InnovationLeslie Marshall - MesmeriseAbout Our Panelists' Companies: What do you do when you have a brilliantly creative team with tons of talent and ideas but no platform to bring them to life? You start a club...or a business I guess...that's us, Mostly Misfits. XR technology is at the core of Mostly Misfits, but our capabilities expand far beyond that.Publicis Media Content & Innovation (PMCI) fosters a world where fearless brands have the courage and confidence to embrace what’s next in immersive experiences through the power of content, commerce and connection.Since 2016, The Mesmerise Group has partnered with Fortune 500 companies to deliver transformative brand experiences, training sessions, and events through XR. Daglar Cizmeci and Andrew Hawken founded the company with a mission to unlock the potential of immersive technologies and manage the opportunity and mitigate the risks of artificial intelligence (AI) – here and now – and for the future. As the trusted guide to immersive technology and AI for the enterprise, the company provides enterprise-grade security and solutions through risk mitigation strategies. The Mesmerise Group is based in London with U.S. headquarters in Santa Monica, California. To learn more about The Mesmerise Group, visit www.mesmerisegroup.com.For more details about our presenters or their companies, please visit the event page on VRAR Chicago's Website.AWE (Augmented World Expo): AWE's mission is to help the XR community advance Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality technology in order to further human progress. With the industry successfully reaching the milestone of 1 billion active users of AR in 2020, over the next decade AWE aims to guide the industry’s attention towards our own core objectives of enabling people across the globe to learn, connect and grow within the XR industry.The AWE community is committed to pursuing the goal of building a 1 trillion dollar XR industry by 2030, while ensuring the outcome is a world worth living in.AWE Nites are a place for developers, creators, investors, founders, academics, corporate decision makers and curious folk to come together locally (or online) on an ongoing basis to help advance the [Immersive Technology (Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality, Mixed Reality)] ecosystem in your city and globally. The Next Evolution -is- AWE Nite ChicagoThank you to our sponsors, 1871, BUNDLAR, and Virbela for providing venue, management, marketing & logistics support and to our partners 2112, VR Motion Learning, XR Women, & International Game Developers Association Chicago (IGDA Chicago) to the VRAR Chicago event series: The Next Evolution | AWE Nite Chicago.

Event Name: Managing Successful Programmes - MSP Advanced Practitioner 2 Days Training
Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate	  														   Credits: 16 PDUsDuration: 2-Day			 																														Language: EnglishCourse Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual/ On-site	Course Description:The Managing Successful Programmes (MSP®) Advanced Practitioner Course provides an opportunity to learn how MSP can be applied to large programmes, in complex and changing environments, with full accountability of the achievement of the required outcomes. The course also prepares participants for the MSP Advanced Practitioner examination.This level is aiming to confirm that a candidate has sufficient understanding of the MSP guidance, combined with actual programme management experience to act as a programme manager, any other member of a programme management team, or head of a programme office. The candidate will also learn how MSP can be tailored to suit any programme environment.The course is entirely focused at applying MSP in complex programme scenarios. Exercises will be based on the candidates own programme management experience, and on the case study used in the Advanced Practitioner Exam. This scenario will need to be studied in advance of the first day of the course.Course Outline:●	MSP Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	 Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Target Audience:●	Experienced Programme Managers, used to operating in a transformational change environment.●	The Head of the Programme Office.●	Business Change Managers.●	Other specialist/governance roles involved in ensuring high quality programme management based on best practices is in place, based on the MSP guidance.Learning Objectives:●	Tailor the MSP methodology to make it suitable for any environment.●	Flexibly react to changes in the programme environment, resolve major programme level	  Apply each of the MSP principles, governance themes and the transformational flow activities within a large complex programme and changing environment.●	Explain the relationship between the MSP principles, governance themes, the transformational flow, programme information (documents) and the MSP defined programme management roles; and can apply that understanding.●	Produce or evaluate MSP programme information (documents).   ●	Pass the Advanced Practitioner exam.Course Agenda:Day 1●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.Day 2●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Note:However, catering to the demands of busy professionals, our virtual training programs are as effective as face-to-face learning. Reach us at info@mangates.com for dates and details of Instructor Led Live Virtual Sessions. If you would like to get this course customized and delivered exclusively for your group, we have an On-Site Training Option, you can reach us at info@mangates.com for more details about on-site or corporate training.Offers:Groups of 3 people 10% DiscountGroups of 5 people 15% DiscountGroups of 10 people 20% Discount

Event Name: The Unreal Garden - Chicago
Location: 108 North State Street Suite 150, Chicago, IL 60602
Description: This summer only, experience the hit immersive exhibit: The Unreal Garden in Chicago. Close to Millennium Park and only a 5 minute walk from the world famous Chicago Bean!The Unreal Garden is a fully immersive holographic experience divided into multiple acts. Visitors explore surreal landscapes, interact with a variety of animals, and complete puzzles and challenges. The interactive elements and unique behaviors of the mythical animals make it unlike any other immersive experience. It's an unforgettable journey that challenges the mind and stimulates the senses.Be the first to tell your friends about the future of storytelling with cutting edge holographic headsets also used by NASA (No nausea!).No experience required, the perfect entertainment option for work parties, friends-night-out, date night, and creating unforgettable family memories.Ages 7 and up welcome. Please leave the furry friends at home.Walk-in tickets are available but they often sell out by 2:00 PM so please book in advance.About The Unreal GardenAre you imaginary? The Unreal Garden takes you on a journey through time and space guided by a butterfly who is convinced that you are a part of her imagination! Interact with the environment, feed the animals, collect all the crystals, and maybe if you’re lucky: you’ll find your way back home before you turn into a hologram!The Unreal Garden is perfect for first-time “Verse Walkers”. There is no experience required to enjoy the show, but you might not find everything the first time you play.Remember: Stay curious, look everywhere and touch everything!Getting To The VenueCheck-in at the Verse Immersive at 108 N State St, Suite 150 in downtown Chicago. The venue is close to  to Millennium Park and only a 5 minute walk from the world famous Chicago Bean!Frequently Asked QuestionsWait, what is this?Somewhere between an interactive Alice in Wonderland and a stroll through the forests of Avatar, The Unreal Garden is an immersive augmented experience which puts you at the center of an engaging story. You’ll walk around wearing fully transparent headsets while you see and interact with visionary art and unbelievable creatures.Do I need to bring my own headset?Nope, we have you covered! Just bring yourself and your phone for selfies!How long does the experience take?Plan on spending between 30 and 60 minutes in The Unreal Garden.Can I transfer my tickets or get a refund?All Verse Immersive event tickets are non-refundable. If you are not able to make it to the event, feel free to give your ticket to a friend or family member.Sightcraft: New VIP Add-On ExperienceStep into the realm of the Sightcraft, a magic casting simulator where cutting-edge science and cognitive techniques merge to reveal your hidden potential! Embrace the magic that permeates every aspect of our world, from the intricate cells within our bodies to the boundless cosmos. Experience a captivating focus game that blends the excitement of spell casting with the joy of social interaction.Unlock the wonders of reality by developing your universal awareness and immediate presence. In this enthralling 15-minute challenge, learn to cast your first spell and put your newfound skills to the test! Witness how the lines blur between science and magic, and remember Arthur C. Clarke's famous words, "Any sufficiently advanced science is indistinguishable from magic."Don't miss your chance to embark on this mesmerizing adventure! Join us at the Sightcraft and tap into the wonders of reality. Reserve your spot now and unleash the magical force within you!

Lansing Days In The Park

The aim is to get out into the community and greet residents with food and fun while also educating them about the services Thornton Township provides at no additional charge. Event Name: Double Dutch Aerobics Chicago
Description: Welcome to Double Dutch Aerobics Chicago! DDA Chicago is a new and exciting fitness class here in the city. Double Dutch, a rhythmic jump rope activity, is re-gaining popularity due to its ability to improve cardiovascular health, coordination, and overall fitness levels. We offer a unique twist by incorporating dynamic cardio exercises and team building into our classes, creating a fun and inclusive environment for participants of all ages and fitness levels. And best of all, if you don't know how to jump double dutch, we will teach you in one minute, or less! #chicago #fitness #workout #Doubledutchaerobics #doubledutchaerobicschicago #fitnessclass #thingstodoinchicago

Event Name: Build and Launch Accelerator Demo Day
Description: This event will showcase teams participating in the University of Chicago's Build and Launch Accelerators.The Polsky Build and Launch Accelerators give student teams the opportunity to work intensively and solely on their businesses and social enterprises in a collaborative and dynamic environment over the summer. The program accepts teams to participate through a competitive selection process, and each team is given funding, in-kind resources, educational content, and mentorship.The Build Accelerator allows students to spend their summer building the key elements of their early ventures, and validating assumptions around their market or customers. The Launch Accelerator allows student ventures at a later stage to spend their summer fundraising for their venture, selling, and gaining/maintaining momentum.Stream details will be shared closer to the event.Questions? Contact Paul Cavalieri at paul.cavalieri@chicagobooth.edu.

Event Name: CHICAGO SOUND BATHS: BRING YOUR OWN DOG!
Location: 1821 West Hubbard Street Suite 304, Chicago, IL 60622
Description: Chicago Sound Baths: Bring Your Own Dog!Join us for a unique and relaxing experience at Chicago Sound Baths: Bring Your Own Dog! Get ready to immerse yourself in a harmonious soundscape while bonding with your furry friend. This in-person event will take place on Sun Aug 20 2023 from 2-4PMLocated at 1821 West Hubbard Street Suite 304, Chicago, IL 60622, our serene venue (which hosts free parking and an elevator) sets the perfect atmosphere for you and your dog to unwind. Leave your worries at the door as our experienced sound bath facilitators guide you through a meditative journey using various instruments and healing frequencies. During this event, you'll have the opportunity to connect with your dog on a deeper level, as the soothing sounds create a calming environment for both of you. Watch as your furry companion relaxes and enjoys the positive vibrations. Chicago sound practitioner Silvia Rubalcaba will gently guide you through a relaxing meditation using Tibetan Singing Bowls, Crystal Singing Bowls and other sound healing instruments while you relax with your fur baby. This one-hour session will conclude with Prosecco and Swag Bags from some of the top Chicago pet professionals.Whether you're seeking relaxation, stress relief, or simply want to spend quality time with your dog, Chicago Sound Baths: Bring Your Own Dog! is the perfect event for you. No prior experience is necessary, and all breeds and sizes of dogs are welcome.Don't miss out on this unique bonding experience! Mark your calendars and join us for Chicago Sound Baths: Bring Your Own Dog! on Sun Aug 20 2023.(﻿UPDATE 7/25/23: We have sold out of human and dog tickets but have plenty of human tickets left!)

Event Name: Wilson Chi-League
Description: Chicago Pro-Am Basketball has been the fabric of Chicago’s basketball culture for decades. Beginning in 1984 with the Chicago Pro-Am at Chicago State University, these games were born out of the desire to provide underserved communities access to high quality professional basketball in a safe environment. Striving to be more than just a game, Chicago’s Pro-Am basketball was elevated in 2013 when the Chi-League was launched as a nine-week summer tournament that served as a form of escapism to help stop the violence of the city by promoting unity through sports. Attend the Men's and Women's tournament at Whitney Young High School for FREE on Saturdays July 22, July 29, August 5, and Sunday, August 13. A suggested donation of $5 to local Chicago YMCAs is recommended upon entry. Wilson partners' with the YMCA to host programming each week during the event. Activities range from park beautification and community cleanups to female empowerment seminars to free basketball skills clinics. Your $5 donation will help us support these initiatives that are so impactful in the Chicago community. PLEASE NOTE, ENTRY IS FIRST COME FIRST SERVED. RESERVATION DOES NOT GUARANTEE ENTRY. Your reservation enters you into a Wilson basketball prize pack giveaway and provides operators with projected attendance to assist with traffic flow. ENTER THROUGH WEST GYM ENTRANCE ONLY.Stay in touch with all things Chi-League here and we look forward to a summer showing how we're all #BondedByBall.Tournament ScheduleSaturday, July 22 - Round 1, Part 1 (subject to change)11:00 am: Doors Open11:30 am: Women's Game 1: Chaos vs CPD Enforcers1:00 pm: Men's Game 1: C.A.S.H. vs Team Sterling Brown2:30 pm: Women's Game 2 : ASWBL vs Azura 4:00 pm: Men's Game 2: Operation Basketball vs Sports Factory Inc.Saturday, July 29 - Round 1, Part 2 (subject to change)11:00 am: Doors Open11:30 am: Women's Game 11:00 pm: Men's Game 12:30 pm: Women's Game 2 4:00 pm: Men's Game 2Saturday, August 5 - Semifinals (subject to change)11:00 am: Doors Open11:30 am: Women's Game 11:00 pm: Men's Game 12:30 pm: Women's Game 2 4:00 pm: Men's Game 2Sunday, August 13 - Championships (subject to change)12:30 pm: Doors Open1:00 pm: Women's Championship Game2﻿:45 pm: 3 Point Contest3:00 pm: Dunk Contest3﻿:45 pm: Men's Championship Game5﻿:00 pm: YMCA Donation PresentationParkingFree parking is available at Whitney Young High School, as well as street parking. The main parking lot in front of the school is at the corner of S. Laflin and W. Jackson Blvd. You can enter the gym ONLY from the west door entrance between Adams and Jackson. East building entrance will be locked.We highly encourage use of public transit to attend Chi-League.

Event Name: Chicago Boys and Girls Clubs Annual Carnival
Description: We're looking for volunteers like you! Help us partner with the True Value Boys and Girls Club for our annual carnival to help the kids kick off the 2023-2024 school year.For the past several years, the Chicago Association of REALTORS®' volunteer members have hosted 200 True Value Boys & Girls Club kids at a fun-filled carnival. We have a blast! The kids enjoy games, bounce houses, face painting, a photo booth, cotton candy and a tasty BBQ. Space is limited. Please click here for more information on CAR’s event attendance and cancellation policy.  By registering to participate in this event, you hereby acknowledge and consent that The Chicago Association of REALTORS® (and their assignees) may take photographs and/or video of you during the event and may use those photographs and recordings for the Association’s purposes, including but not limited to news, publicity and fundraising purposes, without further compensation to you. All such photos and videos are the sole property of the Association.  The Chicago Association of REALTORS® (CAR) is committed to creating a safe and inclusive experience for our community and providing a friendly and welcoming environment for all. We do not tolerate harassment in any form. Please act professionally and follow our Code of Conduct at all CAR events. Do you have any disabilities which require special accommodation? If so, please identify any special accommodations by emailing events@chicagorealtor.com at least one week prior to the event date. Interested in receiving our events emails? Click here to sign-up!

Event Name: Wedding Toast Warm Up
Description: Asked to give a speech at your friend’s wedding? Need a gift for the person you asked to be your Maid of Honor or Best Man?Come prepare for a wedding toast with us! In this two part workshop, we’ll help you structure a thoughtful speech, punch up the jokes, and practice with a real champagne (or sparkling cider) toast! Join us for two consecutive weekend afternoons for a fun, get-sh*t-done workshop. Come with or without a draft speech, procrastinators are welcome! I﻿nstructor: Audrey JonasP﻿lease note that when registering, only the first class will show up, but each session is TWO CLASSES:APRIL SESSION: S﻿undays, April 16 and  April 233:00-5:00 pm CSTJ﻿UNE SESSION: S﻿aturdays, June 10 and  June 173:00-5:00 pm CSTA﻿UGUST SESSION: S﻿undays, August 20 and 27 3﻿:00-5:00 pm CST The Lincoln Lodge Theater Code of Conduct The Lincoln Lodge Theater and Training Center is a place to foster creativity, connection and artistic expression with an aim to provide a safe and supportive environment for performers to grow.  Those entering this space must be able to come together in trust and respect, while honoring the diversity of its community members.  The purpose of this document is to promote student/performer well being and encourage a collaborative and harmonious theater environment. The following is a list of expectations for students and performers while in The Lincoln Lodge space:  -Be aware of the diverse background of theater attendees/classmates and create material from a place of fun, respect and kindness towards others -Sexist, racist, homophobic, and discriminatory behavior or jokes will not be tolerated-Behave professionally and respectfully towards others -Treat sensitive and risky subject matter carefully and with emotional intelligence. Be open to having a constructive, open conversation about a performance afterwards if the occasion arises. The following is a non-exhaustive list of prohibited conduct:-Physical abuse-Theft/damage/misuse of property: Theft or damage, misuse and unauthorized possession or improper use of personal property; and unauthorized or improper use of, or entry into, theater facilities-Harassment: Threatening, harassing, bullying or intimidating a person, either verbally, in writing or through electronic or other means-Sexual Harassment: Unwanted/unwelcome sexual behavior directed at a person in a physical, verbal or non-verbal form-Drug/alcohol use: Consumption, sale, distribution or use of illicit drugs or outside alcohol is strictly prohibited. Additionally, the Lincoln Lodge is a smoke free zone, including vaping/e-cigarettes. -Weapons and hazardous materials: The use, possession or storage of any firearms or weapons; dangerous materials or chemicals are prohibited on the theater premises Consequences for breaching our Code of Conduct will be dealt with accordingly and may consist of but not limited to: warnings, apologies, probation, suspension, or even removal from the premises. All decisions in regards to situations will be at the discretion of the theater director and training center manager.

Perfect for beginners and seasoned artists alike, this class offers a relaxing and inspiring environment for all to unleash their creativity and bring the garden to life on paper. Join us and let your artistic spirit bloom!

Description: Get 4 FREE tickets to our luxury bridal show at the Marriott Hotel O'Hare, Chicago on Sunday, October 29th, 2023 from 11am to 4pm.  Fashion show at 3pm.  Let the wedding planning begin!Show Times: We ask that you choose any arrival time convenient to you. You can stay as long as you'd like. Staggered arrivals allow a less crowded environment.11:00am to Noon (Most Crowded Arrival Time)Noon to 1:00pm (Less Crowded Arrival Time)1:00pm to 2pm (Even Less Crowded Arrival Time)2:00pm to 3:00pm (Even Less Crowded and fashion show starts at 3pm)Hours: Ticketed show times throughout this event are in hour increments for arrival times to allow a less crowded environment. You’ll likely spend 1-3 hours at the event or how ever long you want. And don't miss our fashion show which starts at 3pm. About Bridal Expo Chicago: We have been the number one luxury bridal show and expo for more than 28 years! Attend our show and experience everything new and trending in weddings. Shop in style, find amazing discounts/deals from participating wedding professionals.Free Swag Bag. Tickets normally $25 at the door. How to Order & RSVP:1. Get up to 4 Tickets at No Charge to attend the event. Save $100 instantly.2. Arrive at least 10 minutes prior to your show time if possible. 3. Check your Junk or Spam Folder for Ticket Confirmation. 4. Please show a copy of your ticket order at the door for entry at the time specified. If you are running late, we will still allow you to enter the show whenever you arrive.

Event Name: The Metropolitan Open House
Location: 233 South Wacker Drive #67th Floor, Chicago, IL 60606
Description: ABOUT THE EVENTWe are thrilled to invite you to an unforgettable evening 67 floors up in the sky. Our exceptional Executive Chef, Ozzy, has thoughtfully created an array of mouth-watering appetizers for you to indulge in while participating in thrilling competitions such as Closest to the Pin Par 3 and Longest Drive in our state-of-the-art Five Iron Golf Lounge. As a special treat, you will also gain valuable insights into the exclusive perks of being a Member with us. We sincerely look forward to your presence and cannot wait to share this experience!Complimentary to attend. A la carte bar.ABOUT THE CLUBThe Metropolitan is inspired by its heritage and dedicated to its future as it continues to be where Chicago’s business and social leaders connect, host, work and play. The Club has become the most modern and sophisticated lifestyle Club in Chicago, offering curated, aspirational and dynamic atmospheres on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. The Club serves the needs of the modern Chicagoan and downtowner. As a social and business hub, the Club is the capstone of the reimagined Willis Tower.The Metropolitan Club offers Members a fine dining experience unrivaled in the downtown Chicago area, with inventive cuisine and handcrafted cocktails served with sweeping city views. Our business amenities make it easy to get your job done, with concierge and meeting services, equipment, and technology to facilitate your every need. ACCESSING THE CLUBTo access the Club, please arrive at the Franklin Street entrance of Willis Tower (232 S. Franklin); all guests have to check in with security and provide a government-issued photo-id. After checking in, you will take the elevator to the 66th floor. On the 66th floor, you will exit the elevator and then, in the same area, select the button for the 67th floor and proceed back into the elevator to go up one more floor. There you will find the East Room on your right-hand side. For more information on Membership and the Club, contact our team at 312.876.3200 or metropolitan@invitedclubs.com.STYLE & CLUB ETIQUETTEMembers and guests will feel comfortable at the Club in smart casual attire. Please be sure to communicate this with any guests accompanying you. Denim without rips or distress is permitted, while hats, t-shirts, flip flops, athletic wear and shoes, shorts, and loungewear are not. It is our goal to create a comfortable environment for our Members and guests while visiting the Club; it is up to our Members to share the style etiquette with their accompanying guests. The Metropolitan is designed for adults, but it is child-friendly.

Event Name: Bike Glenview - North Branch Ride
Description: Please join us on the annual Bike Glenview - North Branch Ride! We'll explore the beautiful variety of habitats found along the Chicago River, from Bunker Hill Forest Preserve north to Harms Woods. You'll encounter prairies, wetlands, and woodlands as we wind our way north. Discover what makes these preserves so important for wildlife and people alike!We'll stop along the way to chat about the ecology and history of the preserves we're traveling through. There will be a longer walk through Blue Star Memorial Woods (just north of Harms Woods) to discuss restoration efforts at that site. This ride is designed for cyclists of all skill levels, covering approximately 15 miles. Please meet at 6639 W Harts Rd, Niles, IL 60714. We'll be in the parking lot at the northern end of Bunker Hill Forest Preserve. We'll depart promptly at 10:00 a.m. Remember to bring plenty of water! A helmet is required for this ride.This event is free and it does fill up, so you must register to attend. Thank you to the Glenview Park District and Bike Glenview for helping to coordinate this event.For questions about the ride, please contact your guide, Derek Ziomber, Friends' North Branch Field Organizer, at derek@fotfp.org. For questions about registration, please contact Ilana Federman at ilana@fotfp.org.

Event Name: Uptown Rhythm Festival
Description: Uptown Rhythm FestivalJoin us for an unforgettable evening of rhythm, and fun at the Uptown Rhythm Festival! Get ready to groove to the beats of talented musicians and experience the vibrant energy of the city. This in-person event will take place from  Fri Aug 25 2023 to Sun Aug 27 2023 at 4850 North Simonds Drive, Chicago, IL 60640.Learn about the dances and customs of different communities that call Chicago home and learn from City's sustainability ninja's on how we can all become part of a movement to live more sustainably.Immerse yourself in the rich cultural heritage of Chicago and dance the night away with friends and family. Don't miss out on this exciting event that celebrates the rhythm and soul of the city. Mark your calendars and get ready to let loose at the Uptown Rhythm Festival!Agenda: Aug 25 @ 5:30 PM:  Opening CeremonyAug 25 @ 6:00 PM: DJ Aug 25 @ 8:00 PM: Movie on the lakeAug 26 @ 8:00 AM - 10:00 AM: Yoga on the beach and beach clean upAug 26 @ 5:30 PM - 8:00 PM:  Dance programming and SpeakersAug 26 @ 8:00PM - 10:00 PM: Drum CircleAug 27  @ 8:00 AM - 10:00 AM: YogaAug 27 @3:30 PM - 5:30 PM:  Dance Programming and Speakers

Event Name: Conquer Your Fear of Public Speaking -Chicago- Virtual Free Trial Class
Description: Overcome public speaking fear with gradual exposure, in a supportive environment. Observe a free trial to see if it's right for you. Based out of New York City for 30 years, we are now offering these classes online to an international audience. This one free trial class is an observation session to see if the US$425/10 session program is right for you. The instructor will be happy to answer any questions following the session.****30 Years of Testimonials: https://www.speakeeezi.com/success.htmZenspeak Public Speaking Center: https://www.speakeeezi.comOnce the 10 session package is purchased, the student may use their sessions however they choose.  The course is ongoing, so each session has participants at all levels. We use a workbook which each student works through at their own pace.This is the 30th year we’ve been helping people turn their dread into confidence. Gradual exposure allows you to face fear in manageable steps, at your own pace, in a supportive environment. Instructors Charles di Cagno and Kyra Smith, are phobia therapists, and former and current Directors of Public Speaking at White Plains Hospital Anxiety Treatment Center in the United States. Whatever the level of public speaking, we can help you improve. For those with anxiety, we provide gradual exposure to public speaking through a step ladder of basic to more advanced exercises. For the more experienced, it's a platform tailored to your specific needs to improve various delivery techniques. It is self-paced, in a low pressure, supportive environment with lots of feedback to address your specific issues. Begin with basic exercises and move forward only when ready. The course is ongoing, with a mix of beginning and advanced students. Our hope is you are inspired, not intimidated by the dynamic speakers present, and keep in mind they started with the same fears, progressing to their present level by consistent effort. The course is not difficult. If you have the will, we offer the way to turn a liability into your most powerful asset. The real challenge is admitting you need guidance, getting started, and making a committed, consistent effort.Our 100% success rate over 20 years for wedding speeches is just one indication of our effectiveness. But, whatever the challenge, (formal presentation, group discussion, business meeting, sales, confrontation, employment interview) the program is customized to fit your needs.Sample Gradual Exposure Program Outline for Public Speaking Anxiety:Session One - Get comfortable hearing your voice in public by responding to very simple questions while seated. The questions (i.e., name, occupation, where you live, etc.) require little thought or content.Session Two - Learning to stand confidently before a group. You will stand, with several others and respond to simple questions. As your confidence increases, one by one, each person standing will sit, until you are standing alone. You will continue until this begins to feel comfortable.Session Three- This exercise is the same as the previous one except you start by standing alone.Session Four - Gestures and Movement. Enhance your message, decrease tension and project a confident demeanor incorporating non-verbal skills.Session Five - Implement the skills learned in the session four by relating a personal experience using gestures and movement to enhance your narrative.Session Six - Respond to Questions. Open the floor to questions on a topic of choice.Session Seven - Impromptu Speaking. Learn to organize and deliver an unprepared (no notes) talk.Session Eight - Prepared Speech (Instructor Guided). Learn the secret of outlining and presenting a prepared speech with minimal effort or stress.Session Nine - Prepared Speech. Outline and deliver a speech unassisted.Once you have mastered the above you can begin simulating all manner of interpersonal and public communication including:Persuasive SpeakingPanel DiscussionConflict ResolutionDefending your PositionDebatingInitiating and Sustaining ConversationAs well as many othersWe look forward to working with you.

Event Name: Bridal Expo Chicago, Wed. Eve. Aug.16, Abbington Banquets, Glen Ellyn, 5-9p
Location: 3S002 Il Rt. 53 and Butterfield, Glen Ellyn, IL 60137
Description: Get 4 FREE tickets to our luxury bridal show at the Abbington Banquets in Glen Ellyn on Wednesday, August 16th, 2023 from 5p to 9p. We take the stress out of wedding planning so be sure to invite your friends and family. Show Times: We ask that you choose any arrival time convenient to you. You can stay as long as you'd like. Staggered arrivals allow a less crowded environment.5:00pm to 6:00p (Popular Arrival Time)6:00p to 7:00p (Less Crowded Arrival Time)7:00p to 8:00pm (Even Less Crowded Arrival Time)Hours: Ticketed show times throughout this event are in hour increments for arrival times to allow a less crowded environment. If you are running late, don't worry; we will still allow you to enter! Our arrival time slots  allows each bridal party ample time to speak with more than 40 vendors. It also creates a less crowded environment which is more relaxing and fun.  These arrival time slots help  avoid everyone arriving at once and standing in line. You’ll likely spend 1-3 hours at the event or however long you want. About Bridal Expo Chicago: We have been the number one luxury bridal show and expo for more than 28 years! Attend our show and experience everything new and trending in weddings. Shop in style, find amazing discounts/deals from participating wedding professionals.Free Swag Bag. Tickets normally $25 at the door. How to Order & RSVP:1. Get up to 4 Tickets at No Charge to attend the event. Save $100 instantly.2. Arrive at least 10 minutes prior to your show time if possible. 3. Check your Junk or Spam Folder for Ticket Confirmation. 4. Please show a copy of your ticket order at the door for entry at the time specified. If you are running late, we will still allow you to enter the show whenever you arrive. If our August 16th show doesn't work for you, visit www.BridalExpoTickets.com to see all September through November dates and locations. Use Code: "EE" at check out for 4 Free Tickets.com. SAVE $100 INSTANTLY.

Event Name: Viewmasters Toastmasters
Location: 233 South Wacker Drive Floor 66, Chicago, IL 60601
Description: W﻿e are hosted and sponsored by the Metropolitan Club in the Willis Tower, which offers a fabulous view from the 66th floor. Viewmasters offers a great opportunity to network, develop or polish your communication skills, and practice in a safe and constructive environment.  Above all, we have fun in every meeting and support one another to improve. We offer a hybrid meeting experience to include those who can't appear in person, but encourage you join us in the room for the best experience.   D﻿oors open at 1130, you should arrive by 1145 or login by 1200 because we start and end promptly. W﻿e'll issue you a guest pass for the building to attend in person or the hybrid meeting link when you register via Eventbrite, plus additional information on how we operate. W﻿e look forward to having you join us.

Event Name: We Need to Talk: After Party - Chicago Edition
Description: Join us for an unforgettable evening of food, food and fellowship at our exclusive "We need to Talk" After Party. This event is designed to bring together a diverse community for an evening of connection, laughter and meaningful conversations.Tickets: Tickets are priced at the cost of $10 per person which covers entry to the venue and ensures we have all the arrangements in place to create an enjoyable experience for everyone. Don't miss out on this opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals!Event highlights: Appetizing food + drinks that will satisfy your tastebuds and keep you energeized throughout the night; fun activities that you can choose to participate in designed to break the ice and foster connections among attendees. Engaging conversations: We hope you continue the conversation from earlier and share your thoughts, experiences and ideas in an inclusive and welcoming environment where open and safe dialogues are encouraged. Get ready for an incredible night of connection! Disclaimer: This event is NOT sponsored or supported by the official We need to talk Tour. Please note this event is open to individuals aged 21 and above. Don't miss this chance to unwind and make new friends! secure your sport today by purchasing tickets on Eventbrite. For any inquiries or further inforation, please contact us at attnladiess@gmail.com.

Event Name: YPN Breakfast: How to Business Plan For Success
Description:
Start your day with business advice, compelling discussions and new connections at our monthly meet-ups. Enjoy a complimentary breakfast while you catch up with your YPN friends and make new connections. 

This month, we're breaking down business planning! The late summer and autumn season is a great time to begin auditing your current business plan and getting ready for next year. We've invited local leaders and experts to share strategies, best practices and good habits to build a business plan you will feel confident in. All such recordings are the sole property of the Association. Event Name: Brunch & Bond: Chicago
Description: Join Brunch & Bond, a monthly event series organized by Social Tea, a vibrant social networking community for women with the vision to win together. Brunch & Bond aims to bring women together in a warm and inclusive atmosphere, fostering new connections and friendships.At Brunch & Bond, you'll have the opportunity to meet and mingle with like-minded women in your city. Each event takes place on a monthly basis at various locations across multiple cities simultaneously. Please note that there won't be a Social Tea representative present at the event. Once you have confirmed and booked your spot, you will receive detailed information about what to expect.Please be aware that attendees will be responsible for purchasing their own brunch at the chosen venue. Enjoy the delectable culinary offerings and indulge in delightful conversations as you connect with fellow attendees. The brunch experience will provide a perfect backdrop for creating lasting memories and forming meaningful connections.Social Tea is dedicated to empowering women and fostering a supportive community where women can thrive together. Through Brunch & Bond, we aim to create an environment where strangers become friends, providing an opportunity for personal growth, inspiration, and networking.Secure your spot for Brunch & Bond in your city today and be a part of this unique experience. Take the first step towards building new friendships and connections, all while enjoying a delicious brunch in the company of inspiring women.

Event Name: God's Burning Ones Corporate Prayer Gathering
Description: Kisha L Cephus is an ordained prophet and serves in a local church located in Chicago, IL. Prophetess Kisha is the author of the book “Pray That Through – A Manual on Intercession” – This book is the byproduct of many years of being trained in secret as an intercessor and successfully building and maintaining a thriving corporate prayer environment in the local church. In the first meeting, she will "Cast Vision" – We must understand the “Why” of the meeting as a corporate body. God has commanded her to teach, train, and activate the saints in the power of prayer and fasting; with the ability to heal the soul of man through prophetic counsel and deliverance. She believes God is moving worship and prayer back into the forefront of His Church once again, because prayer is the lifeline of the church. She believes as a Christian, we must create an appetite for prayer within our homes and in our churches. For we all know that prayer can become a dry form of ministry unless it is watered and tended in the hearts of the God’s people. This will ensure effectiveness and potency throughout the year. Every important area and activity of our life and ministry must be covered by focused prayer and we will continue to develop healthy prayer strategies that covers your life; your call, your vision; soul issues, ministry; leadership; congregational needs, community needs, and the nations & the world.Once Jesus was in a certain place praying. As he finished, one of his disciples came to him and said, “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.” Luke 11:1PRAYER CAN BE TAUGHThe Plan of Action for the Corporate Prayer Meetingo Teach 30 Minutes o Demonstration Through Prayer & Intercession (10 Minutes) o Transition to Activation (5 Minutes) o Activation – 2 by 2; Wheel within a Wheel; and a Fire Line (20 Minutes) o Transition to Personal Ministry (5 Minutes) o Personal Ministry – Prayer, Prophetic Utterances and Deliverance (20-30 Minutes) o Invitation to Accept Jesus Christ as Lord, Communion and Savior & Dismiss (5-10 Minutes)ALL ARE WELCOME - SAVED AND THE UNSAVEDMEN AND WOMEN BOYS AND GIRLSCHILDREN ARE ALLOWED~NEW LOCATION~*FREE PARKING AVAILABLE**FREE PARKING AVAILABLE**FREE PARKING AVAILABLE**FREE PARKING AVAILABLE*

Event Name: MSP Advanced Practitioner 2 Days Training in Louisville, KY
Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate																		 Language: EnglishDuration: 2  Days																															   			  Credits: 16Course Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual/ OnsiteCourse Description:The Managing Successful Programmes (MSP®) Advanced Practitioner Course provides an opportunity to learn how MSP can be applied to large programmes, in complex and changing environments, with full accountability of the achievement of the required outcomes. The course also prepares participants for the MSP Advanced Practitioner examination.This level is aiming to confirm that a candidate has sufficient understanding of the MSP guidance, combined with actual programme management experience to act as a programme manager, any other member of a programme management team, or head of a programme office. The candidate will also learn how MSP can be tailored to suit any programme environment.The course is entirely focused at applying MSP in complex programme scenarios. Exercises will be based on the candidates own programme management experience, and on the case study used in the Advanced Practitioner Exam. This scenario will need to be studied in advance of the first day of the course.Course Outline:●	MSP Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	 Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Target Audience:●	Experienced Programme Managers, used to operating in a transformational change environment.●	The Head of the Programme Office.●	Business Change Managers.●	Other specialist/governance roles involved in ensuring high quality programme management based on best practices is in place, based on the MSP guidance.Learning Objectives:●	Tailor the MSP methodology to make it suitable for any environment.●	Flexibly react to changes in the programme environment, resolve major programme level	  Apply each of the MSP principles, governance themes and the transformational flow activities within a large complex programme and changing environment.●	Explain the relationship between the MSP principles, governance themes, the transformational flow, programme information (documents) and the MSP defined programme management roles; and can apply that understanding.●	Produce or evaluate MSP programme information (documents).   ●	Pass the Advanced Practitioner exam.Course Agenda:Day 1●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.Day 2●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Note:However, catering to the demands of busy professionals, our virtual training programs are as effective as face-to-face learning. Reach us at info@academyforpros.com for dates and details of Instructor Led Live Virtual Sessions. If you would like to get this course customized and delivered exclusively for your group, we have an On-Site Training Option you can reach us at info@academyforpros.com for more details about on-site or corporate training.Offers:Groups of 3 people 10% DiscountGroups of 5 people 15% DiscountGroups of 10 people 20% Discount

Event Name: Phoenix Days In The Park
Description: Days in the Park (DIP) happens in each city within the Township at various parks. The aim is to get out into the community and greet residents with food and fun while also educating them about the services Thornton Township provides at no additional charge. The mission is to provide a healthy, self-empowering environment with prevention, education, intervention, and entertainment programs. Days in the Park intends to create and maintain a vibrant community that is pleasant and self-sustaining. For more information, please call 708-596-6040 Ext. 2007.

Event Name: Hot Potato Hearts Ethically Non-Monogamous Speed Dating
Description: Hello to all my single spuds!!! Come connect to the ethically non-monogamous community and find some ENM cuties to kiss!Hot Potato Hearts is a platform created to help people build meaningful connections in a low-pressure, casual safe space. Our goal is to create a welcoming, fun, inclusive, and relaxed environment for cultivating relationships—whether romantic or platonic. Participants will talk to everyone at the event whether they have the same sexual orientation or not, so you can get a date or make some new friends! Follow @hotpotatoheartshotpotato on Instagram for updates.$10.006:30 pm check-in7:00 pm start*﻿***********Please note a camera crew will be filming b roll footage for a news segment at this event *Proof of vaccination is required to participate and masks are strongly encouraged. **Refunds are available up to 12 hours before the event. Tickets may also be transferred to a later date up to 12 hours before the event. ***Photos & video will be taken at the event for the promotion of future events, if you are uncomfortable with this just let me know the night of & I will exclude you from all content. ****If we are on a patio and it begins to rain, speed dating will be moved inside. If there is not enough room for speed dating inside, there will be a singles mixer instead of formal speed dating.

It also creates a less crowded environment which is more relaxing and fun.  These arrival time slots also allows helps us avoid everyone arriving at once and standing in line. You’ll likely spend 1-3 hours at the event or how ever long you want. And don't miss our fashion show which starts at 8:00pm. About Bridal Expo Chicago: We have been the number one luxury bridal show and expo for more than 28 years! Attend our show and experience everything new and trending in weddings. Shop in style, find amazing discounts/deals from participating wedding professionals.Free Parking. Free Swag Bag. Tickets normally $25 at the door. How to Order & RSVP:1. Get up to 4 Tickets at No Charge to attend the event. Save $100 instantly.2. Arrive at least 10 minutes prior to your show time if possible. 3. Check your Junk or Spam Folder for Ticket Confirmation. 4. Please show a copy of your ticket order at the door for entry at the time specified. If you are running late, we will still allow you to enter the show whenever you arrive.

Event Name: Bottomless Mimosas on the Riverwalk - Every Saturday at Island Party Hut
Description: Picture it...you're surrounded by your closest friends, sipping deliciously sweet mimosas, watching the boats go by. The sun is shining, and there's a nice cool breeze. Your favorite song comes on. Welcome to Mimosa Fest on the Riverwalk!Time to drink ALL the mimosas as we enjoy the chill vibes of Island Party Hut  located on the scenic Chicago Riverwalk! Plus don't forget there will be 4 mimosa varieties to choose from!ABOUT ISLAND PARTY HUT: Island Party Hut provides a lively tiki-style environment that will give you that relaxed "by the beach" feeling. Learn more and get your party set up today by emailing Birthdays@MimosasOnTheRiverwalk.com.FREE TICKETS/RAISE MONEY FOR YOUR CAUSE: See below for more info.H﻿OW TO CHECK IN AT THE EVENT: Please look for our staff person in the big gazebo near the entrance. E-mail us at Vendors@MimosasOnTheRiverwalk.com now to find out how to offer tastings at any of our upcoming experiences!FREE STUFF: Your tickets also include over $200 in Freebies* including: $10 of FREE Bitcoin from Coinbase, $10 in FREE food from Ritual and more! Click HERE for more info. *All offers valid for first time users only and subject to change without notice.REASONS TO BUY EARLY: In addition to getting tickets at a lower price, those who purchase early will also receive free tickets and/or deeply discounted tickets to future events.P﻿ICS FROM LAST TIME: Check out some pictures from last time by clicking here.PHOTO CONTEST: Enter to win by tagging us on Instagram or Facebook (@RiverNorthFests)! Our panel of judges will go through the pictures and winners will be contacted afterward! Prizes include tickets to tasting festivals, cocktail cruises on Lake Michigan and more!PLEASE NOTE: This is an outdoor experience. In the event of inclement weather, Island Party Hut management will decide if the experience goes on as planned or is cancelled. If they choose to cancel the experience due to inclement weather, all guests will be notified via email and will receive refunds. If the experience takes place as planned any guest that chooses not to attend will not receive a refund.  SPONSORSHIP OPPORTUNITIES: For questions, sponsorship opportunities, and press inquiries, please email Sponsors@MimosasOnTheRiverwalk.com.FREE TICKETS/RAISE MONEY FOR YOUR CAUSE:Fundraising Opportunity: Are you trying to raise money for a certain cause? Email Fundraising@MimosasOnTheRiverwalk.com for more info!Want to earn a free ticket and some cash for spreading the word? Email Ambassadors@MimosasOnTheRiverwalk.com for more info!CAN'T FIND YOUR TICKET? Click here.WORK WITH US: Interested in meeting new people while having fun running the best events in Chicago? Email EventStaff@MimosasOnTheRiverwalk.com.Rules, Regulations & Disclaimers: Brands subject to change and while supplies last.  Tickets include tastings.  All guests must be 21+ with a valid government issued ID that will be checked by security prior to entrance. Enjoy responsibly. The venue reserves the right to curtail service to anyone if intoxicated. Please be aware that this experience will comply with the Illinois Liquor Control Act 235 ILCS 5/6-16(a) A valid ticket with scannable QR code is required by all guests to enter the experience. It is recommended to print a paper ticket to prevent any technology complications which would prevent your ticket from displaying on your phone. There is no guest list. Each ticket must be scanned. Security reserves the right to inspect all bags and persons. Absolutely no outside food or beverage may be brought into the experience. Guests who are deemed intoxicated (or otherwise unfit), will be denied entry and no refunds will be given. We want all guests to enjoy themselves, but our number one priority is the safety of all guests. Any ticketing/technical issues will be handled by Eventbrite.com. Please contact them directly at https://www.eventbrite.com/contact-us/. Sorry – no refunds or price adjustments. The Eventbrite system does not allow us to restrict people who are underage from buying tickets. If you are not 21 and purchase a ticket, you will not be allowed into the experience.  For further Terms and Conditions of this experience and ticket purchase please see “Ticket Purchase and Event Terms and Conditions” in checkout before purchasing these tickets; which shall also be binding and shall be incorporated by reference as though fully stated herein.

Event Name: Seek and Paint for Safe Water
Location: Jefferson Dr & 12th St SW, Washington, DC 20004
Description:
Water Insecurity Correction Coalition (WICC) invites you to join us on Saturday, August 12th, for a scavenger hunt around the National Mall and painting in the park! The scavenger hunt is perfect for those looking to get to know Washington, DC better and natives searching for hidden gems around the city. Afterwards, finish up and cool off at our Paint in the Park booth! What’s more, by attending our event you will also be helping us ensure clean water access for all. 


Water Insecurity Correction Coalition directly aids and advocates for water-insecure communities across the United States through fundraising development, grassroots activism, policy advocacy, youth empowerment, and meaningful education to ensure that every citizen has equitable access to clean water. WICC is a nonprofit organization with roots across the United States that has helped raise thousands of dollars for water projects across the United States, held educational and community events to raise awareness of America’s water insecurity crisis, and has meaningfully encouraged community involvement and social leadership in young people. 


The scavenger hunt will start at 11am and meet at the Smithsonian Metro, 12th St at Jefferson Dr. SW entrance . It will take approximately 90 minutes to complete and will end at the paint in the park booth on the mall. The paint in the park will begin at 12 and will be open tentatively until 2:30pm. This event costs $6 and all proceeds go to our cause!

Find out more about our organization and the work we do at our website yeswicc.com

Event Name: Your Path to Tech
Description: A FREE, Exciting, and Inspiring Event at George Mason University!Join us for an extraordinary event, "Your Path to Tech," organized by Break Through Tech DC in collaboration with the GMU College of Engineering and Computing. This event is specifically designed for students who are passionate about technology, aiming to empower women (trans and cis) and nonbinary students at Mason.Registration Eligibility:Open to interested undergraduate freshmen and transfer students who are new to George Mason, regardless of their major or minor. Whether you have already chosen a field of study or are still exploring, this event welcomes you.Undecided and undeclared undergraduate students returning to George Mason who identify as women (trans and cis) and nonbinary.No prior experience in tech is required.During this enriching event, you will:Connect with Like-minded Peers: Engage with a community of women and nonbinary students who are embarking on their tech journey at Mason, fostering an environment of collaboration and support.Gain Insights from Inspiring Speakers: Be inspired by our keynote speaker, Dr. Missy Cummings, as she shares her expertise and experiences. Additionally, learn about the exciting tech curricula available at Mason.Engage with Industry Professionals: Participate in two engaging panels featuring experienced women professionals and alumnae from the tech industry. Gain valuable insights, advice, and perspectives that can shape your own path.Hands-on Workshops: Immerse yourself in a dynamic hands-on workshop tailored to your specific field of interest, whether it's computer science/applied computer science or information sciences and technology.Connect with Mentors: Conclude the day by getting paired with a dedicated current student mentor who can provide invaluable guidance and support as you embark on your tech journey at Mason.Space is limited, so don't miss out on this incredible opportunity! Learn more about Break Through Tech and GMU CEC:https://dc.breakthroughtech.org/programs/your-path-to-tech-mason/https://cec.gmu.edu/strengths/women-computing

Event Name: Essential Coaching Skills for Managers 1 Day Training in Washington, D.C
Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate																	 Language: EnglishDuration: 1-Day																																	  Credits: 8 PDUsCourse Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual/ On-Site	Course Description:This coaching skills for managers will help develop the coaching skills of supervisors, team leaders and managers and ensure you deliver a successful coaching skills training course.How to train managers to coach their teams to successWhen the pressure is on to meet targets and managers are rushed off their feet, coaching is usually the first task to get dropped. Yet coaching is essential to building successful teams.Coaching can even be seen as fluffy and unnecessary by ‘old school’ managers. Even if your management team understands the importance of nurturing the best out of their team, coaching can often be done in an unstructured and ineffective manner.Well not anymore. The benefits you will gain from our training are tremendous. They will be more able to:●	Improve the individual skill levels of their team members.●	Ensure everyone in their team is operating at equally high standards.●	Understand individual strengths and weaknesses, to help shape team dynamics.●	Get to know individual work styles, to more easily gain consensus for common goals.●	Structure coaching efforts for maximum effect.●	Support their team members in their learning, enabling them to develop the skills, knowledge and attitude necessary to successfully deliver their job responsibilities and goals.In other words, you’ll be able to get the most out of your managers, so they can get the most out of their teams. And that means better employee engagement and improved productivity – desirable in any organisation.Course Outline:●	What is Coaching? – A review of what coaching is and the key skills required of a good coach.●	My Experience – A look at the participants own experience of having been ‘coached’ in the past. Examining their feelings and the positive and negative aspects.●	Mine Field – A fun activity that allows participants to practice the skills of a coach and review the learning points.●	Coaching Principles – Understanding the core principles that underline an effective approach to coaching for a manager.●	The Manager as Coach – A look at the role of the manager and how coaching fits into this.●	The Fundamental Skills of Coaching – Underlining the managers role as coach by introducing the fundamental skills required and how this applies to them.●	The Coaching Environment – Examining the environment in which positive coaching can take place. One where staff feel challenged and supported enough to achieve positive results.●	A Procedure for Coaching Success – Providing participants with a set structure to create a results driven environment in which coaching plays an integral part.●	The Coaching Conversation – Explaining the GROW model and specific questions based around this in order to enable participants to carry out effective coaching conversations. There is also a chance to put the skills into practice.●	Questioning – Looking at different questioning methods, the advantages of each and asking participants to provide examples.●	Whose Agenda? – Encouraging the participants to help the coachee explore issues by encouraging rather than telling. A chance to practice their questioning in a safe environment.●	Active Listening – Understanding what active listening is and how to ensuring they use it.●	Coaching Opportunities – Identifying what coaching opportunities there are in the workplace and then applying the skills from the course to a coaching practice session.●	Review of Session – Creating an action plan to embed learning.Learning Objectives:At the end of this course, you will be able to:●	Define what coaching is and explain its role in the workplace●	Explain the managers role in the coaching process●	Know when they have created a positive coaching environment●	Follow a specific procedure for coaching success●	Use the GROW model to provide successful coaching conversations●	Use coaching communication skills to good effect●	Identify coaching opportunities and appreciate which style to use.Who can Attend?Anybody who is interested in acquiring the coaching skills.

Event Name: Pinot on the Potomac
Description: We can’t wait to welcome you to our annual wine, picnic & garden party.Our 9th Annual Pinot on the Potomac gala and garden party will be held Saturday, September 23 - to celebrate National Public Lands Day. We look forward to sharing an unforgettable day of wine, nature, and camaraderie as we raise our glasses to our transformative environmental education programs and the preservation of our beautiful public lands.In partnership with the Maryland Wineries Association, this year's Pinot on the Potomac will feature wine tastings from the prestigious Maryland wine trails, live music, a silent auction and so much more.Guests have the option to pre-order personal charcuterie boxes or purchase them on the day of the event from Sweet & Savory Boards by Jo. Traditional and vegan options are available.This year's Pinot on the Potomac will be held rain or shine, no refunds. This event welcomes individuals ages 21 and older only. Pets are not permitted. Please feel free to bring your picnic blankets or folding chairs to relax around our Historic Farmhouse garden and grounds. For nearly 70 years, the Alice Ferguson Foundation been championing hands-on science education and the environment. Your support helps science and nature come alive for thousands of local children as they discover the great outdoors very first time. These one-of-a-kind experiences allow students to learn about the natural world around them and their place in it.For more information about the event or sponsorship opportunities, please contact specialevents@fergusonfoundation.org.Event P﻿artnersM﻿aryland Wineries AssociationAtlantic Seaboard Wine AssociationvS﻿weet & Savory Boards by JoB﻿eez Knees Ice CreamC﻿harles County Youth OrchestraEvent SponsorsAmerican Engineered Solutions, Inc.APG MediaCommunity Bank of the ChesapeakeEagle Hill ConsultingGlobal Advisor GroupMarkon SolutionsMGM National HarborMoody GrahamRodgers ConsultingScheibel ConstructionSMADCSMECOWashington GasWesBancoHonorary CommitteeCongressman Jamie Raskin, Representing Maryland’s 8th Congressional DistrictD﻿elegate Kris Valderrama, Representing Prince Geroge's County, District 26Commissioner Amanda Stewart, Representing Charles County District 3Vice-Chair Wala Blegay, Representing Prince George’s County Council, District 6

Together, let's elevate our success in the captivating world of real estate!

Event Name: ESA at 50 Awards Reception
Description: Join us in the Library of Congress's Montpelier Room for this free event celebrating 50 years of the Endangered Species Act.  Enjoy networking and music from 6:00 - 6:30 and an awards reception at 6:30 celebrating legislators, individuals, tribes, and organizations across the country working to protect endangered species.  Hors d'oeuvres, dessert, and open bar are included with your free ticket.  Advance tickets are required.

Event Name: Inner Circles:  Connection Experiences with Evolving Minds
Description: Nonprofit work, especially after the pandemic, can be difficult and time-consuming for employees, and  many young nonprofit employees have experienced or are experiencing symptoms of burn out. How can we help ourselves and our organizations create spaces that allow us to slow down, build community, and be human? Now more than ever with constant phone use, hybrid work environments, impersonal virtual gatherings, and a perpetually anxious society, connecting with others is essential.Join YNPNdc as we partner with Anthony Sartori of Evolving Minds, who will guide participants through an immersive one-hour training to build connection and community. We will experientially practice resilience skills such as gratitude and mindfulness to build trust and empathy. We will also engage in small and large group discussions to share key learnings. You will walk away with a practical and impactful team-building technique as well as a deeper understanding of the importance of social connection in the workplace. A﻿bout the presenterIn March 2020, Anthony launched Evolving Minds, a mental health nonprofit with a mission to create a culture of care. Anthony has developed innovative mental health at work programs that center community, connection and culture-building, for nonprofit professionals, educators, social impact organizations and retail workers. Anthony has trained over one thousand program graduates, and his programs have demonstrated compelling impact – including an over 30% reduction in symptoms of depression, anxiety and stress, a 50% reduction in absenteeism (employee call outs) and an 89% increase in empathy. He currently is a professional speaker with Active Minds, one of the country's leading mental health nonprofits. He sits on the Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Accessibility Committee and Board of Directors for Inward Bound Mindfulness Education (iBme), a nationally renowned mindfulness nonprofit. He also served as Director of Mindfulness for Vitalize Care, a Y Combinator-backed start-up, where he designed one of the largest healthcare-specific mindfulness learning curricula in the digital mental health space.He is a graduate of Tara Brach and Jack Kornfield’s two-year Mindfulness Meditation Teacher Certification Program, and holds a B.A. in Psychology from the University of Maryland.

Event Name: ASL Open Mic | Columbia | 2nd Fridays | hosted by Marcus J Smith
Description: Come join us for our Open Mic! For two hours, audiences can expect a diverse chorus of voices and a vast array of professional spoken word performers, open mic rookies, and musicians. Expect to be moved, expect a packed house, expect the unexpected, but above all come with an open mind and ear.                                                   $﻿5.00 + Tax and fees online. $8.00 (tax and fees included)  at the door ! ASL (American Sign Language) OPEN MIC PRESENTS:On this night, American sign language users and viewers from all corners of life will come together to recite a poem, song, short skit or jokes. Come out and enjoy the wonderful environment while you eat, get your drink on and socialize. Great for those learning American sign language.H﻿osted by: Marcus J SmithMarcus J Smith is a Baltimore native. He is Hard of hearing, but Marcus defies the odds and goes after his goals and dreams. He aims to encourage all people to do the same. The Gallaudet Alum and new host of Busboys&poet storms Columbia ASL open mic with high energy and compassion to connect the community and build a place for the deaf community to feel seen, heard, and loved!

Event Name: Managing Successful Programmes - MSP Advanced Practitioner 2 Days Training
Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate	  														   Credits: 16 PDUsDuration: 2-Day			 																														Language: EnglishCourse Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual/ On-site	Course Description:The Managing Successful Programmes (MSP®) Advanced Practitioner Course provides an opportunity to learn how MSP can be applied to large programmes, in complex and changing environments, with full accountability of the achievement of the required outcomes. The course also prepares participants for the MSP Advanced Practitioner examination.This level is aiming to confirm that a candidate has sufficient understanding of the MSP guidance, combined with actual programme management experience to act as a programme manager, any other member of a programme management team, or head of a programme office. The candidate will also learn how MSP can be tailored to suit any programme environment.The course is entirely focused at applying MSP in complex programme scenarios. Exercises will be based on the candidates own programme management experience, and on the case study used in the Advanced Practitioner Exam. This scenario will need to be studied in advance of the first day of the course.Course Outline:●	MSP Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	 Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Target Audience:●	Experienced Programme Managers, used to operating in a transformational change environment.●	The Head of the Programme Office.●	Business Change Managers.●	Other specialist/governance roles involved in ensuring high quality programme management based on best practices is in place, based on the MSP guidance.Learning Objectives:●	Tailor the MSP methodology to make it suitable for any environment.●	Flexibly react to changes in the programme environment, resolve major programme level	  Apply each of the MSP principles, governance themes and the transformational flow activities within a large complex programme and changing environment.●	Explain the relationship between the MSP principles, governance themes, the transformational flow, programme information (documents) and the MSP defined programme management roles; and can apply that understanding.●	Produce or evaluate MSP programme information (documents).   ●	Pass the Advanced Practitioner exam.Course Agenda:Day 1●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.Day 2●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Note:However, catering to the demands of busy professionals, our virtual training programs are as effective as face-to-face learning. Reach us at info@mangates.com for dates and details of Instructor Led Live Virtual Sessions. If you would like to get this course customized and delivered exclusively for your group, we have an On-Site Training Option, you can reach us at info@mangates.com for more details about on-site or corporate training.Offers:Groups of 3 people 10% DiscountGroups of 5 people 15% DiscountGroups of 10 people 20% Discount

Event Name: 7th Annual Quinn Cook Basketball Camp Session 2
Description: We are excited to host the 7th Annual Quinn Cook Basketball Camp in Springfield, VA. All players ages 5 to 17 will have the opportunity to improve their skills! Our camp is not your ordinary camp. Yes, we focus on drills, fundamentals, shooting, ball-handling, court etiquette and vision, etc. However, our goal is to develop student-athletes. We emphasize four key components:LeadershipSportsmanshipNutrition/healthy eatingIndividual, one-on-one skill assessment and evaluationWe offer a family environment that will motivate each athlete to get better and enhance his/her game to his or her highest potential. Your son or daughter will have the opportunity to learn from current and/or former players from all levels and learn to be great individuals on and off the court!The camp is for boys and girls of all skill levels. Campers are divided into separate age groups to ensure they receive the proper training. Our outstanding staff will teach the skills to bring each camper’s game to the next level. We concentrate on the fundamentals of the game and having fun in an encouraging environment!CAMP FEATURESOur staff is composed of Current & Past Collegiate, NBA, Overseas Leagues, Street-ball players and current coaches of all levels. Each coach is trained to teach campers the right way to play the game.Our philosophy is to "let them have fun" while learning the great game of basketball! Camp headliners & guests will teach your camper the same top level skills they were taught by their high school, college and NBA coaches!Players learn more than just basketball at camp. They are taught teamwork, consideration of others, self-discipline, and how to attain their potential in sports and in life. Players also learn the importance of achieving good grades and selecting correct role models. The camps may also feature guest speakers.Each player will receive a FREE Basketball Camp t-shirt.In addition to the expert training, each player will get autographs from Quinn and any guests at camp!Campers will also take a professional photo with Quinn.Safety is very important at camp! All staff members will go through a mandatory background check before being allowed to instruct at the camp.There will be an athletic trainer on duty at all times to attend to the campers needs. Team discount - Sign up with 8 or more of your teammates to save an additional $25 off of your camp fee!

Harmonic chords and binaural sounds will be played which promote balance and relaxation. We will practice under the colossal, 75-foot-tall Corinthian columns in the Great Hall of The National Building Museum, America’s leading cultural institution devoted to interpreting the history and impact of the built environment.  The NBM is located just four blocks from the National Mall, directly across the street from the Judiciary Square Metro (Red Line).All are welcome--the class is open to brand new and seasoned yogis alike! Event Name: Army Invite: Congressional Depot Breakfast
Description:
GEN Charles R. Hamilton, Commanding General, Army Material Command  (AMC) requests the pleasure of your company at the House Army Depot Caucus Breakfast from 8:30 a.m.-10 a.m. on Wednesday, July 19, 2023, in Rayburn 2168 (Gold Room). 
The Depot Caucus will host a discussion on the Army’s Organic Industrial Base (OIB) and the critical role it plays in ensuring Army readiness.  Today’s increasingly complex and unstable global environment reinforces more than ever, the importance of synchronizing and integrating our military’s capabilities and resources so that our Nation can rapidly respond to any threat.  
The Caucus, GEN Hamilton and other Senior Army Leaders representing the sustainment enterprise look forward to your thoughts, questions and candid discussions on the industrial base and readiness interests.
Please RSVP to MAJ Jeremy R. Pinson and Mr. Peter Rasmussen by July 17th 2023.
The Army looks forward to engaging with you at the Caucus breakfast on July 19th.
