Event Name: Conquer Your Fear of Public Speaking - DC - Virtual Free Trial Class
Description: Overcome public speaking fear with gradual exposure, in a supportive environment. Observe a free trial to see if it's right for you. Based out of New York City for 30 years, we are now offering these classes online to an international audience. This one free trial class is an observation session to see if the US$425/10 session program is right for you. The instructor will be happy to answer any questions following the session.****30 Years of Testimonials: https://www.speakeeezi.com/success.htmZenspeak Public Speaking Center: https://www.speakeeezi.comOnce the 10 session package is purchased, the student may use their sessions however they choose.  The course is ongoing, so each session has participants at all levels. We use a workbook which each student works through at their own pace.This is the 30th year we’ve been helping people turn their dread into confidence. Gradual exposure allows you to face fear in manageable steps, at your own pace, in a supportive environment. Instructors Charles di Cagno and Kyra Smith, are phobia therapists, and former and current Directors of Public Speaking at White Plains Hospital Anxiety Treatment Center in the United States. Whatever the level of public speaking, we can help you improve. For those with anxiety, we provide gradual exposure to public speaking through a step ladder of basic to more advanced exercises. For the more experienced, it's a platform tailored to your specific needs to improve various delivery techniques. It is self-paced, in a low pressure, supportive environment with lots of feedback to address your specific issues. Begin with basic exercises and move forward only when ready. The course is ongoing, with a mix of beginning and advanced students. Our hope is you are inspired, not intimidated by the dynamic speakers present, and keep in mind they started with the same fears, progressing to their present level by consistent effort. The course is not difficult. If you have the will, we offer the way to turn a liability into your most powerful asset. The real challenge is admitting you need guidance, getting started, and making a committed, consistent effort.Our 100% success rate over 20 years for wedding speeches is just one indication of our effectiveness. But, whatever the challenge, (formal presentation, group discussion, business meeting, sales, confrontation, employment interview) the program is customized to fit your needs.Sample Gradual Exposure Program Outline for Public Speaking Anxiety:Session One - Get comfortable hearing your voice in public by responding to very simple questions while seated. The questions (i.e., name, occupation, where you live, etc.) require little thought or content.Session Two - Learning to stand confidently before a group. You will stand, with several others and respond to simple questions. As your confidence increases, one by one, each person standing will sit, until you are standing alone. You will continue until this begins to feel comfortable.Session Three- This exercise is the same as the previous one except you start by standing alone.Session Four - Gestures and Movement. Enhance your message, decrease tension and project a confident demeanor incorporating non-verbal skills.Session Five - Implement the skills learned in the session four by relating a personal experience using gestures and movement to enhance your narrative.Session Six - Respond to Questions. Open the floor to questions on a topic of choice.Session Seven - Impromptu Speaking. Learn to organize and deliver an unprepared (no notes) talk.Session Eight - Prepared Speech (Instructor Guided). Learn the secret of outlining and presenting a prepared speech with minimal effort or stress.Session Nine - Prepared Speech. Outline and deliver a speech unassisted.Once you have mastered the above you can begin simulating all manner of interpersonal and public communication including:Persuasive SpeakingPanel DiscussionConflict ResolutionDefending your PositionDebatingInitiating and Sustaining ConversationAs well as many othersWe look forward to working with you.

Event Name: Immigrant Youth Tobacco Prevention and Cessation Program
Description:
The Immigrant Youth Tobacco Prevention and Cessation Program is designed to
address the issue of tobacco use among immigrant youth, who are at increased risk of smoking
and exposure to secondhand smoke. The program aims to provide education, resources, and
support to prevent tobacco use and promote quitting among immigrant youth, as well as raise
awareness about the harmful effects of secondhand smoke on children.The Immigrant Youth Tobacco Prevention and Cessation Program aims to reduce tobacco use
and exposure to secondhand smoke among immigrant youth by providing education, resources,
and support. By working with community partners and families, the program seeks to create a
smoke-free environment for immigrant youth and raise awareness about the harmful effects of
tobacco use and secondhand smoke on children.

Event Name: Strong Start Community Playgroups (Francis Gregory Library: 0-12 Mos.)
Description:
The Strong Start DC Early Intervention Program (DC EIP) Community Playgroups provide families with information about their child’s development, early childhood developmental screenings, early intervention process and community resources available to families across DC. The community playgroups are facilitated by early intervention professionals and provide a family-centered, child-interest driven environment for children to interact with their same-age peers, while families receive information about early intervention related topics.
 
Community playgroups are held on different days throughout each month depending on location. RSVP is requested monthly for each playgroup session. 
 
If you have questions or need help with the RSVP, please contact Christopher Chapman at (202) 741-0792 or email at Christopher.Chapman@dc.gov.

Event Name: UWIB DC: Shop & Socialize with UWIB DC
Description: J﻿oin the United Women In Business (UWIB) DC Chapter for a fun evening of shopping, socializing, and more!W﻿e are excited to partner with Morley for a fun exclusive evening of getting to know the UWIB DC ladies, check out this season's hottest styles, and enjoy champagne and light bites.W﻿e will also be raffling off FOUR Gift Cards ($25, $50, $75, and $100) during the event that you can use that night! This is a private and limited space event so you must register to attend.1﻿5% of all proceeds from sales will be donated back to United Women In Business.Date/Time: Thursday, August 3rd from 6:30 - 8:30PMLocation: To be announced - For the safety of our members, as well as to respect venue capacity guidelines, this Bethesda location will be disclosed to those who registered a few days prior to the event.S﻿pecial thank you to Morley for hosting us!A﻿bout Morley: Morley stores are the ultimate destination for high-end resort wear, unique styles, and on-trend accessories. Our shelves stay filled with your favorite designer picks, with everything from sundresses to work wear to date night styles. Created with the modern woman in mind, Morley stores offer complimentary personal stylists to help complete your wardrobe with fresh and beautiful pieces. Born out of Darien, CT, Morley now has 4 presences on the East Coast: Morley, Bethesda (MD); Morley, Delray (FL); Coco & Co. (FL); and Periwinkle (FL). Each of our stores attracts a dedicated following who love the selection of styles we offer from both new and known designers. With hand-selected pieces to reflect the aesthetic of each of our neighborhoods, there's something for everyone at a Morley store near you. We can't wait to have you come shop with us!About United Women in Business: The United Women in Business Foundation (UWIB) seeks to foster professional success through education among all women. Through educational programming, mentorship, and community service initiatives, our goal is to help members excel despite the challenges and inequalities that women face in today’s business environment. We support and connect women with different experience levels ranging from undergraduate and graduate students, to young professionals, female executives, and thought leaders.Getting Involved with United Women in Business: If you are interested in UWIB and would like to receive invites to future events, please fill out our FREE, 5-minute sign-up form here. Check out our UWIB website and stay connected with our team on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!COVID Guidelines:UWIB follows CDC and NYC COVID guidelines. *UWIB does not track or maintain records of vaccinations or other COVID-related metrics. All are welcome and are asked to socialize only in a manner in which they feel comfortable and follows NYC guidelines. UWIB will not be held liable for any illness contracted.By registering for a United Women in Business Foundation event, you are giving permission for UWIB to use any photos of you from this event for UWIB promotional purposes and for UWIB and UWIB's partners to contact you via email after this event.

Event Name: The Bones of J.R. Jones
Description: The Bones of J.R. JonesWEBSITE | FACEBOOK | INSTAGRAM | TWITTER  |  SPOTIFY  |  BANDCAMPOver the course of three full-length albums and two EPs, Jonathon Robert Linaberry has woven his own tapestry of American roots music. It's a classic sound for the modern world, influenced not only by blues, soul, and forward-thinking folk, but also by J.R.'s environment. From the bustle of New York City, where he launched The Bones of J.R. Jones with 2012's The Wildness, to the rustic solitude of his current home in the Catskills, J.R. has always looked to the world around him for inspiration. Few places have left him feeling as inspired as the American Southwest, an area whose desert panoramas and infinite horizons inspired the songs on his newest release, A Celebration. Written during trips to Tucson, Bisbee, Joshua Tree, and other desert destinations, the six-song EP is everything its title promises: a celebration of the thrill of getting lost in something new, whether it's a landscape, a sound, a perspective, or all of the above. "The record's essence was shaped by those beautiful desert nights and the roads that go on endlessly," says J.R. A Celebration's cover art — with its western color palette, desert iconography, and black-and-white photograph of wild animals — was handmade by J.R., who also created a series of accompanying prints. A Celebration does more than shine a light on the American southwest — it highlights J.R.'s ability to the bridge the gap between artistic disciplines.

Event Name: 2023-2024 Space of Her Own Mentor Information Sessions
Description: Alexandria's award-winning Space of Her Own (SOHO) program seeks creative, culturally diverse, adult female volunteers for the upcoming 2023-2024 school year. We hope you'll join us for an information session to learn more about how our program is structured, what our expectations are for mentors, the girls we serve, and how you can apply to become a mentor with Space of Her Own.SOHO seeks to create an environment in which girls feel free to express themselves, step outside of their comfort zone, and grow. By pairing mentors one-to-one with mentees we hope to create the foundation that can serve for a long-lasting bond and mentoring relationship. Mentors and mentees work together each week on an array of projects throughout the year designed to teach girls to value creativity using unique professionally-led arts and STEM instruction to create items that will be used to transform the sleeping space of each girl. At the end of the year, mentors work in pairs to use all the pieces that they've designed and built together with their mentees to give each girl a true Space of HER own.For more information, please visit www.spaceofherown.org. If you are unable to attend, but are still interested in mentoring with SOHO please contact Bessy Chavarria at bessy.chavarria@spaceofherown.org or Madeline Nance at madeline.nance@spaceofherown.org.

Event Name: Soul Salutations: Dirty Souf Sunset Yoga
Description: Soul Salutations Dirty Souf Sunset Yoga features soulful sounds from Dirty Souf while teaching holistic healing practices and how to integrate them into daily habits. This mind-strengthening yoga session will incorporate breathing exercises,  beginner-friendly yoga sequences, and intentionally paced movements to enhance your alignment, strength, and balance. We will relax within ourselves, focus on our breath, hydrate our internal landscape while enhancing our alignment, strength, and balance. Allow the vibes, environment and community help you reduce stress, hydrate your soul and pour good energy into the world. This class is for all levels including anyone new to yoga or interested in designing their own well-being practice. Still don't know if this is for you? Bring a blanket, relax in nature and vibe out to the playlist! Remember: enjoyment is your birthright. This class is part of a 10-week themed series that highlights the importance of body movement, breath, collective healing and the spirit of enjoyment. Check out the entire collection here. WHAT TO KNOW FOR THE BEST EXPERIENCE: LOCATION: The flow will be located in Anacostia Park across from Anacostia Recreation Center. Street Parking is available throughout the park.ENVIRONMENT: We will be outside and on grass! Picnic/Outdoor Blankets are best to flow on grass. You can also flow on a mat, but I suggest still having a blanket. Additional items for consideration: hat, sunglasses, sunscreen, bug spray, and any outdoor accessories that blesses your soul.OFFERING: This is a donation based flow. If you have  received some healthy hydration, consider donating here.CANCELLATION POLICY: Cancellations due to rain or inclement weather will be announced via @energy2radiance social media channels  90 minutes prior to start time. The flow will be added to tentative rain dates of 8/15 and 8/22.A﻿BOUT YOUR INSTRUCTOR: RADIANCE BASDENRadiance Basden is a trailblazing well-being consultant, coach, yoga instructor, NASM certified personal trainer and champion of human development. She enlightens others about the mental, spiritual, and physical benefits of internal wellness and body movement. Radiance is a Hall of Fame runner and wellness expert who has worked with brands including lululemon, Mental Health America, AMResorts, NCAA, Prudential, DC government, as well as local running clubs, gyms and schools. She is the Founder and Principal Consultant for Rooted in Radiance, a full service wellness enterprise HQ in Washington, DC. Rooted in Radiance provides programs covering well-being, fitness, and mental resilience including stress reduction programs, holistic health talks, training,  experiential wellness activations and multi-sensory guided experiences. Radiance is passionate about helping people strengthen their minds and bodies for maximum performance. After experiencing burnout, she sought to reconstruct what it means to invest in your well-being personally and professionally. Radiance uses her decades of experience in fitness and resilience to help others uncover their gifts and push beyond the status quo to create transformational change. Her mission includes creating channels to amplify underrepresented voices, service marginalized communities and champion DE&I, health, and well-being topics.CONNECT WITH  RADIANCE! Event Name: Evening Paddle Adventures
Description: Evenings are a wonderful time in the park to be on the water. This year we are offering a family oriented late-day paddle on the water that is sure to be a wonderful adventure for everyone involved. Alongside a paddle guide, you will paddle along Belmont Bay and enter a pristine marsh environment known as Kane's Creek. There you may encounter secretive wildlife such as beaver, turtles, fox, heron, and even our nation's symbol, the Bald Eagle! While these are family friendly adventures please note: Children 5 and under are NOT permitted in boats. Children 6-12 must be in a tandem kayak with a parent or legal guardian. Children 13-17 may paddle alone in a boat but must be supervised by a parent or legal guardian on the same tour.Please arrive 20 minutes before paddle start time to get fitted with PFDs and receive basic paddling instructions.  Clothing may get wet. Water and sunscreen are encouraged. Reservations are required. Cost of reservation is $20 per person and includes all paddle equipment and parking. Each ticket holds a reservation for one person. Reservations are not complete until payment is made to the park.Request for refunds can be made up to seven days before the event. Requests made less than seven days from the event can only be offered to reschedule to another paddle tour.

Event Name: Seduction 101
Location: 5563 West Manchester Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90045
Description: LADIES ONLYSeduction 101 was created to encourage women to tap into their sensuality. Why is this important? We are often our own worst critics. By providing a safe environment where women can objectively see how their bodies move allows for them to focus on improving body awareness which leads to improved confidence. Body awareness is the connection between one’s mind and body. Our bodies hold on to past memories which can be a hinderance to our self improvement, especially when it comes to physical  activity. Sedution 101 is here to pull out those emotions through sensual dancing. ——Class Order: Warm Up, isolation and movement, routine, cool down. Routines are short and can be used for at home practice. As the class progresses, you will learn beginner floor and chair routines.Attire: Come dressed in clothing you can move around in. Make sure you have knee pads for floor work. Heels are optional. * Class Packages Available *

Event Name: Sex & Magic: A Dimension of Living Passionately
Description: T﻿HE CURRENT SITUATIONGrowing up, we got the condoms talk from our parents, the reproductive organs talk from our high school health teachers, and we received sexual performance lessons from penis-centric movies and pornos.   And with our limited sexual knowledge, we show up in the bedroom trying to create sexual magic by mimicking the spiritually-lacking sex we see on pornos, only to be disappointed when we do not get magical results.  W﻿HAT IS A SEX & MAGIC NIGHT? Sex & Magic is a safe and sexy environment for open-minded adults to tap into their sensuality through breathing, sensual dancing, intimacy exercises that include sexual engagement of the five senses, sexual education around pleasure, and an open space to ask questions about things you don't feel comfortable asking your coworkers or parents. W﻿HAT SEX & MAGIC NIGHT IS NOT?For the gutter-minded people—who I love dearly, this is not an orgy ;). We will be doing work with the body, but we will not be touching any genital areas.  Nudity is not required, but it is also not unwelcome.  The body is a beautiful piece of art and nothing to be ashamed of.   If you would like to remove articles of clothing for certain exercises, I welcome it and you will be guided through that experience.  W﻿HO IS THIS EVENT FOR?S﻿ex & Magic is for open-minded people who want to have a fun sensual explorative experience with other open-minded people. It is for people who want to have a supportive community to help with sexual growth.  It for people who feel lost in their own sexual experience.  It is for people who want a safe place to let out their sensual side without judgment.  It is for people who desire safe connection and touch.  It is for people who more tools in their sexual toolbox.  It is for people who want to try something new.  Positive vibes, a desire to learn, a desire to be open, and non judgment is a must for this setting.  If you're seeking a moment of connection and would like to dive deeper into your sexual experience in a meaningful way, this might be the perfect event for you :) D﻿RESS CODE AND ENVIRONMENTS﻿ex & Magic is built on the premise that adventure and romance should be infused into every facet of life.  The environment is always beautiful and the dress code is "sensual and magical," and that is left up to the participant's interpretation.  The more fun you have with it the better, but always stay true to your own identity and comfort.  T﻿he event will be located in a private rental residence, and the exact location will be given a week before the event in the Los Angeles area.  In the spirit of not being wasteful with resources and making everything custom, I will make a final decision on the location once I have a firmer head count.  But the place will be beautiful and nicely curated.   B﻿OUNDARIEST﻿here are partner exercises and to accommodate singles, we switch partners throughout the workshop, but I send out a survey before the event to take inventory of what everyone is comfortable with.   Obviously, if you come as a couple, you are free to stay with your partner the entire time.  Nobody is required to do anything they don't want to do and because sensual energy can be so intense, there will be a designated solo area for people who might just need a moment to themselves.  Boundaries are of the utmost importance in these types of environments and we will extensively cover how to approach one another during this sensual experience.  A﻿lcohol can be your best friend or your worst enemy.  A lot of events of this nature ban alcohol because it lowers people's ability to read social cues, which is imperative in this space.  However,  for some people, having a drink or two puts them at ease in new situations so their nerves don't infringe on their ability to enjoy the experience.   If you engage in alcohol or weed, and I see it affecting your behavior, you will be asked to leave.  I would recommend coming with a clear channel, but for most adults a glass of wine or two is fine.  T﻿HE HOST WITH THE MOST J﻿asmine C. (Leyva) Perry, the host, is a veteran in the holistic space and she has done a lot of work raising awareness in the food justice space.  She is currently working on her masters in Tantra/sexology.   Her interest in the subject came because she started to experience profound confusion around her entire sexual experience, which deeply impacted her thirteen-year relationship.  Jasmine saw tons of sex scenes in movies as a teenager, but she did not have the same orgasmic experience.  She thought her vagina was broken, and she spent her next two decades dedicating her sexual experience to pleasing men instead of learning her body.  Through her tantra studies, she became more sexually liberated by learning her body, facing her sexual traumas, incorporating more intimacy into her pleasure experience and now she would like to share her exploration with others.  W﻿HAT TO BRING -﻿Please take an at-home COVID test 24 hours before the event and email or text your results to me before you arrive.  Since there is a lot of contact in this workshop, I would like for everyone to feel safe.  -R﻿efreshments and plant-based snacks will be provided.  If you would like to bring your own water bottle, that would be fine.  -﻿Since you will be working with partners hygiene is a must.  Please make sure you are squeaky clean, you have catered to your breath, and refrain from wearing any strong perfume.  -﻿Please refrain from smoking during the experience because that smell tends to linger in clothes and we don't want to upset anyone's sensitivities.  P﻿RIVATE SESSIONS WITH JASMINE I﻿f you would like a more personal experience, please send an email expressing your needs and I'll create something beautiful for you and your party.  Experiences with strangers is not for everyone and I am willing to curate private experiences for interested parties. Disclaimer: I am not a sex worker and I never want to feel used for sex, I only want to be empowered by it.  Any such offers will result in a ban from all future events so please respect me and yourself by not asking for those services.  L﻿IABILITY WAIVER AND PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT B﻿y reading all of the below statements and purchasing a ticket, I confirm and accept all terms and conditions. -﻿I declare that I am Covid-19 free, I do not have any symptoms, and I will submit proof of my health upon entering the space. -﻿The host will due everything possible to ensure my safety but no guarantee is 100%, so I accept full responsibility for my health.  On the off-chance that I contract Covid, the flu, or any other health condition outside of the host's control.	I will not take legal action against the host for anything health-related illness.  -﻿I am aware that this event contains intimate touching, massages, possible nudity for interested parties, and breathing exercises, and while I am not required to do anything, I am 100% okay with being in this type of environment. -﻿The host will do her best to create a safe space, but she cannot 100% guarantee that someone will not say something or do something that might trigger you.   I understand that the host cannot always control people's actions, and I will not hold her responsible for anyone's poor behavior or inappropriate comments.-﻿If I feel uncomfortable, I will let the host know. -﻿I will not interrupt anyone or speak while others are speaking.  I will not disrupt any part of the workshop. -﻿During the entire workshop, I will have my full faculties, I will be aware of social cues, and I will not present as high or drunk.  -﻿If I use any of massage oils provided, I am using them at my own risk and I will not hold the host responsible for any allergies.  -﻿If I consume any snacks or drinks, I am eating at my own risk and I will not hold the host responsible for any allergies. -﻿I will not copy or plagiarize this workshop in its entirety and sell it to others.  -﻿I will not photograph, videotape or post any photos of people in the workshop without permission.  R﻿EVIEWS ON SEX & MAGIC FROM FORMER CLIENTS "In seriousness, I loved how everyone was so willing to be open and vulnerable. It quickly defined itself as a safe space and lived up to the billing""﻿The environment was a joy to release & relax into. I loved the exercises and ease into the space as a group. The personalized feel of grouping people together. ""﻿I felt so comfortable I could have been in my underwear the entire time!""﻿Overall, I had a wonderful time. Keep going. We need more spaces like this to come together to expand and connect. Thank you Jasmine."C﻿ONTACT INFOEmail: TheLeyvaCompany@gmail.com Social Media: @﻿theinvisiblevegan on IGP﻿HOTO CREDIT @﻿Michaelblankphotography on IG S﻿NAKE DISCLAIMERT﻿he ball python snake featured in the photo is Drogon, and for those who might be terrified of snakes,  he will not be present for the workshop :)  I would also like to note that I purchased snakes before I was aware of the atrocities of the exotic pet trade.  I would encourage anyone who thinks this animal is beautiful, to look up ways to help their plight.

Event Name: L.A. Times Food Bowl: Gold Award 2023
Location: 955 South Vermont Avenue #G, Los Angeles, CA 90006
Description: L.A. Times Food Bowl 2023: Gold Award celebrationL.A. Times Food Bowl, presented by City National Bank, is excited to celebrate the winner of the Los Angeles Times 2023 Gold Award, Park's BBQ and chef Jenee Kim. Since opening in 2003, Park’s BBQ has been the premiere place to experience Korean BBQ for out-of-towners and Angelenos alike, helping to make the cuisine an essential part of the L.A. culinary landscape. Times food critic Bill Addison recently named Park’s one of the 101 Best Restaurants in L.A., saying its convivial atmosphere means, “a meal goes by in an exhilarating blur of fellowship and meat.” Selected by the L.A. Times Food editorial team, this year’s Gold Award winner, Park’s BBQ, exemplifies L.A. cuisine and culinary excellence. Join us at the restaurant for a ceremony and dinner celebrating this prestigious award created by and named after legendary Times food critic Jonathan Gold.The event, presented by L.A. Times Food general manager Laurie Ochoa and Park’s chef/owner Jenee Kim, will feature a limited edition, specially curated menu of passed appetizers and drinks as well as a family-style Korean BBQ dinner highlighting Park’s most iconic dishes. Dinner tickets include a selection of exceptional appetizers specially crafted for this event, as well as a multi-course dinner, dessert, and choice of beer or soju.A﻿BOUT THE GOLD AWARDThe L.A. Times Gold Award was established in 2017 by legendary Times food critic Jonathan Gold. Gold wrote at the time: “ The Gold Award was created with the idea of honoring culinary excellence and expanding the notion of what Southern California cooking might be. The award celebrates intelligence and innovation, brilliance and sensitivity to aesthetics, culture and the environment." If you are not an active L.A. Times subscriber, your ticket includes a 6-month digital subscription to the Los Angeles Times. You will receive an email after the event to activate your subscription.Notes: We are unable to accommodate substitutions, vegetarian/vegan options and allergy modifications.

Location: 617 West 7th Street Suite 1200, Los Angeles, CA 90017
Description: Please join us for a mindful MATERIALS Pop-up event in LA on August 16th. We'll be talking about the power of collaboration to scale our individual work to reduce the embodied impacts of the built environment; the evolution of mindful MATERIALS as a movement and an organization; and creating opportunities for connections between attendees. Speakers: TBDL﻿ocation: Perkins&Will LAAgenda:5:00 - 6:00pm:  Meet the exhibitors 6:00 - 7:00pm: Presentations and guided networking 7:00 - 8:00pm: Happy hourAbout these pop-up events:Our goal at mM is to connect ideas; to connect mindful materials with mindful practitioners; and connect the dots between intent and action when it comes to materials. Event Name: Open Mic Comedy At Lyric Hyperion
Description: Open Mic Comedy Night At Lyric HyperionM﻿ondays, 9pm-11pm5 Mins. 2﻿0 Spots. Lotto Style.  Every Monday night at 9 pm, join us for a fantastic evening of laughter, entertainment, and camaraderie at the open mic night hosted by the talented trio of Uriah Wesman, Liz Zagone, and Claire O'Neal. This open mic offers a unique opportunity to witness up-and-coming comedians showcasing their skills without the hefty ticket price. For just $5, you can secure yourself 5 minutes on stage, with a cap of 20 comedians per night. If you're not looking to perform, feel free to come and watch the show for free!Our open mic nights are known for their fun, supportive atmosphere, and great energy. The hosts, Uriah, Liz, and Claire, have fostered an environment where comedians can feel comfortable trying out new material, honing their skills, and connecting with fellow performers. Whether you're a seasoned comic or an amateur looking to dip your toes into the world of stand-up, this is the perfect place to experience the thrill of live comedy in a welcoming and encouraging setting.While we celebrate the freedom of expression that comes with an open mic, it's crucial to maintain a respectful and inclusive space for all attendees. We do not condone or tolerate hateful, racist, or misogynistic behavior during our events. Our goal is to create a safe, enjoyable environment where everyone can appreciate the art of comedy and share their unique perspectives. So, join us every Monday night for an unforgettable evening filled with laughter, excitement, and some of the best up-and-coming comedic talent around!

Event Name: Social Anxiety Los Angeles - Free Trial Virtual Group Session
Description: Based out of New York City for 30 years, we are now offering these classes online to a national and international audience.We target interpersonal and small group interaction with gradual reduction of anxiety in manageable steps, resulting in more skill and confidence in all areas of life. We hope your visit is interesting, informative and motivating. This free trial class is an observation session to see if the program is right for you. The instructor will be happy to answer any questions following the session.There is no charge for this initial session with no obligation to enroll.  Should you wish to continue, enrollment in the 10 session program is US$299.Instructors Charles di Cagno and Kyra Smith, former Phobia Therapists at the White Plains Hospital Phobia Clinic, employ the clinic's unique approach to vastly expanding your zone of comfort.

Event Name: Intuitive Dance Meditation
Description: PURPOSE: An integration of Yoga and Dance mindfulness and movement practices to embody freedom and reconnect to our intuition. A place to build community and connect to the Earth.WHO SHOULD JOIN: Those who are interested in building community and connection to the Earth through dance, yoga, and mindfulness practices. What's in our wallet should not be what's stopping us from taking care of ourselves and connecting with humans who are like minded with open hearts. This class will be free to provide accessible classes to those who are truly seeking a practice. AND all in-person classes will be held at local parks within the Northeast LA area. Please feel free to share with your loved ones. I thank you in advance for sharing space and building community with me!WHAT WE WILL DO: We will meet at Hermon Park near Highland Park-Los Angeles. (Park location may shift in future events) Intuitive Dance Meditation class will be taught for 1.5 hours and those who are interested in building community can stay to connect with other attendees. Bring water, a yoga mat (or blanket), comfortable clothes, snacks or a light meal to picnic after with the community. ABOUT THE CLASS: Intuitive Dance Meditation uses the art form of dance as the primary medium of discovering self-awareness and mindfulness. Dancing through seven primary areas of mindfulness in motion: breath, sound, body, story, mind, spirit, and fusion (of all elements), with a respect to the attitudes of mindfulness, participants tap into their body’s own healing resources and realize that we all have a unique creativity just waiting to be cultivated. C﻿lass will be led by Tasheena Medina. Learn more about her below.B﻿IO: Tasheena Medina moved to Los Angeles in 2011 from the sunny state of Arizona to attend AMDA Performing Arts College. Since graduating with her BFA in Dance Theatre, she has choreographed for numerous projects on the stage and the screen including Nickelodeon's AwesomenessTV, and Assistant Choreographer to Nicole Berger on FOX TV's Brooklyn Nine-Nine, and NBC’s Parks and Rec. As the resident choreographer of Coeurage Ensemble, she choreographed Mary Zimmerman’s, Secret In The Wings, and the West Coast Premiere of The Sparrow, for which she was nominated for an LA Stage Alliance Ovation award. Her most current choreography is with Coeurage Ensembles 2022 production of RENT. When she’s not doing dance related work, she is often educating others through the practice of Yoga, Intuitive Dance Meditation, and Social Emotional Learning (SEL). Tasheena is currently deepening her studies as a graduate student of the Master of Arts in Yoga Therapy Program at Loyola Marymount University. As an educator, entrepreneur, and speaker Tasheena strives to help humans at all levels to be authentic, learn essential techniques, inspire and ensure a safe environment with a holistic and mindful approach.Learn more about her at www.tasheenamedina.comSocial Media: @tasheenamedina

Event Name: The Women's Empowerment Expo 2023
Description: THE WOMEN’S EMPOWERMENT EXPO | LOS ANGELES, CAThe Women's Empowerment Expo is a one-day Women's Conference happening  in Los Angeles, California at Succulent Sudios on Saturday,  August 26, 2023 from 12-5PM.Our guest speakers have a backround in Leadership, Media, Television, PR, Entertainment, Psychology and business.The expo will feature 75+ female-owned businesses exhibitors, Networking opportunities,  brand activations, wellness stations,  panels, personal/business development workshops, performances, motivational speakers, red carpet photo-ops, networking, and an opportunity to take advantage of connecting with womens' groups, organziations, and free resources offered in the community. Honoring Women Who Make a DifferenceAt each event we organize, our primary focus is to offer practical solutions for women who are confronting various challenges. In line with this commitment, as part of the top 100 Women of Influence initiative, we are proud to announce that we will be making a direct donation to both human trafficking survivors in the audience and through  our organization providing paid employment  opportunities to help these survivors rebuild their lives. We firmly believe in taking tangible actions to empower and uplift those who have experienced adversity, and we are grateful for the opportunity to contribute to their journey of healing and resilience.PROMOTING ECONOMIC EMPOWERMENT We provide a female marketplace for female entrepreneurs to showcase their products and services. We aim to help address the gender bias that often exists in traditional marketplaces where women face discrimination and unequal treatment.DIVERSITY & INCLUSIONOur marketplace promotes diversity and inclusion by providing a space for women from different backgrounds and cultures to come together and share their experiences and ideas. We aim to create a more vibrant and inclusive business community overall.Providing a female marketplace creates opportunities for women to become financially independent and self-sufficient. This can lead to increased economic growth and stability for both women and their communities.Through The Women’s Empowerment Expo we encourage more women to become entrepreneurs by providing a supportive environment and access to resources and networks that can help them succeed.We are now accepting Vendor Applications  for female entrerprenneurs looking to gain leads, sell products, promote their business, lead wellness activities,  or just make new connections. Apply here to register to become a vendorSpeaking Opportunities are through sponsorship starting at a minimum of $500.00 to inquire about speaking email theweexpo@gmail.com and add "Sponsor The WEEXPO"In-kind sponsorship opportunities available*https://www.thewexpo.com/vendor-registrationThis event supports The WE Network, our 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that promotes physical and mental wellness by spreading awareness, providing resources, advocating for women, and uniting leaders in different industries to provide education, tools, and support.Website thewexpo.com Instagram @theweexpo

Event Name: Non-monogamy and Polyamory Speed Dating / Speed Friending Los Angeles
Location: 800 South La Brea Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90036
Description: Looking for more ethically non-monogamous and polyamorous friends, dates & other connections? Or just want to do more fun things in LA? Bloom Community is running ENM speed friending / speed dating where you'll have the opportunity to make new friends and join the LA polyamory community!The craving for human connection has been really strong in recent years and we wanted to create a hub for you all to spark that initial connection. All genders, sexualities, gender expressions, ENM styles, etc. are encouraged to attend in our version of Los Angeles speed dating!! We welcome LGBTQ+, trans and non-binary, queer, BIPOC, kinky, and polyamorous folks of all kinds. What is ENM?Ethical Non-Monogamy (ENM) is the practice of having multiple sexual or romantic partners with the consent of all parties involved. Relationship dynamics are different for everybody, & we want to create a space to learn more & get to know other people who are exploring it too.T﻿icketing DetailsThis event requests a contribution of $15-25 to compensate the organizer for their time and support of Bloom. We recommend most people pay $20. Paying $25+ allows us to make more affordable ticketing available to others who need it. A﻿bout Bloom CommunityBloom Community is a social and community-building app that facilitates in-person spaces for connection. In Bloom’s app, you can discover new events, become Buds with people, and join community conversations. Bloom is a great place to meet people around events, especially for queer, ENM, and sex-positive folks. You can RSVP for this event, join the group chat, and connect with people beforehand https://bl.ooo/m/enmla-july?us=eb&uc=des . (P.S. If you don’t want to download the app right now, you can also just enter your phone number to receive SMS reminders from the host)A﻿bout Your HostElisa has been part of the Bloom community since 2021 and started hosting Bloom events in 2022. She's passionate about bringing ENM and Poly folks together in fun and inclusive environments. Elisa loves meeting as many people as she can at her events so make sure to say hi to her if she doesn't find you first! Elisa hosts a podcast with her husband about their polyamorous relationship called Poly+Amor=Us (listen on Spotify or Apple Podcasts). She was also featured on TLC’s newest show Seeking Brother Husband!

Event Name: Conquer Your Fear of Public Speaking-Pasadena-Virtual Free Trial Class
Description: Overcome public speaking fear with gradual exposure, in a supportive environment. Observe a free trial to see if it's right for you. Based out of New York City for 30 years, we are now offering these classes online to an international audience. This one free trial class is an observation session to see if the US$425/10 session program is right for you. The instructor will be happy to answer any questions following the session.****30 Years of Testimonials: https://www.speakeeezi.com/success.htmZenspeak Public Speaking Center: https://www.speakeeezi.comOnce the 10 session package is purchased, the student may use their sessions however they choose.  The course is ongoing, so each session has participants at all levels. We use a workbook which each student works through at their own pace.This is the 30th year we’ve been helping people turn their dread into confidence. Gradual exposure allows you to face fear in manageable steps, at your own pace, in a supportive environment. Instructors Charles di Cagno and Kyra Smith, are phobia therapists, and former and current Directors of Public Speaking at White Plains Hospital Anxiety Treatment Center in the United States. Whatever the level of public speaking, we can help you improve. For those with anxiety, we provide gradual exposure to public speaking through a step ladder of basic to more advanced exercises. For the more experienced, it's a platform tailored to your specific needs to improve various delivery techniques. It is self-paced, in a low pressure, supportive environment with lots of feedback to address your specific issues. Begin with basic exercises and move forward only when ready. The course is ongoing, with a mix of beginning and advanced students. Our hope is you are inspired, not intimidated by the dynamic speakers present, and keep in mind they started with the same fears, progressing to their present level by consistent effort. The course is not difficult. If you have the will, we offer the way to turn a liability into your most powerful asset. The real challenge is admitting you need guidance, getting started, and making a committed, consistent effort.Our 100% success rate over 20 years for wedding speeches is just one indication of our effectiveness. But, whatever the challenge, (formal presentation, group discussion, business meeting, sales, confrontation, employment interview) the program is customized to fit your needs.Sample Gradual Exposure Program Outline for Public Speaking Anxiety:Session One - Get comfortable hearing your voice in public by responding to very simple questions while seated. The questions (i.e., name, occupation, where you live, etc.) require little thought or content.Session Two - Learning to stand confidently before a group. You will stand, with several others and respond to simple questions. As your confidence increases, one by one, each person standing will sit, until you are standing alone. You will continue until this begins to feel comfortable.Session Three- This exercise is the same as the previous one except you start by standing alone.Session Four - Gestures and Movement. Enhance your message, decrease tension and project a confident demeanor incorporating non-verbal skills.Session Five - Implement the skills learned in the session four by relating a personal experience using gestures and movement to enhance your narrative.Session Six - Respond to Questions. Open the floor to questions on a topic of choice.Session Seven - Impromptu Speaking. Learn to organize and deliver an unprepared (no notes) talk.Session Eight - Prepared Speech (Instructor Guided). Learn the secret of outlining and presenting a prepared speech with minimal effort or stress.Session Nine - Prepared Speech. Outline and deliver a speech unassisted.Once you have mastered the above you can begin simulating all manner of interpersonal and public communication including:Persuasive SpeakingPanel DiscussionConflict ResolutionDefending your PositionDebatingInitiating and Sustaining ConversationAs well as many othersWe look forward to working with you.

Event Name: Conquer Your Fear of Public Speaking -Los Angeles- Virtual Free Trial Class
Description: Overcome public speaking fear with gradual exposure, in a supportive environment. Observe a free trial to see if it's right for you. Based out of New York City for 30 years, we are now offering these classes online to an international audience. This one free trial class is an observation session to see if the US$425/10 session program is right for you. The instructor will be happy to answer any questions following the session.****30 Years of Testimonials: https://www.speakeeezi.com/success.htmZenspeak Public Speaking Center: https://www.speakeeezi.comOnce the 10 session package is purchased, the student may use their sessions however they choose.  The course is ongoing, so each session has participants at all levels. We use a workbook which each student works through at their own pace.This is the 30th year we’ve been helping people turn their dread into confidence. Gradual exposure allows you to face fear in manageable steps, at your own pace, in a supportive environment. Instructors Charles di Cagno and Kyra Smith, are phobia therapists, and former and current Directors of Public Speaking at White Plains Hospital Anxiety Treatment Center in the United States. Whatever the level of public speaking, we can help you improve. For those with anxiety, we provide gradual exposure to public speaking through a step ladder of basic to more advanced exercises. For the more experienced, it's a platform tailored to your specific needs to improve various delivery techniques. It is self-paced, in a low pressure, supportive environment with lots of feedback to address your specific issues. Begin with basic exercises and move forward only when ready. The course is ongoing, with a mix of beginning and advanced students. Our hope is you are inspired, not intimidated by the dynamic speakers present, and keep in mind they started with the same fears, progressing to their present level by consistent effort. The course is not difficult. If you have the will, we offer the way to turn a liability into your most powerful asset. The real challenge is admitting you need guidance, getting started, and making a committed, consistent effort.Our 100% success rate over 20 years for wedding speeches is just one indication of our effectiveness. But, whatever the challenge, (formal presentation, group discussion, business meeting, sales, confrontation, employment interview) the program is customized to fit your needs.Sample Gradual Exposure Program Outline for Public Speaking Anxiety:Session One - Get comfortable hearing your voice in public by responding to very simple questions while seated. The questions (i.e., name, occupation, where you live, etc.) require little thought or content.Session Two - Learning to stand confidently before a group. You will stand, with several others and respond to simple questions. As your confidence increases, one by one, each person standing will sit, until you are standing alone. You will continue until this begins to feel comfortable.Session Three- This exercise is the same as the previous one except you start by standing alone.Session Four - Gestures and Movement. Enhance your message, decrease tension and project a confident demeanor incorporating non-verbal skills.Session Five - Implement the skills learned in the session four by relating a personal experience using gestures and movement to enhance your narrative.Session Six - Respond to Questions. Open the floor to questions on a topic of choice.Session Seven - Impromptu Speaking. Learn to organize and deliver an unprepared (no notes) talk.Session Eight - Prepared Speech (Instructor Guided). Learn the secret of outlining and presenting a prepared speech with minimal effort or stress.Session Nine - Prepared Speech. Outline and deliver a speech unassisted.Once you have mastered the above you can begin simulating all manner of interpersonal and public communication including:Persuasive SpeakingPanel DiscussionConflict ResolutionDefending your PositionDebatingInitiating and Sustaining ConversationAs well as many othersWe look forward to working with you.

Event Name: MSP Advanced Practitioner 2 Days Training in Los Angeles, CA
Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate																		 Language: EnglishDuration: 2  Days																															   			  Credits: 16Course Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual/ OnsiteCourse Description:The Managing Successful Programmes (MSP®) Advanced Practitioner Course provides an opportunity to learn how MSP can be applied to large programmes, in complex and changing environments, with full accountability of the achievement of the required outcomes. The course also prepares participants for the MSP Advanced Practitioner examination.This level is aiming to confirm that a candidate has sufficient understanding of the MSP guidance, combined with actual programme management experience to act as a programme manager, any other member of a programme management team, or head of a programme office. The candidate will also learn how MSP can be tailored to suit any programme environment.The course is entirely focused at applying MSP in complex programme scenarios. Exercises will be based on the candidates own programme management experience, and on the case study used in the Advanced Practitioner Exam. This scenario will need to be studied in advance of the first day of the course.Course Outline:●	MSP Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	 Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Target Audience:●	Experienced Programme Managers, used to operating in a transformational change environment.●	The Head of the Programme Office.●	Business Change Managers.●	Other specialist/governance roles involved in ensuring high quality programme management based on best practices is in place, based on the MSP guidance.Learning Objectives:●	Tailor the MSP methodology to make it suitable for any environment.●	Flexibly react to changes in the programme environment, resolve major programme level	  Apply each of the MSP principles, governance themes and the transformational flow activities within a large complex programme and changing environment.●	Explain the relationship between the MSP principles, governance themes, the transformational flow, programme information (documents) and the MSP defined programme management roles; and can apply that understanding.●	Produce or evaluate MSP programme information (documents).   ●	Pass the Advanced Practitioner exam.Course Agenda:Day 1●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.Day 2●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Note:However, catering to the demands of busy professionals, our virtual training programs are as effective as face-to-face learning. Reach us at info@academyforpros.com for dates and details of Instructor Led Live Virtual Sessions. If you would like to get this course customized and delivered exclusively for your group, we have an On-Site Training Option you can reach us at info@academyforpros.com for more details about on-site or corporate training.Offers:Groups of 3 people 10% DiscountGroups of 5 people 15% DiscountGroups of 10 people 20% Discount

Event Name: Queer Here Cinema
Description:
We screen Queer-Positive Films with main characters and/or creators who identify as LGBTQIA+ from all genres, from around the world. Come for a Film Festival experience, in a casual environment.
Queer Here Cinema takes place at 10 & 10 ½ DTLA. 10 ½ is a 3,000 sq ft theatrical venue with a twenty-five by twelve-foot stage featuring a floor-to-ceiling video wall that your film will be screened on, lighting rig, and state-of-the-art sound system. Creators can appreciate the private backstage Green Room with viewing access to the films.

Event Name: Yacht Jazz/R&B Evening  - All White Attire
Location: 13755 Fiji Way, Marina Del Rey, CA 90292
Description: We decided to take our Jazz/R&B Evening to the sea for our founder's birthday celebration! Come experience some true upscale vibes with us aboard a beautiful yacht in Marina Del Ray! We will begin boarding the yacht at 4PM and we will be departing at 5PM sharp, there are no acceptations or refunds! Arrive early to allow yourself time to park and board!Attire: All White Upscale Attire (Don't mess this up)Parking: There is a lot for parking right next to where we will board the yacht, an image with directions has been attached below.If you love R&B vibes, upscale environments, live music, amazing views, dope people, tasty food and top tier drinks, this is an experience curated specifically for you. EARLY ARRIVAL IS STRONGLY SUGGESTED! UPSCALE DRESS CODE IS STRICTLY ENFORCED, SO COME DRESSED TO IMPRESS!There will be live music, Uno, Spades, signature drinks, a taco bar and vibes will be curated by yours truly! It's the perfect event for a special date night out!If you've never experienced The Outlet LA vibes, you're most definitely in for a treat! Come dressed to impress and bring your whole crew because you never know who you might rub elbows with at our events! Check us out on Instagram to follow and see previous events: @TheOutletLA *By attending The Outlet LA events, you are subject to your photos and videos being taken and used for our promotional purposes and branding.*No Refunds for any events, tickets purchased in advance have guaranteed admission. There will be no tickets sold at the door for this event. *This event is 21+, no kids!Event Guidelines :Guest Comfort and Safety:No one acting for you and none of your guests can bring animals, alcoholic beverages, explosives, firearms, or articles of a dangerous or damaging nature aboard the yacht. If anyone in your group brings any of the above items, you will be solely responsible for any damage that results, and we may need to confiscate the items. If there is any misconduct, possession or use of these forbidden items, or if there is illegal gambling by your guests, the Event Manager or Captain can choose to immediately end the event, and you will still be responsible for all fees for the event. We can at anytime refuse to allow any guest or other person to remain at the eventMarijuana, Drug and Alcohol Policy :The use and/or possession of illegal drugs or controlled substances is absolutely prohibited by City Cruises by Hornblower and the US Coast Guard. City Cruises by Hornblower holds a zero tolerance policy related to illegal substances aboard all vessels and anyone who is caught participating with or in possession of any such items will NOT be allowed to board and substances will be confiscated. No alcohol, open containers or outside food permitted. No illegal drugs, or controlled substances, including prescription drugs and marijuana are allowed on board any vessel or City Cruises property. Per Federal law, the use of marijuana products on the premises is illegal, regardless of a medical condition(s). Zero Tolerance:1. Any alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs found prior to departure will be confiscated.2. Any alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs found on board while cruising will result in a call to the Harbor Police and immediate termination of your event without refund.3. Any underage drinking while cruising will result in a call to the Harbor Police and immediate termination of your event without refund.4. All IDs will be checked prior to boarding and wrist bands will be used for age identification at the bar.

Event Name: Fast Friends - It's like Speed Dating, But for Friendships
Description: We know meeting new people outside of work is tough, so we're hosting an event to make it a little easier.At the event, you'll meet 7-10 other LA folks over a glass of wine (or multiple glasses), meeting with each potential pal for 7 minutes. HOW IT WORKSBuy your ticket and answer the questions prompted at checkout (this will help us match you with new potential friends)Check in with your hosts at 7:30 PM 7:45 PM - 9:15 PM the friend pairing rounds will occur BENEFITTING CHARITY100% of profits generated from this event will be donated to the Friendship Foundation.The Friendship Foundation supports parents and families who have children and young adults with special needs by providing a safe, accepting and inclusive environment where they can enjoy sports, art, music and many other social programs with their peers. It is their belief that every person is precious and capable of love, connection and friendship.ABOUT THE VENUEWe're partnering with our friends at the Los Angeles Athletic Club to host this event. Back when Los Angeles was just a dusty town of about 11,000 folks getting around via horse, a few of its top movers and shakers met in a law office and made some plans. They wanted recreation, socialization, and invigoration.  So, they formed LA’s first private club: The Los Angeles Athletic Club. The club's core purpose is to create positive experiences through camaraderie, personal improvement, and healthful recreations.A﻿ll things we love.We'll be hosting our event inside the Los Angeles Athletic Club's Invention Dining area - one of the oldest bars in Los Angeles. The pre-prohibition bar program uses fresh ingredients and high-quality spirits for all of its cocktails- the perfect combo to friend zone people on a Tuesday afternoon.

Event Name: BLAXICANA FEST:  LA FASHION WEEK 2023

Event Name: Instrumental Educators Workshop 2023 (ETM-LA & ASTA Sponsored)
Description: Education Through Music-Los Angeles in Partnership with American String Teachers Association present anInstrumental (Strings & Band) Educators WorkshopThursday, August 10, 2023  |  9:00AM-12:00PM PTIn-Person. In-Person will follow health, masking, and social distancing requirements.EARLY BIRD PRICING (ended)Regular Registration Fee: $50 Regular Rate (In-Person) All participants receive a FREE Method Book  **Join us on August 10, 2023 for the INSTRUMENTAL (STRINGS & BAND) EDUCATORS WORKSHOP led by DR. DAVID POPE (Chair, Professional Studies Department & Associate Professor of Music Education - Baldwin Wallace University; Distinguished Music Educator Award of the Yale Symposium for Music in Schools; Education clinician for Alfred Music and American String Teachers Association’s national conference chair.)EXPLORE:Creating Successful, Engaging, and Fun Beginning STRINGS & BAND EnsemblesBuilding Musicality in Your Beginner GroupsBeginning & Intermediate Strings & Band Techniques (Note: Strings & Band ensemble students will participate in order to create an in action "learning lab" environment)&﻿ MoreAll strings and band teachers welcome (at all levels).**Thanks to the generosity of Alfred Music, every participant will take home one of the following method books:Sound Innovations Book for 1 StringsSound Innovations Book for 1 BandSound DifferentiationSound OrchestraScholarships may be available to LACDAC grantees and college students currently enrolled in music and/or music education courses.  For more information about the scholarships & training, please contact admin@etmla.org.

Event Name: P-Valley (Poetry in the Valley)
Description: Looking for a new way to spend your Sunday afternoons? Come join us at Blaqhaus Noho for P-Valley, a celebration of poetry and spoken word that takes place every second and fourth Sunday of the month. This event is free (2 Item Minimum) and open to all who are interested in experiencing the power of language and creative expression. Plus, while you're here, enjoy some delicious southern food and drink!Whether you're a seasoned poet or just starting out, P-Valley is the perfect place to share your work and connect with other creatives in the community. Our welcoming and supportive environment is designed to encourage artistic growth and exploration, so don't be shy - step up to the mic and let your words be heard!Mark your calendar and plan to join us for an afternoon of inspiration, entertainment, community, and southern flavors at P-Valley. We can't wait to see you there!

Description: This event is an Augmented Reality Art Magic experience. Join us for an immersive art experience combining technology and artistry to create magical visual effects.

Event Name: LAFD FCAP @ VRTA - Drill Tower 81
Description: We STRONGLY encourage all LAFD candidates to take advantage of this FREE program.  ***Dress Code "Dark Blue" exercise shorts/pants, short sleeve t-shirt (no tank or crop tops), Dark athletic shoes, no loose or restrictive jewelry, bring a firm foam roller and water.One of the most significant challenges faced by LAFD firefighter recruits is developing the strength and fitness required to be successful in the LAFD Training Academy.  The Los Angeles Fire Department is offering the Firefighter Candidate Advancement Program (FCAP), a physical fitness and development program designed by firefighters for firefighters.  The focus is on developing both strength and metabolic conditioning in a similar training environment to that found in the LAFD's fire academy.   Your success as a firefighter for the LAFD depends heavily on the work you put in BEFORE you arrive at the Drill Tower.  If You Have Not Applied to The Los Angeles Fire Department AND/OR Taken the Written Exam You Are Not Allowed to Participate in FCAP.You must be 18 years or older.  Please call 213-893-9502 if you have any questions.THE FCAP PROGRAM IS NOT JUST A WORKOUTIntroduction to:- Tools and Equipment- Ladders and Hose Lays- Terminology- Culture of the LAFD - Enter the LAFD Fire Academy in the best shape of your life.- Learn what to expect at the academy both physically and mentally.- Get to know active LAFD officers and firefighters involved in the program.- Build a network with other firefighter candidates for support and encouragement.- Build confidence and physical fitness that will carry you through to a successful career	  with the LAFD. **If it is your first time to FCAP this year please copy and paste the link below and fill out the waiver to bring to your next session**https://drive.google.com/open?id=1CTyfNEFOokCHHyxhSC3Sd7ZtSEQcQer5

Event Name: BROWN SUGAR WEDNESDAY: MIDWEEK PARTY EXPERIENCE
Description: Searching for the ultimate midweek vibe? Look no further than Brown Sugar! Our weekly Wednesday night party is where it's happening, bringing you incredible music, positive vibes, and a warm, inclusive community that celebrates diverse cultures.Join our resident DJ Damage alongside a lineup of the nation's hottest DJs as they spin the very best of Nostalgic Hip Hop, R&B, Reggae & Afrobeat tunes that'll keep you grooving all night long. But that's just the beginning - we're all about creating an environment where everyone feels at home. Brown Sugar believes in uniting people through the power of music and dance, because that's what defines our vibrant culture.No exclusivity here, no velvet ropes. Just snag your ticket and come on over to create unforgettable memories. Whether you're looking to unwind or unleash your moves on the dance floor, our amazing community has got your back.Ready to connect with like-minded individuals who share a passion for phenomenal music and positive vibes? Brown Sugar is the ultimate destination. We can't wait to welcome you to our next epic event!Take a sneak peek at the recap video below to catch a glimpse of the electrifying atmosphere you can expect:

Event Name: Changing the Landscape: A Creative Conversation
Description: In a world where the sheer amount of issues at play can often overwhelm and sometimes paralyze action, how can we focus in, and practically cultivate habits and decision-making practices that allow us to be most impactful in our own environments? On August 19th at the Box in Culver City, MashUp Contemporary Dance Company invites you to  a one-of-a-kind, intimate performance experience merging live dance, projection, dialogue, and connection as we examine our ever-changing personal and collective landscapes, and what it means to both adapt to, and be a driver of change.General Admission: $25VIP Priority Seating (Includes front row seat, complimentary drink ticket, and 15% off merchandise): $40Changing the Landscape: A Creative Conversation is supported in part by the City of Culver City and it’s Cultural Affairs Commission, with support from Sony Pictures Entertainment and the Culver City Arts Foundation.

Event Name: Writing, managing and evaluating successful funding bids
Location: The Burroughs, London, NW4 4BT, United Kingdom
Description: Applying for research funding presents a number of challenges that significantly impact academic career plans and development. Competition, limited resources and the pressure to meet funding requirements may create a highly selective environment, making it increasingly difficult for academics to secure promotions and establish networks.  In response to these challenges, our workshop will explore the current funding landscape, and provide guidance from experienced academics who have successfully secured external funding. We also aim to build an interdisciplinary network within the academic community for future collaborations.  We will invite PhD students, early-career, mid-career and experienced researchers, funding bodies, communities and organisations interested in advancing research and knowledge exchange. This workshop is supported by the Higher Education Innovation Fund (HEIF), Middlesex University. For more information contact: Dr. Rui Su, Senior Lecturer in Tourism, r.su@mdx.ac.uk; Dr. Chong Yu, Lecturer in Marketing, c.yu@mdx.ac.uk

Event Name: African Housing Show 2023
Location: Engineers Way The Drum, The Civic Centre, Wembley Stadium, Wembley Park, HA9, United Kingdom
Description: Sustainable Trade Financing for AfricaPromoting Environmental Awareness and InnovationEXHIBITION CONFERENCE & THE AFRICAN PROPERTY AWARDSTrading Green is an event platform created by Property Express Group with the purpose of engaging with businesses, governments, influential individuals, and green activists to raise awareness about the impact of environmental businesses on Africa's water, air, and soil. Our goal is to examine the positive and negative effects that people and industries have on natural resources in Africa and the world, and to find innovative technological solutions to mitigate these effects.Africa's natural resources, often referred to as the world's last line, are rapidly deteriorating due to careless human and business activities. Extensive analysis, samples, experiments, and measurements have demonstrated the need for change and the development of plans to reduce pollution, minimize climate impact, and ensure the provision of healthy resources for our people and the land.At Trading Green, we firmly believe that data and results from environmental studies play a crucial role in identifying and addressing various issues that can harm the environment. These issues include excessive hazardous waste, overcrowded landfills, and drastic climate change. Such ecological problems can directly impact the health and safety of people, animals, and the land itself. Through thorough soil, water, and air experiments, we gather valuable information that helps conservation engineers develop new systems to reduce or eliminate harmful contaminants that may cause illness or death.Our platform aims to utilize the insights gained from these studies to assist scientists, city planners, state and local legislators, and other engineers in designing environmentally safe procedures for construction and expansion projects. By doing so, we hope to facilitate the creation and provision of equipment and supplies for manufacturing through the collaboration of innovative technology planners. Moreover, we aim to support governments, business owners, developers, and city planners in implementing laws and regulations that protect natural resources.In collaboration with the African Property Awards and African Property Magazine, Trading Green will host its inaugural event to facilitate dialogue on the impact of businesses, governments, and all stakeholders on our ecosystem. The primary objective of this event is to explore innovative technological approaches to address these environmental challenges.With the theme "Quality Housing," our event will feature the UK Environmental Minister, Thérèse Coffey, as the guest speaker. Her distinguished presence will shed light on the pressing environmental issues facing Africa today. Experts, business owners, policymakers, heads of governments, and representatives from African Governments in the UK, African Union, and African global entities will be invited to attend this significant event.The event is scheduled to take place on Saturday, November 4th at the Brent Civic Center, The Drum, Wembley Stadium, Engineers Way, London HA9 0LF.For stakeholders interested in participating, attending the event, becoming a speaker, or exploring sponsorship opportunities, please contact us at re@africahousingshow.org.Email: re@africahousingshow.orgPhone: +44 7404714332Website: www.africahousingshow.org

Event Name: MLSAR Open Studio | DOOR TO DOOR: Szelit Cheung and Olga Grotova
Location: Clapham Common, London, SW4, United Kingdom
Description: Co-presented by THE SHOPHOUSE and Schoeni Projects, “DOOR TO DOOR” Artist Residency hosts in Hong Kong and London in the summer of 2023, with participating artists Szelit Cheung and Olga Grotova.From 18 July onwards, the OPEN STUDIO of “DOOR TO DOOR” will occur at MLS Artist Residency (MLSAR), London.The OPEN STUDIO aims to delve into the artists' creative processes while displacing them from their accustomed creative environments. An interactive experience blurs the intimate relationship between artists, audience and gallery.A﻿bout DOOR TO DOORA door and a work of art, are two things that may seem unrelated, but both function as an entrance - to a building or the mind of an artist.“DOOR TO DOOR” is a tripartite conversation between artists, audience, and space. The residency programme is developed as a cultural exchange programme between artists based in Hong Kong and the UK and aims to encourage artistic exchange and knowledge production. OPEN STUDIO Each artist occupies a studio space for four weeks across Hong Kong and London, where they will research their project visions and create unique works in response to their surroundings. EXHIBITION The exhibition aims to facilitate active observations and meaningful dialogue within the community. It takes place after the OPEN STUDIO, acting as a celebration and showcase of the on-site works created by the artists.

Description: Have you always wanted to get better at public speaking? Event Name: UK-Nigeria Health-Tech Fest
Location: Broad Sanctuary, London, SW1P 3EE, United Kingdom
Description: The ease that comes with technology is a needed feature in health delivery and the growth of digital health is driven by a combination of behavioral and regulatory factors.Healthcare delivery is being transformed by the integration of cutting-edge technologies such as AI, blockchain, telemedicine, wearables, biotech, and others. These innovations aim to enhance health coverage and delivery, furthering the progress toward universal health access.The UK-Nigeria HealthTech Fest seeks to harmonize major stakeholders in the health sector in Nigeria and the UK to shape the future of health technology in the access and provision of high-quality healthcare services to achieve universal health coverage.The summit will embrace in-person and virtual dialogue on “LEADING THE FRONTIERS OF HEALTHCARE TRANSFORMATION WITH TECHNOLOGY”UK-Nigeria Health-Tech Fest will offer top-level engagement with industry experts across Nigeria and the UK health industry subsections via a strategic conference, exhibitions, and networking in a business-enabling environment.

Doors open at 5:00 PM (BST), featuring DJs from around the world curating AfroBeats, Amapiano, Soca and Dancehall music to electrify the room.AfroSoca, a celebration of a deeply rooted culture that unites Africa and the Caribbean through Rhythm, Bass and Dance. We provide a fully stocked bar and wide variety of food options from a local menu to keep you energised throughout the night.The dress code is simple: explore your fashionable trends. Event Name: Hacknakey - Life Drawing with Naked Live Music
Location: 130 Kingsland High Street, London, E8 2LQ, United Kingdom
Description: Ello ello ello!W﻿elcome to our life drawing event ;DWe host a unique evening of life drawing with live music performed by guest musicians local to East London. Every event we host showcases a new performer and we are continually in awe at the incredible talent we’re able to share with you.The first half of the evening will be tutored, with a series of short poses, getting you out of your comfort zone, with playful exercises designed to get you thinking and seeing differently. We then take a short break where we recommend you get a drink from the bar - Kraft brew much of their drinks in house and we highly recommend you have a try!The second half of the evening will feature live music from a guest musician who will be performing their solo work, naked. It's a wonderfully relaxing and supportive environment, where you’ll be transported to a place you won’t want to leave from. What could be more tranquil than being serenaded whilst sketching away?Hacknakey is a safe space that promotes body positivity and celebrates all creative abilities. Absolute beginners and more advanced people welcome. This is a great place to meet new people… come alone or brings some pals!A few words from our community:“ Hacknakey host this awesome and incredible life drawing class where I literally almost cried while drawing I felt so happy and grateful.”“I’ve modelled in over 100 locations inside London alone. This is the most recommended group so far in London, especially if you are a beginner and want to have a fun time. Their tickets sell out quickly. I was wondering why before modelling, but now I know.”“I had the best evening last night, thank you so so much. Sam and I have only been dating for a short time and this was my night to pick date night and we just had the most incredible night. THANK YOU! Can’t wait to do it again.”Some housekeeping:- We provide paper, charcoal, and other surprise art supplies but if you wish to bring your own sketchbooks and materials please do!- We are LGBTQ+ friendly and discrimination in any form will not be tolerated at our event.Thank you and we’re really looking forward to seeing you there!Emily x

Event Name: Business networking at Hay Hill Private Members Club
Location: 12 Hay Hill, London, W1J 8NR, United Kingdom
Description: London Connector helps you meet the right people at the right place (business leaders, corporate professionals, entrepreneurs, investors, professionals).Our unique venue is:Set in a stunning six-story building at Berkeley Square, Hay Hill is unique as it combines the luxury of a private members club with the business focus of a co-working environment, pioneering the concept of the club working, all in the heart of Mayfair.For our event, we have reserved an area of the venue with a cash bar, so that we can mix and mingle and meet old and new friends, new contacts, and, why not, new clients too!ProgramThe format of the evening is 'mix and mingle', meet like-minded business leaders and entrepreneurs and investors in a relaxed environment. Our team is onsite to facilitate meaningful introductions. We connect at a human-to-human level, and prefer building relationships.How many people are attending?We have a maximum capacity of 80 guests for this venue and given the popularity of our events and the nature of the venue that hosts us, this one is predicted to be sold out in advance also because on average for each event we run 30-40 places are booked by our members who have joined the yearly membership. Early booking is truly and highly recommended. Last time we run an event at this venue we had a larger capacity and we sold out 5 days before the event date.The reason the events we organize are so successful is that we follow a very simple, but effective formula. One week before the event we create a WhatsApp group with those attendees who wish to start getting to know each other. This allows each participant to set up meetings with those they wish to meet during (or even before) the event. On the day of the event, you will find a relaxed environment, and a welcoming and supportive crowd.Our team will be at the venue to introduce you to anybody specific you'd like to talk to.Guests will have access to the part of the Club reserved for our event, but not to other private areas of Hay Hill Club. You can book a private tour though.Dress code: business casual (no trainers, no jeans)
