Event Name: Sharks and Beer in North Beach
Description: San Francisco’s 901 Columbus Cafe, which has adopted the nickname, “White Shark Cafe”, is hosting another “Sharks and Beer” night on August 4th, 2023 and everyone is invited to attend.Local filmmaker, Skyler Thomas, will speak briefly on the history of the actual White Shark Cafe in the Pacific Ocean as well as lead a discussion regarding the controversy over the disappearance of white sharks in South Africa, once considered the white shark capital of the world.  The evening will be capped by a special talk from local shark diving pioneer, James Moskito the owner & operator of OceanSafaris.com, who led trips to the Farallon Islands and Guadalupe Island to see white sharks dating back to the late 1990s.James will share a few of his most notable stories and footage as well as offer an exclusive discount for his upcoming trips that will only be revealed at the eventWe will proudly be featuring two beers from The Lost Coast Brewery, long-time supporters of Skyler’s white shark conservation efforts.  Funds generated that evening will go to the nonprofit, Independent Arts and Media, which assists in covering the expenses of local educational events, such as this one, and the production of conservation films.With the theme of the White Shark Cafe taking center stage, the deal of the night will be the purchase of a new, custom-designed ‘White Shark Cafe San Francisco’ t-shirt.  Any t-shirt purchase includes two free Lost Coast beers.But arrive early, only 40 of these limited-edition shirts are available!  Single pours of the beers (without the shirts) that evening will be $4.00.The opening presentation will be at 7:00 PM. Shirt and beer sales start at 5 PM and will continue until closing or whenever supplies run out.

Event Name: Improv 3: Commitment to Craft (Wed-080923-SF)
Location: 901 Mission Street Lower Level, San Francisco, CA 94103
Description: Improv 3: Commitment to CraftSix Week Course | Adults Only (18+)Access code from previous instructor needed for registration.Leela believes improvisors are artists and must train as such.  This class provides you with a 6-week crash course on craft.  Focusing on the main building blocks of scenework, you will learn to rely on your senses (rather than "thinking") to create detailed space object environments, specific and interesting characters, and skills to develop believable scenes onstage.  Armed with these tools, you’ll step into the role of Improvisor with heightened awareness and confidence.Prerequisite: Improv 2: Authentic Relationships or instructor approval.Day/Time: Wednesdays, from 7:00 PM – 10:00 PMDates: 8/9,  8/16, 8/23, 8/30, 9/6, 9/13 (2023)Instructor: Diana BrownLocation: STUDIO A, Leela Training Center, 901 Mission Street, SF***Located only one block from the Powell MUNI/BART station.***Class Instructions: Please meet inside the lobby of the SF Chronicle Building at the 901 Mission entrance by 6:55 PM.  Then wait in the lobby next to the security guard until a Leela representative comes to greet you and direct you to the classroom.

Event Name: SF Cuddles - Cuddle Party at HeartLab! Saturday Sept 9th 2023
Description: Fully Vaccinated and Boosted Cuddle Party!T﻿his event is for vaccinated and boosted participants - please go over all the details below, as some things have changed, and see whether this event is for you.Here's some information on what Cuddle Parties are:What is a Cuddle Party?Cuddle Party is a 3-4 hours workshop experience where participants engage in communication exercises, explore touch in a non-sexual space, experience personal exploration and intimacy, and have fun with like minded people.What do we do at a Cuddle Party?We do two main things at Cuddle Parties: 1. Enjoy each other's touch. You can come and enjoy giving and receiving caring touch from other people who want to give and receive it. 2. Practice Consent. A major part of Cuddle Parties is learning how to ask for what you want and how to answer requests. Worried? Confused? Don't fret - we will teach, guide and help you practice how to do it. Why is Cuddling important?Nurturing and consensual loving touch is good for maintaining a healthy life, a strong nervous system and a balanced emotional state for people of all walks of life. One’s ability to connect with and develop greater trust in others is emphasized during the group exchanges during Cuddle Parties. Self-care is a cornerstone of the Cuddle Party experience.Is this SEX?!Great question! No. This is a non-sexual event. You have the option of experiencing touch and maybe intimacy if you'd like to - but we steer away from sexual behavior. If you are looking for something sexy, we're all for it! :) just not in this event.You can find more info about Cuddle Parties after the logistical information below.Some Frequently Asked Questions regarding COVID-19:Will EVERYONE be fully vaccinated?YES! This is a boundary that is put on participating in the event, for the safety of everyone.All participants MUST BE  BOOSTED.I have not been fully vaccinated yet, but I have a negative COVID-19 test. May I join?While we appreciate that this would mean you are a lower risk, I'm afraid that at the moment we cannot admit you to the event. Thank you for your patience and kindness for letting others who really need this be able to participate.SOME IMPORTANT NOTES:LOCATION: HeartLab, San Francisco. 3095 21st St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA. The venue has one step at the entrance, but is otherwise wheelchair accessible.  More details will be given with your ticket.BRING: Comfortable PJs, personal water bottle, and if you'd like you can bring blankets, pillows and any kind of soft fluffy things to enhance your experience. Face masks are allows but will not be required. PLEASE BE ON TIME: Make certain to account for TRAFFIC AND PARKING. Parking in the area might be a bit difficult, but it is a few blocks away from the 24th & Mission BART station.Doors close at 1:30pm - no late entry. The opening Welcome Circle is intended for introductions and to go over the rules of Cuddle Party. This is an important aspect of the Cuddle Party experience and creates a safe container for all participants. It is essential for everyone to be on time. You will not be admitted after doors close.TICKETS: $35 for single admission or $60 per two people. NOTE: Must be 18+ to attend.NOTE: This is a sober event. Please do not attend influenced.CANCELLATION: Tickets are non-refundable. Having said that, please care for your fellow cuddlers, and if you are not feeling well on the day of the party - please stay at home to keep our community safe.Please do NOT wear heavy scents or perfumes. Many people are sensitive to them, and when we're in this space there is no way for people to avoid them. Please shower and lightly deodorize if desired, but skip the scented stuff.ABOUT YOUR FACILITATOR:Yoni Alkan, DHSYoni has a Masters in Conflict Resolution and Mediation. He is a Certified Cuddle Party  Facilitator and is on the Cuddle Party Board of Directors. He is also a professional cuddler at Cuddlist, and the author of The Book of Cuddles. You can find out other things that he does on www.yonialkan.com.We Could All Use a Hug | Yoni Alkan | TEDxSoMa https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EP74acIVs60SOME MORE INFO ABOUT CUDDLE PARTIES:The Live Greater Series: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a-WwqwyGUlk Cuddle Party is a formal, non-sexual event that offers participants an opportunity to explore intimacy with like-minded others, in a relaxed environment, that upholds personal boundaries and maintains a professional atmosphere, at all times. People are encouraged to engage in communication and touch, in a non-threatening, share-affirming environment. Cuddle Party is a holistic, social environment, that attracts fascinating people from all walks of life. It provides a special and unique opportunity for connection, learning and growth. Cuddle Party experiences teach participants that they alone (with the staff's assistance) create their own safety container. How does it change people's lives? Many of us have a hard time saying NO to requests, and saying no might make us feel afraid that we will hurt the other person. Very rarely do we get a chance to practice saying NO, or practice getting a NO in a safe and nurturing environment. But it's not all about the NO, it's also about the YES! We practice saying YES to one another, and asking for what we want, and changing our minds - all very important skills that we don't put an emphasis on in our everyday lives. It's transformative for people!For more information go to http://www.cuddleparty.com/faq/ If you have any other questions feel free to contact us at info@sfcuddles.com Come meet open and fun loving people and cuddle with us!

Event Name: HIIT Bootcamp at 1 Hotel San Francisco
Description: On Saturday at 9:00am you can get your sweat on with the incredible coaches from LuxFit! This 50 minute high intensity bootcamp will take place on the 5th floor terrace at 1 Hotel San Francisco, located at 8 Mission Street. 1 Hotel San Francisco is the city’s first mission-driven hotel that celebrates the Bay Area’s natural environment and offers an urban oasis in the heart of the city. As a luxury lifestyle hotel brand inspired by nature, 1 Hotels cultivates the best of sustainable design and architecture, together with extraordinary comfort and an unrivaled level of service. Embrace the beauty of the Northern California landscape through reclaimed wood, native greenery, and organic textures. Take in views of the city skyline, the iconic Ferry Building, and the San Francisco Bay from the scenic Embarcadero. The property features a wellness spa, fitness center, 5,074 sq. ft. of event and meeting spaces, along with a farm-to-table restaurant and bar showcasing the seasonality of fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. The hotel is located steps from the Financial District, SoMa, Union Square, renowned museums, Chinatown, North Beach, and Oracle Park.

Event Name: Managing Successful Programmes - MSP Advanced Practitioner 2 Days Training
Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate	  														   Credits: 16 PDUsDuration: 2-Day			 																														Language: EnglishCourse Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual/ On-site	Course Description:The Managing Successful Programmes (MSP®) Advanced Practitioner Course provides an opportunity to learn how MSP can be applied to large programmes, in complex and changing environments, with full accountability of the achievement of the required outcomes. The course also prepares participants for the MSP Advanced Practitioner examination.This level is aiming to confirm that a candidate has sufficient understanding of the MSP guidance, combined with actual programme management experience to act as a programme manager, any other member of a programme management team, or head of a programme office. The candidate will also learn how MSP can be tailored to suit any programme environment.The course is entirely focused at applying MSP in complex programme scenarios. Exercises will be based on the candidates own programme management experience, and on the case study used in the Advanced Practitioner Exam. This scenario will need to be studied in advance of the first day of the course.Course Outline:●	MSP Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	 Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Target Audience:●	Experienced Programme Managers, used to operating in a transformational change environment.●	The Head of the Programme Office.●	Business Change Managers.●	Other specialist/governance roles involved in ensuring high quality programme management based on best practices is in place, based on the MSP guidance.Learning Objectives:●	Tailor the MSP methodology to make it suitable for any environment.●	Flexibly react to changes in the programme environment, resolve major programme level	  Apply each of the MSP principles, governance themes and the transformational flow activities within a large complex programme and changing environment.●	Explain the relationship between the MSP principles, governance themes, the transformational flow, programme information (documents) and the MSP defined programme management roles; and can apply that understanding.●	Produce or evaluate MSP programme information (documents).   ●	Pass the Advanced Practitioner exam.Course Agenda:Day 1●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner exam guidance.●	MSP® Advanced Practitioner case study.●	Tailoring MSP.Day 2●	Applying MSP within a large programme and a complex and changing environment, resolving complex programme level issues and managing programme level risks.●	Leading the programme management team.●	Organization of the programme, the programme office and programme assurance.Note:However, catering to the demands of busy professionals, our virtual training programs are as effective as face-to-face learning. Reach us at info@mangates.com for dates and details of Instructor Led Live Virtual Sessions. If you would like to get this course customized and delivered exclusively for your group, we have an On-Site Training Option, you can reach us at info@mangates.com for more details about on-site or corporate training.Offers:Groups of 3 people 10% DiscountGroups of 5 people 15% DiscountGroups of 10 people 20% Discount

Event Name: Conquer Your Fear of Public Speaking -Berkeley- Virtual Free Trial Class
Description: Overcome public speaking fear with gradual exposure, in a supportive environment. Observe a free trial to see if it's right for you. Based out of New York City for 30 years, we are now offering these classes online to an international audience. This one free trial class is an observation session to see if the US$425/10 session program is right for you. The instructor will be happy to answer any questions following the session.****30 Years of Testimonials: https://www.speakeeezi.com/success.htmZenspeak Public Speaking Center: https://www.speakeeezi.comOnce the 10 session package is purchased, the student may use their sessions however they choose.  The course is ongoing, so each session has participants at all levels. We use a workbook which each student works through at their own pace.This is the 30th year we’ve been helping people turn their dread into confidence. Gradual exposure allows you to face fear in manageable steps, at your own pace, in a supportive environment. Instructors Charles di Cagno and Kyra Smith, are phobia therapists, and former and current Directors of Public Speaking at White Plains Hospital Anxiety Treatment Center in the United States. Whatever the level of public speaking, we can help you improve. For those with anxiety, we provide gradual exposure to public speaking through a step ladder of basic to more advanced exercises. For the more experienced, it's a platform tailored to your specific needs to improve various delivery techniques. It is self-paced, in a low pressure, supportive environment with lots of feedback to address your specific issues. Begin with basic exercises and move forward only when ready. The course is ongoing, with a mix of beginning and advanced students. Our hope is you are inspired, not intimidated by the dynamic speakers present, and keep in mind they started with the same fears, progressing to their present level by consistent effort. The course is not difficult. If you have the will, we offer the way to turn a liability into your most powerful asset. The real challenge is admitting you need guidance, getting started, and making a committed, consistent effort.Our 100% success rate over 20 years for wedding speeches is just one indication of our effectiveness. But, whatever the challenge, (formal presentation, group discussion, business meeting, sales, confrontation, employment interview) the program is customized to fit your needs.Sample Gradual Exposure Program Outline for Public Speaking Anxiety:Session One - Get comfortable hearing your voice in public by responding to very simple questions while seated. The questions (i.e., name, occupation, where you live, etc.) require little thought or content.Session Two - Learning to stand confidently before a group. You will stand, with several others and respond to simple questions. As your confidence increases, one by one, each person standing will sit, until you are standing alone. You will continue until this begins to feel comfortable.Session Three- This exercise is the same as the previous one except you start by standing alone.Session Four - Gestures and Movement. Enhance your message, decrease tension and project a confident demeanor incorporating non-verbal skills.Session Five - Implement the skills learned in the session four by relating a personal experience using gestures and movement to enhance your narrative.Session Six - Respond to Questions. Open the floor to questions on a topic of choice.Session Seven - Impromptu Speaking. Learn to organize and deliver an unprepared (no notes) talk.Session Eight - Prepared Speech (Instructor Guided). Learn the secret of outlining and presenting a prepared speech with minimal effort or stress.Session Nine - Prepared Speech. Outline and deliver a speech unassisted.Once you have mastered the above you can begin simulating all manner of interpersonal and public communication including:Persuasive SpeakingPanel DiscussionConflict ResolutionDefending your PositionDebatingInitiating and Sustaining ConversationAs well as many othersWe look forward to working with you.

Event Name: Learning to Draw So You Can Paint; Drawing Fundamentals
Location: 75 Hagiwara Tea Garden Drive Golden Gate Park, San Francisco, CA 94118
Description: Learning to Draw So You Can Paint; fundamentals of materials and techniques particularly suited to the artist who wants to improve their paintings.  Lecture, demo's, practice, resource material and personal attention are provided in a supportive, constructive environment.   Realistically transposing three-dimensional scenes onto two-dimensional surfaces is our goal.  We'll cover:*  Learning to see!   *  Materials and Equipment      *  Contour Drawing             *  Negative Shapes                 *  Line, Value & Color         * Composition                *  Perspective     *  Presentation          Students will be expected to complete a simple assignment prior to the session.  Minimal  materials cost.  A detailed materials list will be sent to registrants.$45.  one-day session.    Art Association member discount available.     Limited class size

Event Name: Frugal Foodies East Bay--Greatest Hits Night
Description: Join us for a Greatest Hits Night where we cook some of the best recipes of the past few years of Frugal Foodies.  This is a night you won't want to miss.  Tasty is the word!About Frugal Foodies: Do you want to meet new people? Are you ever hungry? Do you want to learn how to prepare generally healthy meals? And would you like to do it in a friendly environment, for very little money, and with a bit of adventure along the way?  Frugal Foodies happens every Tuesday night, starting at 6:30 and running until around 9:45. But each week it’s a different group of people, a different menu, and an altogether different experience.  Learn more at www.frugalfoodies.com.

Event Name: Transformative Breathwork Journey with Nathaniel & Julian of Spirit Camp
Description: During this transformative breathwork journey, you’ll lie down comfortably with eyes closed. For 30-40 minutes, Nathaniel and/or Julian will guide you through a simple breathing technique accompanied by music and prompts.Activating the power of your own breath, your body can naturally shed layers of stress, anxiety, self-doubt, and stuck emotions, and then settle into a place of inner stillness and intuitive insight.Writing prompts will be offered prior to breathwork to intentionally deepen the healing experience.We believe everyone is a student, and everyone is a teacher. Whether you are new to breathwork, or experienced, our facilitation style is a match for all levels. You’ll discover new ways of relating to yourself and the world around you as you cultivate a deeper sense of inner peace and well-being.Bring: A journal and a body free of substances. Also bring an eye mask and light blanket if you have them. For a deeper experience, we recommend not having a heavy meal within 2 hours before we start.Bio: A queer couple, Nathaniel and Julian combine their complementary expertise and passion to create unique self-healing experiences. Breathwork has been a major practice in their healing journey both individually and as a couple. So much so that they completed 5 levels of training with renowned healer David Elliott.They’re the stewards of Spirit Camp, a magical retreat sanctuary located in the coastal redwoods of Mendocino, California, dedicated to providing greater access to a range of healing modalities. Spirit Camp aims to create a safe and nurturing environment for people to connect with their authentic selves, explore their spirituality, and self-heal from past traumas.Forever curious in their desire to grow into their most authentic, whole selves, Nathaniel and Julian explore a wide range of healing practices that they weave into their work. Having experienced the dogmatic structures of patriarchal systems, they continually work to identify these tendencies within themselves as they strive to hold space for self-healing where everyone is empowered to follow their inner guidance.Schedule & Late Policy: *Doors close at 11:05am. Please arrive on time as we will not be able to let people in late once we begin*Terms & Conditions:As breathwork can be physically and emotionally activating, it is contraindicated for those who have severe hypertension, cardiovascular disease, asthma, epilepsy, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, recent acute trauma, heavy medications, family history of aneurysm, or any recent major surgeries. You take full responsibility to determine with your qualified medical practitioner if breathwork is safe and appropriate for your own body, and participate entirely at your own risk. By purchasing a ticket, you agree to these terms and conditions.

Event Name: Vinyasa Flow at 1 Hotel San Francisco
Description: Join Love Story Yoga for a rooftop 60-minute vinyasa flow at 1 Hotel San Francisco.Our teachers will lead our signature Bhakti flow where everyone's welcome - from the adventurous beginner looking for a workout to the advanced student wanting a balanced practice. The teacher offers variations that enable you to practice at your own level while keeping up with the flow. Expect curated playlists to support an uplifting flow and strategic sequencing designed to increase strength and flexibility while releasing stress and fatigue.Classes will be held outdoors on the 5th floor rooftop terrace, overlooking the Embarcadero waterfront. When you enter the lobby, take the elevators to the 5th floor, make a right and head out to the terrace. Mats will be provided for your use.Space is limited, please RSVP in advance. About 1 Hotel San Francisco:1 Hotel San Francisco is the city’s first mission-driven hotel that celebrates the Bay Area’s natural environment and offers an urban oasis in the heart of the city. As a luxury lifestyle hotel brand inspired by nature, 1 Hotels cultivates the best of sustainable design and architecture, together with extraordinary comfort and an unrivaled level of service. Embrace the beauty of the Northern California landscape through reclaimed wood, native greenery, and organic textures. Take in views of the city skyline, the iconic Ferry Building, and the San Francisco Bay from the scenic Embarcadero. The property features a wellness spa, fitness center, 5,074 sq. ft. of event and meeting spaces, along with a farm-to-table restaurant and bar showcasing the seasonality of fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. The hotel is located steps from the Financial District, SoMa, Union Square, renowned museums, Chinatown, North Beach, and Oracle Park.

Event Name: Frugal Foodies East Bay--Cuisines of the World: The Letter L
Description: Even with a pandemic screwing things up, we’re about halfway through the alphabet and our journey around the globe.  This month, we stop in countries starting with the letter L, which are a lot of working class countries.  This may not be a glamorous month with stops in Libya, Lesotho, Liberia, Laos, and Lebanon, but you’re going to eat well and enjoy lots of dishes rarely found in US restaurants.  Interestingly, I’ve not been to any of these countries, but have been within five miles of three of them, so this will be a chance to finally enjoy some of the excellent cuisine.About Frugal Foodies: Do you want to meet new people? Are you ever hungry? Do you want to learn how to prepare generally healthy meals? And would you like to do it in a friendly environment, for very little money, and with a bit of adventure along the way?  Frugal Foodies happens every Tuesday night, starting at 6:30 and running until around 9:45. But each week it’s a different group of people, a different menu, and an altogether different experience.  Learn more at www.frugalfoodies.com.

Event Name: SF Cuddles - Cuddle Party at HeartLab! Sunday Aug 20th 2023
Description: Fully Vaccinated and Boosted Cuddle Party!T﻿his event is for vaccinated and boosted participants - please go over all the details below, as some things have changed, and see whether this event is for you.Here's some information on what Cuddle Parties are:What is a Cuddle Party?Cuddle Party is a 3-4 hours workshop experience where participants engage in communication exercises, explore touch in a non-sexual space, experience personal exploration and intimacy, and have fun with like minded people.What do we do at a Cuddle Party?We do two main things at Cuddle Parties: 1. Enjoy each other's touch. You can come and enjoy giving and receiving caring touch from other people who want to give and receive it. 2. Practice Consent. A major part of Cuddle Parties is learning how to ask for what you want and how to answer requests. Worried? Confused? Don't fret - we will teach, guide and help you practice how to do it. Why is Cuddling important?Nurturing and consensual loving touch is good for maintaining a healthy life, a strong nervous system and a balanced emotional state for people of all walks of life. One’s ability to connect with and develop greater trust in others is emphasized during the group exchanges during Cuddle Parties. Self-care is a cornerstone of the Cuddle Party experience.Is this SEX?!Great question! No. This is a non-sexual event. You have the option of experiencing touch and maybe intimacy if you'd like to - but we steer away from sexual behavior. If you are looking for something sexy, we're all for it! :) just not in this event.You can find more info about Cuddle Parties after the logistical information below.Some Frequently Asked Questions regarding COVID-19:Will EVERYONE be fully vaccinated?YES! This is a boundary that is put on participating in the event, for the safety of everyone.All participants MUST BE  BOOSTED.I have not been fully vaccinated yet, but I have a negative COVID-19 test. May I join?While we appreciate that this would mean you are a lower risk, I'm afraid that at the moment we cannot admit you to the event. Thank you for your patience and kindness for letting others who really need this be able to participate.SOME IMPORTANT NOTES:LOCATION: HeartLab, San Francisco. 3095 21st St, San Francisco, CA 94110, USA. The venue has one step at the entrance, but is otherwise wheelchair accessible.  More details will be given with your ticket.BRING: Comfortable PJs, personal water bottle, and if you'd like you can bring blankets, pillows and any kind of soft fluffy things to enhance your experience. Face masks are allows but will not be required. PLEASE BE ON TIME: Make certain to account for TRAFFIC AND PARKING. Parking in the area might be a bit difficult, but it is a few blocks away from the 24th & Mission BART station.Doors close at 1:30pm - no late entry. The opening Welcome Circle is intended for introductions and to go over the rules of Cuddle Party. This is an important aspect of the Cuddle Party experience and creates a safe container for all participants. It is essential for everyone to be on time. You will not be admitted after doors close.TICKETS: $35 for single admission or $60 per two people. NOTE: Must be 18+ to attend.NOTE: This is a sober event. Please do not attend influenced.CANCELLATION: Tickets are non-refundable. Having said that, please care for your fellow cuddlers, and if you are not feeling well on the day of the party - please stay at home to keep our community safe.Please do NOT wear heavy scents or perfumes. Many people are sensitive to them, and when we're in this space there is no way for people to avoid them. Please shower and lightly deodorize if desired, but skip the scented stuff.ABOUT YOUR FACILITATOR:Yoni Alkan, DHSYoni has a Masters in Conflict Resolution and Mediation. He is a Certified Cuddle Party  Facilitator and is on the Cuddle Party Board of Directors. He is also a professional cuddler at Cuddlist, and the author of The Book of Cuddles. You can find out other things that he does on www.yonialkan.com.We Could All Use a Hug | Yoni Alkan | TEDxSoMa https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EP74acIVs60SOME MORE INFO ABOUT CUDDLE PARTIES:The Live Greater Series: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a-WwqwyGUlk Cuddle Party is a formal, non-sexual event that offers participants an opportunity to explore intimacy with like-minded others, in a relaxed environment, that upholds personal boundaries and maintains a professional atmosphere, at all times. People are encouraged to engage in communication and touch, in a non-threatening, share-affirming environment. Cuddle Party is a holistic, social environment, that attracts fascinating people from all walks of life. It provides a special and unique opportunity for connection, learning and growth. Cuddle Party experiences teach participants that they alone (with the staff's assistance) create their own safety container. How does it change people's lives? Many of us have a hard time saying NO to requests, and saying no might make us feel afraid that we will hurt the other person. Very rarely do we get a chance to practice saying NO, or practice getting a NO in a safe and nurturing environment. But it's not all about the NO, it's also about the YES! We practice saying YES to one another, and asking for what we want, and changing our minds - all very important skills that we don't put an emphasis on in our everyday lives. It's transformative for people!For more information go to http://www.cuddleparty.com/faq/ If you have any other questions feel free to contact us at info@sfcuddles.com Come meet open and fun loving people and cuddle with us!

Event Name: Brunch & Bond: Oakland
Description: Join Brunch & Bond, a monthly event series organized by Social Tea, a vibrant social networking community for women with the vision to win together. Brunch & Bond aims to bring women together in a warm and inclusive atmosphere, fostering new connections and friendships.At Brunch & Bond, you'll have the opportunity to meet and mingle with like-minded women in your city. Each event takes place on a monthly basis at various locations across multiple cities simultaneously. Please note that there won't be a Social Tea representative present at the event. Once you have confirmed and booked your spot, you will receive detailed information about what to expect.Please be aware that attendees will be responsible for purchasing their own brunch at the chosen venue. Enjoy the delectable culinary offerings and indulge in delightful conversations as you connect with fellow attendees. The brunch experience will provide a perfect backdrop for creating lasting memories and forming meaningful connections.Social Tea is dedicated to empowering women and fostering a supportive community where women can thrive together. Through Brunch & Bond, we aim to create an environment where strangers become friends, providing an opportunity for personal growth, inspiration, and networking.Secure your spot for Brunch & Bond in your city today and be a part of this unique experience. Take the first step towards building new friendships and connections, all while enjoying a delicious brunch in the company of inspiring women.

Description: San Francisco has a new and exciting comedy show and it’s called Sundays Best. Sundays Best is a variety of comedy show where every week new performers get new topics and tell stories, jokes, and share any and all ideas on the matter. Found inside one of San Francisco’s most underground comedy venues, this show is the best thing to do on a Sunday night. Sundays Best  is a show for humans of all kinds. The show lasts 90 minutes and has comedians , poets, writers, artists of all kinds. Comedians and performers will gets a new topic each week.THERE WILL BE LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE PER SHOW TO ENSURE A SAFE & SOCIAlLY DISTANCED ENVIRONMENT*seats are first come, first serve * Tickets are Non-Refundable but can be scheduled for another dateGuests are required to wear a mask at all times unless actively eating and or drinkingAbsolutely NO outside drink allowedTwo drink minimum is enforcedMilk bar is a 21+ venue

Event Name: SILENT PARTY OAKLAND "TRAP, R&B AND AFRO-BEATS"
Description: BAY AREA!  Join Urban Fetes & friends for a fun filled Silent "R&B" Party at Level 13. Enjoy 3 live DJ’s spinning all night to keep you dancing all night long! Lose yourself in the music styles of Dance, Hip Hop, R&B, Trap & Afro-Beats. Get your tickets today before we sell out! http://www.silentoakland.eventbrite.comUrban Fêtes' Silent Parties have taken the nation by storm and developed the reputation as a new wave of culture - where the audience is in total control of their musical and social environment. Silent parties have been around for decades, but Urban Fêtes has brought back the rave-like shindig with a modern twist. This is the ultimate go-to event for millennials to attend.SPECIAL NOTES:- 21+ to party- Rain or Shine - Tickets available at the door, but are limited*We have a strict NO REFUND policy unless Urban Fetes cancels event.*WHAT TO BRING:- Valid ID- Eventbrite ticket or code on your phoneHOW IT WORKS:When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of Urban Fetes wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ’s with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color (BLUE, RED, GREEN) LED that shows what channel you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off to talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave!**By attending our parties you are subjected to photos and videos being used in our promotional efforts via our website, social media and print marketing.**

Event Name: The Pancakes & Booze Art Show SF • August 3rd, 2023
Description: SF's Pop-Up Underground Art Show is BACK for a 2-Day Event on Thursday August 3rd at Public Works.Come experience one of the largest pop-up art movements to hit North America over the past decade. Celebrating over 10 years of serving FREE PANCAKES and introducing you to some of the nation's leading emerging artists.• Over 75+ local artists exhibiting over 500+ pieces of work• All-U-Can Eat Pancakes• 21+ EVENT• Live Audio Performances from local DJs and Music Producers• Live Body Painting & Art• 7pm to Midnight on Thursday & 8pm to 1am on FridayFollow us on Instagram , Facebook , or Tik Tok@pancakesandbooze #pancakesandboozeAre you looking to exhibit your artwork? Please visit our website ( www.pancakesandbooze.com/submit ) to submit an application or email us at info@pancakesandbooze.com for further information.ABOUT The Pancakes & Booze Art Show:The LA based event originated in 2009 and has since popped up more than 500 times in 35+ cities around Europe & North America.Batter sizzles, beer foams, and canvas lines the walls from ceiling to floor as hundreds, sometimes thousands, of revelers indulge in endless pancakes.This is no stuffy wine-and-cheese, pretentious, someone-gag-me art event. It’s an innovative reimagining of the art show concept. A welcoming vibe for up-and-coming artists to sell and strut their stuff in a free verse, anything goes environment.Instagram: @pancakesandboozeArt Submissions: www.pancakesandbooze.com/submitEmail: info@pancakesandbooze.comN﻿O REFUNDS. ALL SALES ARE FINAL.Under NO circumstance will refunds or credits for future events be issued.This ticket does NOT guarantee immediate entry.Entry is based on the capacity of the venue when you arrive.Entry is first come first serve, regardless if you've bought a ticket online or at the door. Event Name: Laughs on Tap at Faction Brewing - Special Anniversary Show!
Description: L﻿aughs on Tap at Faction Brewing in AlamedaS﻿ince  August 2019, Alameda Comedy Works has brought laughs to Faction Brewing in Alameda. We're celebrating our anniversary with a special showcase featuring 6 of the best comics in Bay Area. Scheduled to appear real life husband and wife - Nick Larson and Danielle Arce, James Mwaura (Final Bay Area Show), Becky Lynn (Sacramento Punchline), Chad Opitz (Doug Benson Podcast)Located at the former Alameda Naval Base, Faction Brewing offers an excellent combination of craft beers and entertainment. So, what better way to spend your evening than sipping on a refreshing beer and enjoying some great comedy? The event is perfect for anyone who wants to relax, unwind, and share some laughs with friends, colleagues, or family.The atmosphere at Faction Brewing is relaxed, welcoming, and undoubtedly entertaining. You will enjoy the cozy ambiance of the venue, which creates the perfect environment for a comedy show. The stage setup is intimate, ensuring you have a clear view of the performers and feel like you are part of the experience.So, grab your friends or family and head over to Faction Brewing for an evening of non-stop laughter and entertainment. Tickets are selling fast, so be sure to book yours now! Don't miss out on the chance to see some of the best comedians in the Bay Area while enjoying fantastic food and drinks at Faction Brewing. We guarantee you will leave the venue with a huge smile and some unforgettable memories!F﻿AQ:Q﻿: Is there an Item minimum? No, we do not force an item. There are QR Codes on every table and staff will bring out beers to you!Q: Is there age limit? 18 and over. Q﻿: Are you Dog Friendly? Yes, you're welcome to bring your dog but please be mindful not to interrupt the show.Q﻿: Is there Food? Outside the Venue there will be a food truck that will be onsite. You're welcome to bring purchased items from the truck inside the venue.Q﻿: Is there reserved seating? No. Special Requests can be made for larger parties who want to sit together. However it's first come first served.Q﻿: How long is the show? Every show runs 90 minutes to 2-hours.Q﻿: Do they only serve beer? Yes, at the moment.

Event Name: Life after Breast Cancer: Pilates & Strength Training Survivor Workshop
Description: Life after Breast Cancer: Pilates & Strength Training Survivor WorkshopJoin us for an empowering and rejuvenating workshop by Alydesigned especially for breast cancer survivors. This in-person event will take place on Sat, 19 August, 10:30am at FitNut Loft studio at River Valley.Discover the transformative benefits of Pilates and strength training as you regain control of your body and enhance your overall well-being. This workshop focuses on tailored exercises and techniques to rebuild strength, improve flexibility, and restore confidence.Connect with fellow survivors in a supportive and uplifting environment, where you can share your journey and inspire each other. Learn valuable self-care practices and gain valuable insights from Aly herself.Don't miss this opportunity to embrace life after breast cancer, regain your strength, and rediscover your inner power. Reserve your spot today!AboutAfter losing her breasts and putting on 16kg, Aly Khairuddin started a fitness studio to help breast cancer survivors. Aly’s breast cancer battle caused her to lose both her breasts and her hair, go into early menopause, and put on 16kg. She tells CNA Women how she decided to start her own fitness studio FitNut Loft to empower other women like her to feel beautiful.Read more about it: https://cnalifestyle.channelnewsasia.com/women/aly-khairuddin-fitnut-loft-fitness-studio-mastectomy-breast-cancer-survivor-mastectomy-362961

Event Name: What Are Private Equity Secondaries?
Description: During this in-person event at the StashAway office, w﻿e will be covering:An introduction to Private EquityWhat are secondaries and how does a secondary fund work?Why current environment is conducive for secondaries?Q&ARefreshments and Canapés* will be provided during the event. We will open the doors at 6.30pm, so feel free to arrive earlier if you'd like to network with the other attendees.S﻿tashAway clients are welcome to bring a guest along, but kindly register this guest as your +1.(*Please note that this event is intended for StashAway clients and their guests. We reserve the right to ask non-clients/guests not attending with a StashAway client to pay $10 for entry).A﻿bout the speaker:Kerrine Koh, Managing Director, Client Solutions, Hamilton LaneKerrine is a Managing Director the Client Solutions Group, where she heads the firm’s Singapore office. She is primarily responsible for business development, as well as coverage of client relationships in Southeast Asia.Prior to this, Kerrine was the Head of Alternatives Distribution for Southeast Asia at BlackRock, where she was responsible for distribution strategy and client engagements on BlackRock’s alternative investment product suite, across client segments. Previously, she was the head of Institutional Client Business for Southeast Asia. Kerrine first joined BlackRock in 2010 as a member of the iShares Global Client Group, where she was responsible for ETF distribution.Before joining BlackRock, Kerrine was responsible for business and product development for Alternative Investments at UOB Asset Management and held credit analysis and strategic investment roles within United Overseas Bank.Kerrine received a M.Sc. in Applied Finance from Singapore Management University and a B.A. in Economics with first-class honours from the National University of Singapore. Kerrine is a Chartered Financial Analyst and Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst charter holder.About StashAwayWe’re Asia’s leading digital wealth manager, and in November 2020, we launched in the MENA region. Event Name: Public Speaking Masterclass
Description: Money Mastery (Singapore) Toastmasters ClubMoney Mastery Toastmasters Club is a NON-PROFIT Organization affiliated with Toastmasters International. An international non-profit organization with its headquarters in the US.Toastmasters International was started to provide members with a safe and conducive environment to practice communication and leadership skills. To date, there are around 16,000 Toastmasters Clubs around the world.Why a $20 Guest Fee?The guest fee helps to contribute towards the hall charges as well as the food we prepare for all attendees.Though we are a non-profit organization, we choose to host our meetings in a big hall with a proper stage and near an MRT station. This facilitates our member’s exposure to 1) a larger audience as our regular attendance is around 50 Pax2) the opportunity to speak on a stage with proper audio devicesThe MMTMC DifferenceThe average Toastmasters Club conducts its meeting in a relatively small room with a capacity of 30. Most meetings are conducted with an attendance of around 15 - 20. MMTMC meetings are conducted in a large hall with a stage. Audience attendance is usually around 60 - 70 Pax. Some larger events and themed meetings do attract attendance of up 80 - 100 Pax. Like our annual speech contests, workshops and speech marathon nights. If your goal is to improve public speaking skills, which do you prefer? Stretching your exposure to a larger audience capacity? Would it be more challenging and exciting to present to an audience of 15 or 70? Sounds great…so What does one gain from attending the event?A Toastmasters meeting consists of 3 main segments Prepared Speeches, Table Topics and Evaluations. It's 3.5 hours of mind-blowing speeches, heart-warming personal stories and amazing people. Expect to witness:4 well-crafted inspiring and intriguing speeches by some of our prepared speakersAn intuitive speech evaluation segment. Watch how our veteran Toastmasters evaluate the nitty-gritty of a well-prepared speech. What more can be a better opportunity to learn the hidden intricacies of giving a powerful 5-minute speech?An opportunity to network with like-minded people who shares a passion for improving their public speaking and communication skills.A great chance to find out more about the Toastmasters movement and how you can be a part of it.So, grab this unique opportunity to learn public speaking from one of the BEST clubs in Singapore.Payment ModesOnline payment at 20$Strictly no walk-inStill considering?Better communicators often land a better job. They often get better pay. And almost always advance faster in their career. The ability to present an idea, persuade your point of view and influence your peers and superiors to your ideas is your competitive edge This is why Tony Robbins says…” the quality of your life is the quality of your communication” And how effectively you express and communicate with your spouse, partner or in-laws can make a world of difference to the quality of your relationshipBetter communication = Better prospectsBetter communication = Better relationshipsBetter communication = Happier and better quality of life See how ordinary folks from a buffet spread of professions take to the stage as they compete to persuade, influence and inspire you with their ideas and insights. With one goal in mind… improving their communication skills.Come and experience how you too, can start to sharpen your communication and presentation skills in 2023. This can easily be one of your best Saturdays of the year 2023.See you there! FAQsWhat is Toastmasters?Toastmasters International is a US-headquartered non-profit educational organization that operates clubs worldwide to promote communication and public speaking skills. Check out the Toastmasters website here for more information. How to get to the meeting venue?Our venue is very accessible by public transport. Visit here to find out how.More Questions?Feel free to reach out to Michell Sheya Wong via WhatsApp/Text (+65 9086 6386) or Email  us at (getstarted@mmtmc.rocks) or visit www.mmtmc.rocks.About Money Mastery (Singapore) Toastmasters ClubMoney Mastery Toastmasters Club is a NON-PROFIT Organization affiliated to Toastmasters International. An international non-profit organization with its headquarters in the US.Toastmasters International was started to provide members with a safe and conducive environment to practice communication and leadership skills. To date, there are around 16,000 Toastmasters Clubs around the world.

Event Name: Cashflow 202: The Advanced Game of Technical Investing
Description: Get ready to take your financial knowledge to the next level with Cashflow 202: The Advanced Game of Technical Investing.What is Cashflow 202?Cashflow 202 is the ultimate game for those seeking to dive deeper into the world of personal finance and take their money management skills to new heights. It's a powerful tool that simulates real-life financial scenarios, allowing you to test your strategies, make crucial investment decisions, and learn from the outcomes.Building on lessons from Cashflow 101,  it teaches the concepts such as Options Investing and Shorting to help participants experience the volatile nature of the financial markets.Unlock the Secrets of Wealth-Building In this highly interactive and immersive game, you'll have the opportunity to explore advanced concepts such as sophisticated investing, asset management, and cash flow analysis. You'll learn to navigate the complexities of the financial market, identify lucrative investment opportunities, and develop a strategic mindset that can propel you towards financial independence.Level Up Your Financial IQCashflow 202 is designed to challenge your financial intelligence and provide valuable insights that can be applied to your real-life financial journey. Whether you're a seasoned investor or just starting to explore the world of finance, this game will expand your knowledge, sharpen your critical thinking skills, and help you make smarter financial decisions.Why Join Cashflow 202?Gain Advanced Financial Insights: Explore advanced investing strategies, analyze market trends, and discover powerful techniques for building and preserving wealth.Develop a Strategic Mindset: Learn to assess risk, make calculated investment decisions, and optimize your cash flow for long-term success.Network with Like-Minded Individuals: Connect with a community of fellow financial enthusiasts, exchange ideas, and learn from each other's experiences.Embrace a Risk-Free Learning Environment: Experience the thrills and challenges of financial decision-making without the real-life consequences of technical trading.Embrace a Risk-Free Learning Environment: For individuals who like to experience what is technical trading rather than reading about it,Unlock Your Financial Potential: Equip yourself with the knowledge, skills, and confidence needed to take control of your financial future and achieve your goals.Remember, wealth-building is not just a dream—it's an achievable goal. Let Cashflow 202 be your guide to financial success.Seats are limited, so secure your spot today. Visit our website or contact us for more information. Let's level up your financial future together!As the game will start once enough players have arrived, non-RSVP and late participants may be rejected. Do sign up and arrive early to avoid disappointment.A $20 admin fee will be collected at the door for walk-ins.T﻿his event is facilitated by Michael Chua, Financial Game Master for NTU's Alumni's Financial Game events in 2023 .Email: m﻿ichael@traders.sg

Event Name: Music Improv Group
Description: (﻿NOTICE)T﻿he Thurs 1 Jun session has been moved to CRANE JOO CHIAT, 285 Joo Chiat Rd, Kolibri Room from 7pm to 9pm.If the energy of jamming and improvisation stimulates you, then join our practice every fortnight on Thursday. Explore what our sounds can create spontaneously across music genres and instruments! Bring your own guitar, ukelele, violin, percussion or any instrument.“Our group started very organically with aficionados meeting randomly to jam. And now thanks to Crane, we’ve been able to practise regularly. We’d love to create jamming performance occasions in future, where space, environment and interactions can feed, and free!, musical spontaneity.”  - Tania, group member. The group is very fortunate to be led by Dr Larry Francis. He is an ethnomusicologist, composer, performer and music educator. He is also a Visiting Fellow at King’s College, University of London and holds many other credits to his career. One of his key areas of interest is teaching improvisation in performance. Join us as musicians come together to jam & improvise. Bring your own guitar or other complementary instrument, pop by, and have fun!

Event Name: Effective Decision-Making in Disruptive Times | The LLiBrary Lunchtime Talk
Location: 11 Eunos Road 8 #03-02 (via Lobby B), Singapore, 408601, Singapore
Description: Important NoticeThis programme/event is open to members of the National Library Board, Singapore. Please ensure you have your myLibrary username on hand before proceeding with the registration. If you do not have a myLibrary username, you can create one here: https://account.nlb.gov.sg/About the ProgrammeIn a fast-moving and disruptive environment characterised by VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex and Ambiguous), those with strong decision-making ability will achieve greater success at work and in life.Strong decision-making ability entails analyzing the information, identifying possible courses of action and making mindful choices that have the best chance of achieving a desirable outcome.Effective decision-making leads to action. Very often, success in life is the result of effective decisions taken at the right time and followed through with smooth implementation. In this workshop, you will learn:Nature of Decision-Making in Volatile, Uncertain, Complex and Ambiguous (VUCA) environmentDifferentiate between System 1 and System 2 ThinkingDecision-Making techniques in System 1 and System 2Apply the Decision-Making Process to make good decisions in lifeAbout the SpeakerFred Tan (Genium & Co)Fred has built an impressive career, leveraging his extensive experience in Planning & Operations, Leadership & Organizational Development (L&OD), and Human Capital Management to help organizations cultivate exceptional leaders. His passion for empowering individuals to reach their full potential began during his tenure in the military, where he took on the Human Resources function and led operational deployments in East Timor, Banda Aceh, and the United Nations Headquarters in New York. Fred's academic pursuits and practical experience have laid a solid foundation for his leadership capabilities leading to his appointment as the Head of Centre for Leadership Development (CLD) for SAF from 2011 to 2018. During this time, he was responsible for creating and implementing an award-winning leadership development system for military leaders.Fred facilitates L&OD programs focused on leading self, leading teams, and leading organizations in both the public and private sectors. Fred's qualifications include 12 years of experience facilitating L&OD programs, various specialist certifications, and degrees in Engineering Management, HR Development & Management, and Human Capital Leadership. Some notable certifications include Certified Transformative Coach, Certified TetraMap Facilitator, and Certified Trainer in Systems Thinking, Mapping, and Leadership. Additionally, he is an Associate Trainer at the Civil Service College and Singapore Institute of Management's Centre for Systems Leadership (CSL).His dedication to the field is further showcased through his completion of prestigious programs such as the Art & Practice of Leadership Development at Harvard Kennedy School, Crisis Leadership Program at NPLI - Harvard University, and Level 7 Advanced Diploma Qualifications from CIPD.

Event Name: How to Drive Workplace Productivity and Foster Positive Culture
Description: Join us for an inspiring event that will empower you with the knowledge and strategies to drive workplace productivity. Learn from industry experts as they share practical insights, research-backed techniques, and real-world case studies. Discover how to motivate and engage your team, enhance communication and collaboration, and create a work environment that fosters employee well-being and satisfaction. Attend this event to gain the tools and resources needed to optimize productivity and create a positive culture that fuels success. Program OutcomesDiscover how workplace training can be the catalyst for transforming your workplace culture. In this online learning experience, get your team properly aligned around the right approach to workplace training. Through on-demand, hands-on instruction, you'll learn how to:Transform CultureUnderstand how to build a work environment that encourages individual and organizational learning. One which employees continuously seek, share and apply new knowledge and skills to improve individual and organizational performance.Create a Growth InfrastructureLearn the fundamentals of how to apply technology to put the right infrastructure in place to support your transforming culture.Focus OperationsIdentify areas of growth and devote focused attention to the discovery, development and implementation of solutions to close skills gaps and promote growth.In addition to the workshop instruction, you'll also leave this learning experience with a digital copy of our Strategic Expansion Toolkit. A digital playbook containing interactive sections on improving productivity and performance. With optional expanded learning opportunities in leadership, operations management and workplace productivity.FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONSWho is this for?This learning experience is for human resource and business leaders who want to grow their organization and improve employee retention exponentially in the next 12 months.How do I get into this event?Your learning experience begins immediately after registration. When you register, you'll be asked to confirm your registration in our online virtual classroom. Once complete, you'll receive instant access to the on-demand learning session. Along with your toolkit workbooks which will be provided at the end of the session.I just signed up, but haven't received my confirmation detailsYour Eventbrite receipt and email will have information on how to begin your confirmation for the workshop session. After confirming your reservation in the workshop, you'll receive an email with your access details before the event.I signed up, but missed the scheduled event date and timeYour Eventbrite receipt and email will have information on how to access the online learning session. Registration in this event provides you with on-demand access to the training session, workbooks and future updates to the learning session and resources.SIGN UP AND JOIN US TODAY.

Event Name: YES YOU First Birthday at TUFF CLUB feat. V.ALARIK (Grow Room, Bangkok)
Description: One year flies by when we're making memories with You. After a short break to breathe and re-energise, YES YOU returns in full force to celebrate the year that has been, in the first of a new series of curated events to come.Join us at TUFF CLUB on Friday, August 4th, as we reconnect with our club roots to provide You with a night focused on forward-thinking house music, community and creating more memories. Our special guest for the evening is V.ALARIK, joining us from Bangkok. One half of the Soi Dogs crew and co-founder of Grow Room - an event which fosters an environment of positive vibrations and implores its revelers to "go deeper, open your mind to new experiences, and let yourself go," V.ALARIK has become a regular staple in Thailand's underground music scene, also featuring on festival lineups like Kolour and Wonderfruit. He's also an esteemed producer, with releases on labels like RE.FACE and Not Allowed. With a diverse array of house, deep, minimal, dub and breaks in his arsenal, You can expect a real journey when V.ALARIK steps up to the plate.On support duties, Zafirah returns and celebrates her birthday with us, alongside HBN (Last Saturdays) and Taaka (YES YOU). Each early bird ticket is entitled to receive a free YES YOU fan to be collected on arrival at the club.All-inclusive. All about You.

Event Name: Communities: Reading Allowed | library@orchard
Description: Important NoticeThis programme/event is open to members of the National Library Board, Singapore. Please ensure you have your myLibrary username on hand before proceeding with the registration. If you do not have a myLibrary username, you can create one here: https://account.nlb.gov.sg/.About the programmeNo silence here as we gather to read aloud and listen to stories' highs and lows. Discover books that you might have otherwise missed, or sit in for an alternative community reading experience. Co-organised with Read-Aloud Sg Book Club. For adults.This month, we'll be reading "The Almost Complete Collection of True Singapore Ghost Stories. Book 11" by Russell Lee. Important programme information:1. Participants will take turns to read aloud different lines/sections from the selected book for the session.2. This programme is targeted at adults.3. No prior reading is required before the session.About LearnX CommunitiesCommunities: Reading Allowed is one of NLB’s many LearnX Communities that connect like-minded people to create a modern kampong of communal learning. These communities cover a wide range of topics and can be found in libraries all over the island. Interested? Head over to https://go.gov.sg/what-is-a-learnx-community to join an existing community or start one of your own! About the seriesCommunities is an alternative learning environment where you can pick up a plethora of skills by sharing and experimenting with others. This series is built on the belief that teaching and learning can happen without a teacher.

Event Name: Effective Email Writing | Get Professional
Description: Important NoticeThis programme/event is open to members of the National Library Board, Singapore. Please ensure you have your myLibrary username on hand before proceeding with the registration. If you do not have a myLibrary username, you can create one here: https://account.nlb.gov.sg/.About the ProgrammeThis course aims to help you write effective business emails in English. This workshop will help participants draft emails that get them the intended results. We will share tips how to capture the attention of the recipient of the email and prevent your email from being labelled as “spam.” When we make the effort to write a clear message in the proper tone and without the complexity, we ensure that our emails will be a welcome item in any inbox.Through writing activities and feedback from peers and the trainer, participants will write with greater confidence after the session.After completing this course, you will be able to:Write powerful business emails for professional needsImprove your overall written English skillsCorrect common errorsAbout the Speaker Uma Jeyaram. Senior Trainer, Edukinect Pte Ltd. Uma is experienced in IT training and has been facilitating training for more than 15 years in several non-IT topics. She has trained students, mid to high level executives online or in-person training sessions across the region.Uma is responsible for the development of training materials at Edukinect and has conducted various Train the Trainer programs for the company. As a Microsoft Innovative Educator and Trainer, Uma has developed and delivered several courses organised by IMDA on various Assistive Technologies that help to create a more inclusive learning environment for people with disabilities.

Event Name: Money Management For Women Workshop: Discover Your Money Personality
Description: Money Management For Women Workshop: Discover Your Money Personality Amidst the hustle and bustle of everyday life, it is essential to carve out “me time” to focus on your personal growth and financial well-being. Ladies, join us for a workshop to uncover your money personality and recognizing how it influences your financial choices and goals.During the workshop, you will:1. Discover Your Money Personality – Take the Test!This workshop isn’t about numbers and investments. It is about understanding your money personality, recognizing how it influences your financial decisions. Embrace the power of self awareness as you embark on your journey towards financial success2. How Your Money Personality Impacts Your Investment PlanningExplore the connection between your money personality and investment planning. Whether you identify as a confident risk taker or cautious strategist, learn to leverage your inherent tendencies to make informed and confident investment decisions.3. 7 Common Challenges Faced by Women In InvestingLet’s address the challenges unique to women in the realm of investing. From balancing multiple financial responsibilities to breaking through societal norms, we will equip you with strategies to overcome these obstacles.Join us over a cup of coffee or tea on a Saturday morning! Nestled in our com-forty office couch, you will find a warm and inviting space to share, learn and grow together. Connect with like-minded women and expand your financial horizons in a supportive and friendly environment.Details:Date: 12 August 2023, SaturdayTime: 10 am to 11 amVenue: GEN Office (168 Robinson Road, Capital Tower #13-03, Singapore 068912. Nearest MRT Station: Tanjong Pagar MRT Station Exit F)Cost: $10Please note that this workshop will commence if we have a minimum of 8 participants. We aim to create an intimate and supportive environment to conduct this workshop.We look forward to meeting you as you elevate your well-being with mindfulness and a positive money mindset. Personal Note from Speaker:Why am I doing this workshop?From what I have observed through a decade of working with women, I find that the biggest strength of women in investing is that they are able to commit to a long term plan and not deviate unnecessarily. Ultimately, the success of an investment plan is not dependent on just the performance of the investment but also on the behaviour of the investor.Women can make good investors but they need to play to their strengths and when needed, get good help. Hence, I hope to help women who are new to investing or have just started exploring DIY investment platforms to kickstart their investment journey through this workshop.This workshop is designed to with beginners in mind to guide them through concepts and strategies.About Lee MengLee Meng, Executive Financial Services Consultant, is a certified Chartered Financial Practitioner with a primary focus of using the “Building Transferable Wealth” concept in solving the financial issues for her personal clients.She also specializes in helping companies formulate a proper plan to integrate employee benefits into their culture.Find out more about Lee Meng at https://www.gen.com.sg/leemeng

Event Name: Fintech 65 - 2023 Edition, Fintech Nation
Description: Fintech Nation is back with Fintech65 2023 edition to celebrate the most valuable contributors to the fintech ecosystem in Singapore. From start-ups to financial institutions to big tech, these individuals have made meaningful contributions across regulatory and compliance, ESG and sustainability, Web3 and Blockchain, and women in the Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics domains.C﻿uratorsWe are blessed to have industry leaders are curators for the 2023 edition - Pauline Wray, Rachel Freeman, Katrina Cokeng, Navin Suri, and Zennon Kapron.N﻿omination CategoriesRegulatory and Compliance - Regulatory and compliance frameworks play a critical role in the startups' sustainable growth and development companies operate in a highly regulated environment, and compliance with regulatory standards is essential for their success. We aim to recognise individuals helping Fintech companies consistently manage risk and regulatory compliance.Artificial Intelligence & Data Analytics (Women) - Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics (AIDA) are indispensable tools for fintech startups and scaleups seeking to unlock the full potential of their data and capitalise on cutting-edge technologies to grow their businesses. Our primary objective is to honour exceptional women who have contributed to achieving AIDA excellence across all departments of their organisations.ESG and Sustainability - ESG & Sustainability considerations are crucial for fintech companies seeking fast growth while balancing their impact on the environment, society, and governance. Prioritising ESG can lead to competitive advantage, risk management, innovation, regulatory compliance, and long-term sustainability. We aim to recognise individuals helping Fintech companies realise and undertake efforts to embrace ESG & sustainability into their operating DNAWeb3 & Blockchain - Web3 & blockchain technologies have significant potential to disrupt and augment traditional financial institutions. However, there is a talent gap and regulatory uncertainty that fintech companies need to develop innovative financial products and services. We aim to recognise individuals helping Fintech companies define new frontiers of innovation and creativity in Web3 and blockchain.

Event Name: Learn Facilitation Skills
Description: REGISTER (WAITLIST) NOW via WhatsApp: +65 8896 3365 (Hui Jun will assist you)This workshop is sponsored. *****Develop strong facilitation skills with one of the most difficult dialogues to have: race and racism. If you master this difficult conversation, you can apply your new found facilitation skills to any group setting where effective group dynamics, collaboration, and decision-making are required.Become a leader in:Meetings • Workshops • Team Development • Difficult Conversations • Training and Education • Organizational Change • Problem-solving and Decision-making • Conflict Resolution • Innovation and Creativity • Community and Group Engagement • Project Management • Cross-functional Collaboration • Your LifeIn this 2-day workshop, you will co-learn and bond with participants from all diverse backgrounds. You will be introduced to:Facilitation Fundamentals: An introduction to the principles, concepts, and core skills of facilitation. This includes understanding the role of a facilitator, creating a safe and inclusive environment, and establishing ground rules for effective collaboration.Communication and Listening Skills: Developing active listening skills, effective questioning techniques, and the ability to communicate clearly and concisely. These skills are crucial for understanding participants' needs, fostering open dialogue, and managing group dynamics.Group Dynamics and Facilitation Techniques: Understanding group dynamics, stages of group development, and facilitation techniques to engage participants, encourage participation, and manage conflicts. This includes methods for generating ideas, decision-making processes, and building consensus.Tools and Activities: Exploring a range of facilitation tools, techniques, and activities that can be used to encourage creativity, foster collaboration, and support problem-solving and decision-making processes. This may include brainstorming techniques, visual facilitation methods, and interactive exercises.Emotional Intelligence and Relationship Building: Developing emotional intelligence and self-awareness as a facilitator. This includes understanding and managing emotions, building rapport with participants, and creating a supportive and respectful environment.Adaptability and Flexibility: Learning to adapt facilitation approaches to different contexts, group dynamics, and challenging situations. This includes handling unexpected issues, managing diverse personalities and perspectives, and adjusting facilitation techniques as needed.Ethics and Professionalism: Exploring ethical considerations in facilitation, such as maintaining confidentiality, respecting participants' rights, and ensuring fairness and impartiality. Understanding the responsibilities and code of conduct for facilitators is also covered.Practice and Feedback: Most facilitator courses provide opportunities for participants to practice their facilitation skills through role-playing exercises and group discussions. Constructive feedback and coaching from instructors and peers help refine and improve facilitation techniques.

Event Name: Learn2Code Roblox $100
Description: Join t.me/icancode_asia for updates  and message Telegram @icancodeasia for enquiries.Four weekly 1 hour coding  classes onsite or through Zoom. Come join us and pick up a new skill.This workshop is suitable for children aged 7 -16 who are interested to learn computing in a creative environment. It will draw upon their creativity and imagination while learning new programming concepts which are applied to the projects they develop.What is Roblox?Roblox is developed under an object-oriented programming system utilizing the programming language Lua to manipulate the environment of the game. It is a game creation system that allows users to design their own games using Roblox Studio and play a wide variety of different games created by other users.Learning Outcomes✔ Learn the basics of Roblox Studio✔ Learn about Lua programming functions, conditions and events✔ Create a Roblox Obby using baseplate, spawn location and parts✔ Create an interactive Roblox gameICanCode Contactsupport@edu.icancodeasia.comwww.icancodeasia.comNo refund and replacement policy. Waiver of liability is accepted with registration.

Event Name: New Moon Soul Transmission
Description: The New Moon Soul Transmission offers a profound opportunity for transformation and self-discovery. During this sacred gathering, we will embark on a collective journey, merging our consciousness and vibrations to create a powerful and supportive environment.To initiate this transformative process, we will begin by partaking in the ceremonial drinking of Cacao. This sacred elixir will serve as a heart-opening catalyst, facilitating a deep connection with ourselves and each other. Through this shared experience, we will cultivate a sense of unity and harmony within the circle.Next, we will delve into the Soul Transmission, also known as Innderdance. This powerful practice is designed to activate your Kundalini process, unlocking the dormant energy within you and allowing it to flow freely. Through movement, breath, and surrender, you will tap into your authentic being and experience a profound sense of inner transformation.Following the Soul Transmission, we will enter into a state of deep integration through a Gong Bath. The resonant vibrations of the gongs will wash over you, penetrating every cell of your body, and facilitating a harmonious alignment of your mind, body, and spirit. This immersive experience will create a space for profound healing and integration to take place.As the circle nears its completion, we will come together to share our experiences from the entire journey. This sacred sharing will allow us to reflect, gain insights, and deepen our understanding of ourselves and our collective journey. It is through this collective reflection and support that we continue to grow and evolve on our individual paths.Join Fiona for the New Moon Soul Transmission, a transformative gathering that will empower you to explore your authentic self, embrace your potential, and connect with a supportive community on this sacred journey of self-discovery.Fiona is a Reiki Master, Vedic Astrologer, Afterlife Medium, Sound Healer, Cacao Ceremonialist, Akashic Channeler and Yin Yoga Teacher. Her mission is to initiate others into their spiritual journeys and life purposes.
