Event Name: The Writers Social - Sep
Location: Goodman Arts Centre, 90 Goodman Road, Block E, #03-32 *Please note that there is no lift access to the Training Room, Singapore, 439053, Singapore
Description: J﻿ointly presented with SG Writers NetworkMeet other writers, be part of the community!C﻿alling all writers and poets (again)! Be part of our growing community and receive the support you need, whether it be in perfecting your craft or just finding moral support.To another evening of casual conversation about all things literary, whether it's about the writing life or just a shared passion for books. This is the perfect opportunity to meet and connect with fellow writers, poets, and book enthusiasts in a relaxed and supportive environment. For September's session we have Kah Gay of Ethos Books, a local independent publisher based in Singapore. The 30-min sharing will include: the manuscripts that Ethos Books publishes (poetry, fiction, non-fiction, creative non-fiction)Ethos' ongoing and upcoming work with emerging writersEthos' focus on Southeast Asia stories and literary translationFollowed by a 30-min Q&A in the first part of the session.P﻿rogramme Details:F﻿ree with registrationD﻿ate: 15 September 2023, FridayT﻿ime: 7.00 - 9.00 pmV﻿enue: SBC Training Room, Goodman Arts Centre, Blk E, #03-32 (Directions below)H﻿ot drinks provided, encouraged to bring  snacks to share with everyone!A﻿bout featured guest:Ethos Books is a local independent publisher of literary fiction, non-fiction, and poetry based in Singapore.Giving voice to emerging and exciting writers from diverse backgrounds, we help foster an environment in which literature and the arts not only survive, but thrive. In short, we nurture the growing literary community in Singapore and throughout the region.K﻿ah GayWorking with a young and dynamic crew, KG focuses on making books and supporting an environment for literature, the arts and culture. Top of his wish list: to build the foundation for a regional network of publishers, for the circulation of fiction, non-fiction and poetry. Also, to find friends who would want to work on publishing projects to spread environmental consciousness.M﻿oderators:S﻿G Writer's Network will join the conversation and moderate the Q&A session.

Event Name: Volunteer at our M@D Garden – Newton or Changi
Location: 10 Winstedt Road Block A, 02-02, Singapore, 227977, Singapore
Description: Urban Gardening Volunteer at M@D GardenThe objective of the program we conduct is to bring people, especially children, to be more appreciative of nature and promote healthy mindful living. Resilience, Care, and Responsible is just a few characters development we will cover during the program. Using their imagination and observation to connect the dots as a form of experiential out-of-classroom learning. Nature is the best teacher for us to learn and grow to be better at ourselves and towards improving the future.Suitable for: First Timers, Open to All, Family Friendly, Organisation or GroupsMinimum Age: 13The activities include1) Building a community garden site from start (for CSC location)2) Sowing vegetable seeds3) Replanting plants4) Composting5) Rebuilding Spiral Garden6) Some harvesting7) Water harvesting/irrigation To Bring:Bring along your own headgear, water bottle, gloves. Is permaculture just about farming?In fact, permaculture is a creative design process based on whole-systems thinking informed by ethics and design principles.The first design principle is to Observe and Interact.Another design principle is to Use and Value Renewable Resources and Services.Come along and experience how we bring these principles to life!This garden is a collaboration between Mindful Space, Cangkul Zen and The Circle of Human SustainabilityDate and TimeFrom 20 May 2023 to Sat, 30 Dec 2023One day per week on weekend3 hours per sessionSat Location: NewtonSun Location: ChangiLocationNewton:10 WINSTEDT ROADSingapore 227977 Changi:2 NETHERAVON ROADSingapore 508503When you sign up, our partner from Cangkul Zen will contact you to confirm your place and time.Stay updated with the latest events and workshops at:FB: @MindfulSpaceSgInsta: #mindful_space_Mindful Space97837313https://www.mindfulspace.com.sg/

Event Name: Spark Your Next Disruptive Blockchain Idea - Workshop
Location: 21 Heng Mui Keng Terrace Level 2, Conference Hall, Singapore, 119613, Singapore
Description:
[﻿Jointly presented by NUS AIDF and NUS ENTERPRISE Blockchain Initiative]Are you an aspiring entrepreneur or a startup enthusiast looking to kickstart your next big venture? 
We specially designed this unique ideation workshop combining six types of startup founders' mindset with the power of design thinking to help you spark the next disruptive idea. This workshop is part of the blockchain entrepreneurship series that AIDF and NUS Enterprise have curated preparing you for a pitch night on National University of Singapore campus in Oct 2023 where you can pitch your ideas in front of a panel of investors and blockchain experts to test your idea as well as to exchange ideas with blockchain enthusiasts. 
During this 2-hour physical workshop, we will dive deep into the world of entrepreneurship and guide you through the ideation process, applying a human-centered approach to problem-solving. We will draw inspiration from the unique characteristics, skills, and backgrounds of six distinct types of startup founders, allowing us to gain a broader perspective and unlock innovative solutions.
Here's a glimpse of what you can expect from this workshop:Introduction of Founder and Startup Types: How it affects your outlookExploring Ecosystems: Identifying the various industries ready for disruptionApplying Design Thinking to identify the unmet needs, pain points and untapped opportunities and groundbreaking solutionsCollaboration and Cross-Pollination. Harnessing the power of diversity by collaborating with other participantsWhether you're a dreamer, innovator, catalyst, maverick, disruptor, or builder, this experience will equip you with the tools, knowledge, and confidence to generate groundbreaking startup ideas and embark on a transformative entrepreneurial journey.Don't miss this opportunity to be a part of the future of innovation!This is the second in a series of events that culminates into a pitch event on campus in the National University of Singapore that will happen in Oct 2023. Participants will learn topics and skills through these events to eventually pitch their ideas in front of a panel of investors and blockchain experts. Stay tuned!Speaker: Gustavo LiuFounder of RescaleLabGustavo Liu is the founder of RescaleLab and specializes in pedagogy design, program management and training delivery for venture creation and entrepreneurship initiatives. Started in 2018, his work at Rescale Labs includes leading and facilitating tech-enabled entrepreneurship initiatives across universities, research institutions, and corporate organizations, and has a deep commitment to leveraging technology and data to address operational inefficiencies within high-touch learning environments.

Event Name: Kickboxing @ Bedok Stadium
Description:
🥊 Kickboxing Class - Ignite Your Power! 🥊
Are you looking for a workout that combines cardio, strength training, and self-defense techniques all in one exhilarating session? Look no further! Our kickboxing classes are designed to challenge your body and mind, giving you a total-body workout like no other.
🔥 What to Expect:
Intense Cardio: Get your heart pumping and burn calories as you punch, kick, and move to the rhythm of energetic music. Say goodbye to boring treadmills and hello to an adrenaline-filled workout!
Full-Body Toning: Kickboxing engages your entire body, targeting your arms, legs, core, and glutes. Get ready to sculpt lean muscles and develop strength you never knew you had.
Stress Relief: Kick and punch away the stress of the day! Our classes provide a safe and supportive environment where you can release tension, build confidence, and boost your mental well-being.
Expert Instruction: Our experienced trainers will guide you through proper techniques, ensuring you learn effective self-defense skills while minimizing the risk of injury.
Fun and Empowering Atmosphere: Join a community of like-minded individuals who share your passion for fitness and self-improvement. Our classes are filled with positive
energy, encouragements!
💥 Ready to Join? Take the First Step! 💥
Sign-up for 6 lesson at $15 per lesson each and get your first trial for free!

Event Name: Coding for Children
Description: We are excited to invite your children to a special trial session for a free coding workshop tailored specifically for young minds. This engaging and educational workshop aims to introduce children to the fascinating world of coding and computer programming in a fun and interactive manner.Date: 12 Aug 2023, SaturdayTime: 1030am to 130pmLocation: 51 Cuppage Road, #07-15Workshop Highlights:Introduction to Coding: Our experienced instructors will provide an overview of coding, explaining its importance in today's digital age and its potential to unlock endless possibilities for creativity and problem-solving.Hands-on Activities: The children will have the opportunity to engage in exciting hands-on coding activities using child-friendly coding platforms. They will learn how to create animations, games, and interactive stories, fostering their logical thinking and computational skills.Interactive Learning Environment: The workshop will be conducted in a supportive and inclusive environment, encouraging collaboration, teamwork, and the sharing of ideas. Our instructors will be available to provide guidance and support throughout the session.Q&A and Parent Information Session: At the end of the workshop, there will be a dedicated Q&A session where parents can address any queries they may have about the program. We will also provide additional information on the curriculum, duration, and future sessions of the coding workshop.No prior coding experience is necessary, and this trial session is open to children aged 5 - 8 Years Old. We encourage you to take advantage of this opportunity to expose your child to the exciting world of coding, fostering their creativity and problem-solving abilities.

Event Name: Good Start Early Childhood Education Conference 2023
Description: Themed "Effecting Change in Our Classrooms, this conference is focused on providing practical handles for early childhood practitioners and parents. We hope to inspire, inform and equip conference attendees to be agents of change wherever they are planted.Hence, each of the presentations this year will cover either one or more of the following three interconnected strands: (﻿1) Early Childhood Theories, Practices and Strategies(﻿2) Early Intervention and Inclusive Practices(﻿3) Mental Well-being of Children and Teachers T﻿here are 4 main segments in this years' conference. (﻿1) AM Plenary (Keynote Speech + Little Heroes of Inclusion Award Ceremony)-﻿ all participants will attending the AM session together (﻿2) PM Break Out A -﻿ participants may choose (1) session out of 15 options(﻿3) PM Break Out B-﻿ participants may choose (1) session out of 15 options(﻿4) PM Break Out C-﻿ participants may choose (1) session out of 14 optionsMandarin Break Out Presentations/WorkshopsYou may click on each of the sessions to read the synopsis!(2) PM Break Out A A.C1 融合班级中幼儿学习需求的应对策略 by James Ling Jian 凌健 (KLC International Institute)A.C2 情绪教育“动”起来 by Ban Lee Chin 万老师 (NTUC First Campus Co-Operative) and Cynthia Choo 周老师 (Yishun Methodist Mission)A.C3 释放出以儿童为中心的文档的力量：教育者与儿童之间的共同规划和共同学习 by Ng Shu Ping and Zeng Min 曾敏 (Anglican Preschool Services)A.C4 为学前教育领导和工作者提供动物园启发的正念练习 by Ong Peiying  (Mandai Wildlife Group)(3) PM Break Out BB.C1 请你了解我，走进我的世界 Getting to know more about children with additional needs by Doris Yee (AWWA)B.C2 让我们一起玩吧！如何通过建立关系来培育有包容性的学习环境 by Elaine Ng (The Learning Connections)B.C3 课堂绘本阅读: 读什么怎么读 Shared Book Reading in Class: What to Read and How to Read by Dr. Sun He (National Institute of Education, Nanyang Technological University)B. C4 利用幼儿全域课程资源学习中文 by Dr. Chen Shi (KLC International Institute)(4) PM Break Out C C.C1如何在学前教室使用“结构化教学法 How to implement the concept of Structure Teaching in preschool classroom? by Doris Yee Ching Yen (AWWA)C.C2 学前儿童的行为辅导 by Sun Ying (Anglican Preschool Services)C.C3 提升幼教老师幸福感的策略 by Huang Fang and Yannie Soo (National Institute of Early Childhood Development) English Break Out Presentations/WorkshopsYou may click on each of the sessions to read the synopsis!(2) PM Break Out A A.E1 The Power of Therapeutic Play in the Classroom by Raine Too (Little Marvels Therapy) and Grace Lim (Creative Play Lab)A.E2 Positive Behaviour Interventions and Supports (PBIS): Promoting positive behaviours and social-emotional competence in young children by Iris Chen and Jerlyn Leong (Community Psychology Hub)A.E3 The ABCs of Early Literacy Intervention by Wendy New (Imagine If and Singapore University of Social Sciences)A.E4 Identifying Developmental Language Disorder (DLD) in the Preschool Classroom by Caroline Lee (Singapore Institute of Technology) and Dr. Shaun Goh (National Institute of Education, Nanyang Technological University)A.E5 Symbolic Literacy: Substitution and Visual Modelling as the Central Actions of Learning Activity by Galina Dolya (Key to Learning International)A.E6 The Art of Reading Children's Drawings by Dr. Rebecca Chan (National Institute of Education, Nanyang Technological University)A.E7 The What and How of Teaching Values to Preschool Children by Dr. Sandra Wu, Dr. Christina Lim-Ratnam and Ms. Karunambiga Subramanian (National Institute of Education, Nanyang Technological University)A.E8 Building Strong Foundations: Supporting the development of self-regulation skills in the classroom by Dr. Ng Ee Lynn (National Institute of Education, Nanyang Technological University)A.E9 Being a Heart-Centred Educator by Dr. Geraldine Teo-Zuzarte (St. Joseph's Institution International Preschool)A.E10 Is there a "type" to be a Special Ed Teacher? by Dr. Pamela Lim (Singapore University of Social Sciences)A.E11 Cultivating Success: Unlocking the Power of Workplace Culture in Preschools by Evelyn Kwek and Pamela Sng (Great Place to Work)(3) PM Break Out BB.E1 Cultivating Higher Order Thinking through LEGO Play by Alicia Yah (Presbyterian Preschool Services)B.E2 Some-THINK to Play: Transform effortless explorations into conscious efforts to support children’s learning by Tracy Er (Presbyterian Preschool Services)B.E3 Harnessing the Power of Your Visual Mind for Lesson Planning by Goh Ai Yat and Joyce Chua (PictureThink Academy by Infiniskills)B.E4 Social and Emotional Learning Using Puppetry by Juliana Geetha, Hadjirul Eliona Francisco and Liang Hong (Anglican Preschool Services)B.E5 The Power of Self-Directed Learning in Developing Engaged and Independent Learners by Wendy New (Imagine If and Singapore University of Social Sciences)B.E6 Building Social Communication Skills for Better Behaviour Regulation and Academic Learning by Chithra Kathiresan (Connect and Communicate)B.E7 The Social Skills Taxonomy for Children with Social Communication Challenges by Nurhayati Ismail (Autism Partnership)B.E8 Promoting Young Children's Cognitive Development Through Mediating Learning by Dr. Lucy Pou Kwee Hoon (L.A.M.P. Learning)B.E9 Communication and Literacy Strategies in the Inclusive Preschool Classroom by Bernard Tan (Dinosaur Speech Therapy)B.E10 Collaborative Exploration in the Design and Implementation of The Making Every Preschool Inclusive (MEPI) Training Programme for Early Childhood Inclusion by Tee Yi and Janice Leong (Rainbow Centre)B.E11 Active Listening Builds Resilience by Dr. Tsao I Ting (Redwood Psychology)(4) PM Break Out C C.E1 Making the Learning Environment Inspiring (MEI) through Visible Thinking Routines (Harvard Graduate School of Education) to Celebrate Children’s Thinking and Understanding by Eileen Boey (Presbyterian Preschool Services)C.E2 Practical Ways to help Your Child Develop Language and Communication Skills by Jean Foo (The Colourful Mind)C.E3 Let's Play Together! Event Name: Yacht Fishing
Location: 11 Cove Drive, Sentosa Cove, Singapore, Jetty 098497, Singapore
Description: You will be taught the skills of hunting bigger fish on our yacht where the conditions are much tougher compared to fishing on land as we will be affected by the wind, the current and undulating seabed.You will also learn how to tie one more advance knot which can last prolonged fight with strong predatory fish. It will be a unique experience to learn something new in the most unusual classroom environment.EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:Must have attended Beginner Angler's CourseNUMBER OF INSTRUCTOR TO STUDENTS: 1:6Minimum 4 students are required for the course to be conducted. Groups and individuals will be combined to form a class.AGE:Child who is 12 years old and below will have to share a rod with an adult who is also taking the course for safety reasons.TRIP INCLUDES: - Novice Angler's Course Handbook *- MFFA certificate upon completion of course*p/s* If you signed up for the course- Bait for fishing- Mineral water on board- Ice for keeping fish- Fresh catch of your own from the sea to bring backFISHING EQUIPMENT: Requires 1 medium setup (rod: PE 2-3, length 5ft-6ft, reel size 2000-3000 with PE2 lines)Fishing equipment and accessories are provided free of charge to all students of MFFA, however, we encourage you to bring your own so that you can grow to become an independent angler.ATTIRE:Lessons are conducted outdoors most of the time. Please wear clothing such as a long-sleeved t-shirt, cap, face mask, etc. that can protect you from the sun.DON'T FORGET TO BRING:- Lunch (Please take light breakfast before the course)- Seasick pills (if you are prone to seasick)- Clothing/ Cap/ Bandana/ Sunglasses to shield from the sun- Raincoat (in case of rain)- Plastic bags to take your catch back (no big ice box please)

Event Name: Learn2Code Minecraft $100
Description: Join t.me/icancode_asia for updates  and message Telegram @icancodeasia for enquiries.Four weekly 1 hour coding  classes onsite or through Zoom. Learn coding through blended self-paced coding projects with instructor support.New to Coding? Come join us and pick up a new skill.This workshop is suitable for children aged 7 -16 who are interested to learn computing in a creative environment. It will draw upon their creativity and imagination while learning new programming concepts which are applied to the projects they develop.What is Minecraft?Minecraft was created in the Java programming language. Players explore a blocky 3D world to discover and extract raw materials, craft tools, build structures and fight computer-controlled Mobs.Minecraft: Education is a game-based learning platform that promotes creativity, collaboration, and problem-solving in an immersive digital environment. It provides endless opportunities for exploration, storytelling and digital learning.Learning Outcomes✔ Introduction to Minecraft: Education	 ✔ Block coding in Microsoft MakeCode	 ✔ Learn algorithms, sequencing, loops and conditionals✔ Build Minecraft world with NPC spawnICanCode Contactsupport@edu.icancodeasia.comwww.icancodeasia.comNo refund and replacement policy. Waiver of liability is accepted with registration.

Event Name: 'I'm My Own Boss' Club: Group Coaching for Self Employed + Small Biz Owners
Description: 6-week Group Coaching Programme for Self Employed + Small Business OwnersIf you'd like an invoice so that you can reclaim the 21 % BTW, contact me on hannah@takecoachingamsterdam.nl with your KVK and BTW details.ABOUT THE PROGRAMME In this 6-week coaching programme for self employed people and small business owners, I will bring a group of 6 people who are doing work their own way together, along a collective journey to find relief and renewed motivation in their work, business and life. - Hear and learn from fellow 'own rule makers'- Exchange experiences of and explore various themes, business set-up scenarios and ideas that are necessary for growth both for you as a person and the business you are running- Unstick and move forwards with a plan, and deeper satisfaction and belief in yourself and your offeringsWeek 1: Dreams + Goals - explore and share your desires for you and your work. Remember why you started in the first place. Re-connect with what's gone well so far, where you're at on your journey, and where you want to go next.Week 2: Doubt + Blocks - practice sharing your doubts, difficulties or blocks out loud. Give them a voice so that they can be heard + seen. Once we bring them out in to the light or show them they're not alone, they'll feel like we can work with them better.Week 3: Flow, Energy + Motivation - learn about all the different ways people get things done (not just the way society tells you you need to be in order to be 'productive' and 'successful'. Explore new rituals, systems, ways of thinking that work best for you.Week 4: Money + Pricing - there had to be a week about money because bills need to be paid and we need to live and eat! Explore how you set prices, how you manage cash flow, how you think about what we need to normalise about money in self employment, and why earning 'what' matters to you.Week 5: Selling as You, for Who? - get clear on who you want to be selling to. Get happy with your own unique sell style. Figure out what kind of person would want to buy from YOU because they want to work with YOU. Discuss how you're currently reaching them and how you might be able to reach even more of them, even more effectively.Week 6: Rewiring your beliefs about how work works - take stock together on what insights you've learnt that are most important to you. Make note of the tools, reframes, perspectives and ideas that have challenged you in the best way for you to move forwards in your work and business. Leave with both a plan, and a deeper sense of confidence + self-trust in how you can create your own version of success.I﻿'m excited! Are you?FORMATOver the 6 week period we will create a container together that is confidential and non-judgemental. We will all be entering the space from different perspectives as unique individuals with various business types, set-ups and experiences, so an open ear, and open heart, and respect for others is mandatory. Each person will share only what they wish to share. Through shared vulnerability and a commitment to each other, we’ll create group trust so it will feel safe to go deeper into our experiences, lessen the grip of insecurities and struggles that block us from experiencing the work and life we want, and find new or renewed confidence and belief in ourselves so that we can unstick, and make things happen in our businesses.I will take you through group exercises and inquiries drawn from various coaching methods and 10 years of business/brand strategy experience. I will facilitate self-enquiry, group thinking, perspective shifts, exposure to other business strategies and models, and collective conversation. Whilst I will be offering a range of frameworks or exercises, I will be coaching you, not mentoring you (i.e. I won't be telling you what to do or telling you to follow set models). This programme very much focuses on reconnecting you to your own resourcefulness and answers, and tapping in to the collective knowledge and experience of the live group. There is no singular correct way to do self employment or run a business, and we will all have learnt and be learning different things along the way. The learnings that we will all share, will feed in to a melting pot of experiences, inspirations and ideas that will create a learning experience bigger than the sum of it's parts. It will also create a sense of not being alone in how you feel, as well as offering community and support in your journey and ambitions. DATES, TIMES & LOCATIONWednesdays over 6 weeks 10:30am - 12:00pm (NL Time) 13th, 20th, 27th September; 4th, 11th, 18th October 2023Stories, Sarphatistraat 14, Amsterdam (tea, coffee and mini stroopwaffels included)(You're welcome to arrive at the practice to settle in up to 15 minutes before we begin. To ensure a safe space with no disruptions, late entry will not be possible).IS THIS FOR YOU?The programme will be in English - people of all nationalities and backgrounds are welcome.This programme is for people who have already set up as a self employed person or small business owner and have the wheels already in motion. It is not for people who would like to become self employed, or people running large businesses. I heartily welcome a range of industries and professions, as well as a range of self employment experience, e.g. from having completed your first 6-12 months in business, to being 5 years in and feeling lost or wondering where you go from here. Please do drop me an email on hannah@takecoachingamsterdam.nl if you are unsure if it's for you and would like to ask any questions!T﻿he most important factor, is that you want to be here. You are willing to show up, be part of and contribute to the group experience, and open yourself to the wonderful uncertainty of what will be discovered and unfold.Although this programme will, at times, feel therapeutic, holistic and personal, it is not therapy. Whilst we set up a container that enables trust and honesty, we ask everyone to take responsibility for their experience. Please speak to your therapist if you are wondering whether it is right for you to take this course.TICKETS 500€ + 21% BTW for the 6 week programmeIf you'd like an invoice so that you can reclaim the 21 % BTW, contact me on hannah@takecoachingamsterdam.nl with your KVK and BTW details.Y﻿OUR FACILITATOR AND COACHH﻿annah Ray is a therapeutic business, career and life coach. After working as a strategist in the advertising industry for over 10 years, she decided to put her skills more in to people than ads, retrained as a coach and founded and grew her own coaching practice, TAKE. She has so far coached a huge variety of people with different work set ups, from PR consultants, a dog groomer with their own salon, a swimwear designer, padel club creators, boutique hotel owners, to audiobook producers, filmmakers, sustainability experts, CFOs and COOs of start ups, and more. H﻿er approach to coaching is in the belief that the person sitting in front of her is fully capable and much more resourceful than they think. She is not interested in telling you what to do, but in finding out what the right questions to ask you are, so that you can bring some tenderness to your blocks and doubts, allow yourself to dream and voice your ideas + ambitions, and then explore what kind of set ups or ways of working will enable you to make shit happen. As much as she works holistically, spaciously and with a considered manner, she is deeply practical and will lovingly challenge you to create your own plan of action that moves you back in to alignment and keep stepping in the direction you want to go.H﻿annah has extensive experience with running groups and workshops for the most garrulous of crowds in corporate settings, as well as patience, respect and space for the quietest of introverts and dancing creative brains. She is also a 450hr yoga therapist with a lot of experience guiding group energy and inquiry in both a studio and 1-1 setting.w﻿ww.takecoachingamsterdam.nl

Event Name: Wentzo Connect '23
Description:
Op donderdag 12 oktober 2023 organiseren we de tweede editie van Wentzo Connect, met ditmaal als thema ‘Smart Networking & Sustainability’! We nodigen je van harte uit om hierbij aanwezig te zijn.

Wat kun je verwachten
Tijdens Wentzo Connect ’23 inspireren we je om jouw netwerkinfrastructuur nog slimmer en duurzamer in te zetten. Dit doen we onder andere met boeiende keynotes, break-out sessies met praktijkvoorbeelden en live demo’s. Op het netwerkplein ontmoet je vooraanstaande leveranciers en partners, ook heb je de kans om vakgenoten te spreken.  ’s Avonds kunnen we verder bijpraten onder het genot van een hapje en drankje. Je gaat naar huis met een leuke giveaway.

Aanwezige netwerkleveranciers en IT partners
Onderstaande netwerkleveranciers zullen een bijdrage leveren in de vorm van een presentatie en zijn aanwezig op het netwerkplein. Binnenkort vullen we deze lijst aan met meer IT partners.

HPE Aruba Networking
Extreme Networks
Juniper-Mist
Huawei
Fortinet
Waar?
Wentzo Connect ’23 vindt plaats bij onze vernieuwde en uitgebreide event locatie Wentzo Meetz in Garderen. Je parkeert hier gratis voor de deur.

Maximum aantal deelnemers
Om een hoge mate van evenementervaring te kunnen garanderen geldt er een maximum aantal bezoekers. Vul hieronder je gegevens in en reserveer alvast jouw plek. De toegang is gratis.

Event Name: Masterclass: NEW Generation Leadership!
Description: MASTERCLASS:NEW GENERATION LEADERSHIP - Limited EditionWelcome at the After-Summer-Vibes of Inspiration!Laat je meevoeren in de positieve wervelwind waarin we de stropdas van ouderwets management vervangen door de cape van innovatie, creatie en voldoening!“Great leaders of the new generation are not afraid to challenge the status quo and think outside of the box!"Realiteit:Persoonlijke behoeftes veranderen in rap tempo maar het bedrijfsleven verandert niet in hetzelfde tempo mee. Gevolgen zijn zorgwekkend; 1,3 miljoen mensen hebben een burn-out, er zijn net zoveel antidepressiva-afnemers, angststoornissen stijgen aanzienlijk en 77% van de medewerkers ervaart dagelijks stress op het werk. Om over de personeelstekorten maar te zwijgen. Maar ook gebruikt 85% van de mensen hun potentie NIET!  Wat een kansen!Dat kan makkelijk anders! Vanuit fun & (cash)flow.  "The future depends on what we do, create and innovate in the present!"Inhoud & Inspiratie:👉		Wat is de ‘X-factor’ voor generatie Y&Z👉		Wat kan je doen aan personeelstekorten👉		Sustainability & MVO vanuit een ander perspectief👉		New world, new marketing P’s; welke en waarom👉		Hoe creëer je human capital👉		Hoe doorbreek je de huidige cultuur om weer te innoveren en creëren👉		Wat zijn de laatste wetenschappelijke cijfers en trendsVoor wie?Voor bedrijven/ leiders die:👉		Denken dat de nieuwe generatie niet wil werken ;-)👉		Te maken hebben met een personeelstekort👉		Echt impact en onderscheid willen maken👉		Hun resultaten onbegrensd willen laten groeien👉		Opnieuw geïnspireerd willen worden vanuit fun & flow👉		Kennis willen hebben waar ze direct wat mee kunnen👉		Frustratie voelen en nu de lead willen pakken👉		Toe zijn aan next new level👉		Weten dat er zoveel meer mogelijk is, maar hoe dan?Happy to welcome you.Let's bliss ;-)Karin Jansen is founder van Miss Business Bliss waarin zij bedrijven begeleidt naar Visionair Leiderschap. Daarnaast is zij bestuurslid bij Nyenrode Business University waarin zij de circle van Persoonlijke Groei leidt.

Event Name: Eco-Printing Workshop with Flowers!
Description: Flowers + Fashion = ArtIn our eco-printing workshop (hosted by Indian fashion designer Supriya) we will learn how to transfer the beauty of flowers onto natural textile (cotton, linen, silk, wool)👚👕We will explore this eco-friendly alternative to chemical dye together, using only the natural pigment of the flower🌺💐When: August 6, 2-5pmWhere: Tolhuistuin GardenCosts: €5,70What to bring: a hammer or heavy object for stamping flowers onto fabrics 🔨And, like you’re used to, there will be live music to Jam to 🎶 Kom met ons de bloemetjes buiten zetten!

Event Name: Fundamentals for a Spiritual Life - The 7 planetary influences
Description: Fundamentals for a spiritual life“The human is an unfixed, unrealised embodied spirit created by a higher authority to fulfil a purpose”- This is the first principle of our school.Does this resonate in you? Do you somewhere feel you are here for a reason, to fulfil a Human function? Then you might wish to meet our school, our Work and Way. You are welcome to visit and become introduced to fundamental teachings on the human, the universe and the interaction between the two. We pass on our work in different ways from oral teaching to various practical methods including movements, music, meditation and stories.A﻿genda22 August – The Universe: a lawful matterUniversal laws to which all things must respond29 August – The 4 Human TypesHuman nature through the cyclic law5 September – Self KnowledgeLayers of ‘self’: essence & personality12 September – The 7 planetary influencesMyth & our relationship with the ‘local Gods’19 September – Letters & NumbersThe power of symbologyThis meeting is part of a series that is advised to be followed in full, you are also welcome to attend a single meeting of the program.About the organizerThe Phoenix Fellowship is a living Esoteric School for Human Development and Spiritual Growth. We are here for anyone seeking answers to life's questions and wanting to make an essential difference in the world. For more information, you are welcome to visit our website.Schedule19:45 – 20:00: Time to arrive20:00 – 22:00: Meeting on Fundamentals for a spiritual life.SettingMost meetings are attended by 5 to 10 students and are led by an experienced teacher. It is possible to ask questions or to only listen. It is a safe environment in which we hope you will have an inspiring evening. Perhaps good to mention: we work in the English language.PricePrice € 20/student € 10 per evening.To subscribe or inquireTo ensure we can make adequate preparations for your attendance, we kindly invite you to subscribe in advance using one of the following options:Purchase a ticket via the Eventbrite platform. Email Subscription: Subscribe by sending an email to info@phoenixdynamics.nl.Online Subscription Form: Visit our website's subscription page and fill out the simple form.We will follow up on your subscription by sending you additional information about the evening.Thank you for your cooperation and we hope to welcome you to one or more of our open evenings.

Event Name: 27th KPN's Scale Up Afternoon
Description: On behalf of KPN Liaison Management Scaleups, we welcome you again to our 27th Scale Up Afternoon.The event will be hosted on the 13th of September 2023The program of the event14:30 - 15:00 		   Walk-in & registrations15:00 - 15.10 		   Opening and preparations for speeddates15:10 -15:30 		   1st round of speed dates15:40 - 16:00 		   2nd round of speed dates16:00 - 16:15 			Break16:15 - 16:35 			3rd round of speed dates16:45 - 17:05 			4th round of speed dates Parallel to the speeddates:15:10-17:05				  Entrepreneurs coaching areas on 1. Talent,  2. Investments,  3. Scaling		   If you don’t have a speeddate, we’d appreciate you to contribute to our ecosystem, either by having a demand on one of the topics, or offer your expertise on the topics to those present in the coaching areas17:05 – 18:00 			Network drinksSpeed dating informationThe following 1) KPN departments 2) corporates and 3) investors will be present:1) KPN (for startups & scaleups looking for cooperations with-, or investments from KPN):[﻿To be announced] 2) Corporates (for startups & scaleups looking for cooperations, Proof of Concepts, or sharing knowledge).Connekt is looking to cooperate with startups/scaleups specializing in smart mobility, sustainable logistics, energy transitions, data platforms, and data spaces. Additionally, other focus areas include housing construction and enhancing public spaces. While Connekt prefers Dutch startups / scaleups, they also welcome European startups / scaleupsA﻿hold is looking for new ideas on how to improve our customers' and employee's journey with innovations. Deloitte is looking for cooperation with scaleups who can solve their clients' challenges on sustainability, future of food, digital, trust and security,  and transformation. They are mainly interested in MA tools, taxation, future banking, but also Web3.0, Metaverse, Quantum computingEntreprise Solution is looking for scaleups who are either planning to expand to the USA or already operating in the following areas: Sustainability, Circularity & Resilience, Safety & Security, Health & Wellness, Smart City & Smart Home, Smart Mobility, Vehicle Tech, Data Security, Big Data, AI & Robotics, Quantum Computing , Data Security, Big Data, Blockchain, Quantum Computing, Robotics & Drones, Sensors & Internet of Things, Telecom/ 5G, IoT, Photonics, NanoTech & New Materials, Energy Storage/Battery Technology, Immersive Entertainment, augmented reality (AR) & virtual reality (VR), Future of Work, Product design & manufacturing, other. EY is an accounting and tax firm, who supports fast growing companies with accounting and tax related issues. They are looking for fast growing companies who want to professionalize their company to cooperate with or to share knowledge with in all industries.KPMG offers support to Dutch scaleups facing challenges in the areas of tax, finance, operations, and risk, by granting access to knowledge and expertise in these fields. KPMG’s expertise is highly relevant for companies at (or approaching) growth milestones such as entering a new (international) market, growing their team or operation significantly, raising funding, or even preparing for exit/IPO.Microsoft is looking cooperation with B2B software companies with headquarters in the Netherlands. They support scaleups in business development and help them by giving access to the market.NS is looking for cooperation in the areas of AI, 5G, sensor technology, energy transition, predictive maintenance, mobility, and cybersecurity. They are interested in Dutch and European startups/scaleups who offers POC and are at least in TRL phase 3 or 4.PostNL is Netherland’s largest parcel and postal delivery company, with over 8 mln consumers digitally connected. They are building the future of delivery in, to and from the Benelux. Aspiring to be your favorite deliverer, they offer a wide range of simple, smart and sustainable logistic solutions; anywhere, anytime. PostNL is looking for a collaboration with Dutch or international startups/scaleups that enhance consumer services processes in e-commerce. The ambition is to broaden the e-commerce journey for consumers by adding extra relevant (digital) services to the current scope of PostNL (delivery of parcels). They are particularly interested in cooperating with startups/scaleups that contribute to sustainability, such as repairs, recycling, etc.Johan Cruijff Arena is looking for companies that are able to build a digital twin of the Johan Cruijff Arena to digitalize events such as football games, or companies that will be able to improve their Operational Mobility Centre in any way. 3) Investors (for startups & scaleups looking for investments). ABN AMRO is a financial institution focusing on matching companies to informal investors; solely looking for investment opportunities in seed and growth Dutch companies with at least TRL 9, with scalable businesses and a capital needed up to 2 million.  They are interested in all industries except for Medtech, Biotech, or Real EstateEneco Ventures is looking for later stage investment opportunities in energy software startups/scaleups in North-west Europe, with a focus on those already having a PoC, and generating at least 0.5 million in revenue with a diversified client base. In general, however, Eneco are also interested in speaking to any energy software startups/scaleups in earlier stages active in Europe that are willing to scale to the home markets of Eneco, being The Netherlands, Belgium, or GermanyRabobank  is looking for investment opportunities or cooperation with Dutch startups/scaleups in the fields of energy transitions, agriculture, food, and sustainability. Other focus areas include the housing sector and fintech (embedded finance).  Additionally, Rabobank is particularly interested in startups/scaleups with a TRL of 9, but also welcome those with a TRL of 5 or higher, accompanied by revenue and a client base, regardless of its sizeRockstart is an early stage investor that empowers purpose-driven founders across three domains: Energy, AgriFood, and Emerging Technologies. Rockstart invests in early-stage startups globally, and provides access to capital, market, and expertise by connecting founders with co-investors, mentors, partners, corporates, and the wider Rockstart network. Across funds, we invest between EUR 100k and EUR 265k initially, after which we're able to follow-on invest until Series B. As the Emerging Tech Fund, we focus specifically on the verticals Digital Health, Industry 4.0 and Advanced Analytics, Data Safety & Security and Smart Cities & Societies. TIIN Capital is interested in seed, later stage and growth companies in the European cybersecurtiy industry whom are looking for an investment. Volta Ventures is looking for investment opportunities focusing on early-stage (pre-seed to early Series A) B2B software companies in the Benelux region. Additionally, ticket sizes range from 300k to 2M initially, and up to 6-7M pre-portfolio. Interested? Get your ticket on this webpage and join our eventThe deadline for the speed dates is September 6th 2023. We hope you'll join our 27th KPN Scaleup AfternoonIf you can’t attend our event but ordered a ticket, please cancel your registration in eventbrite or inform us via kpnscaleups@kpn.com at least one week in advance. If you want your data to be removed from our systems please email: kpnscaleups@kpn.comWe love Innovation, We love Startups & Scaleups

Event Name: Rise & Lead Summit & Awards 2023

Event Name: Chem Together #15
Description: Chem Together is the Knowledge&Networking event by ACN, where chemistry professionals come together to share ideas and make new connections.The third edition of 2023 is now announced: Save The Date!The theme will be: "Unlock your Lab's Potential". Join us to discover the R&D of the future, among sustainability and digitalization.  1﻿6.00-16.10: Welcome.1﻿6.10-16.20: ACN Updates16.20-16.40: ELEMENTA LABS - AI-driven voice assistant to automate data collection, optimize experimental workflows and enhance data integrity in your lab.16.40-17.00: Presentation tba.1﻿7.00-17.20: Presentation tba.17.20-18.30: Drinks and networking.Event language: EnglishCHEM TOGETHER #15 will happen in Matrix ONE, in the heart of Amsterdam Science Park!M﻿eet our speakersAhmed Khalil is the co-founder and CEO of Elementa Labs. Ahmed kicked off his career in sales and business development in big pharma and medical devices, specialising in cardiovascular line. Later in his career, he transitioned to early-stage drug discovery, specialising in cancer immunotherapy.  During his work as a scientist in various labs around the Netherlands, he noticed inefficiencies that labs struggle with when it comes to data documentation and data management.  As a result, he started his entrepreneurial journey, combining his commercial and technical expertise, to enable scientific labs to be more efficient and data-driven.M﻿ore tbaRegister Now to Guarantee Your Spot.Questions? Check www.acnetwork.nl or email us at info@acnework.nl

Event Name: Walk In Urban Sustainable Wine Tastings
Description: Several times per year Wines Unlimited organises a wine tasting in Amsterdam in an "event setting" including food, DJ, plus fun and relaxing elements for anyone who's into real wine. Our wines are authentic for their origin and are always imported straight from the producer. We only sell / import wine from European wine producers who do everything themselves from grape to wine. They make wine with as little impact to the environment as possible. Pure, clean wines without pesticides and sulfites. Mostly organically made wine which you can only find at: Salburg Wijnimport - Wines Unlimited and are only distributed by us. Wines Unlimited plants since 2020, 150 trees per year for climate-proof forest in the Netherlands and restores tropical forest and habitat of the orangutan on Borneo. We do this through ANBI foundation Trees for All. We're also a proud Business partner of Project Pura and we are a 'Register Wijnhandelaar'

Event Name: Credit Expo Nederland 2023
Description: Nederlands grootste business event op het gebied van Credit ManagementCredit Expo biedt een compleet overzicht van de Nederlandse markt voor Credit (Risk) Management en daaraan gerelateerde producten en diensten. Je krijgt inzicht in alle mogelijke oplossingen om kredietrisico’s te beheersen, het order-to-cash proces te stroomlijnen en je inkomende cashflow te versnellen zonder klantrelaties onnodig onder druk te zetten. Ruim 40 toonaangevende bedrijven presenteren innovatieve producten en diensten op het gebied van credit management software, kredietinformatie, elektronisch factureren, kredietverzekering, factoring en outsourcing, fraudepreventie, credit checks & onboarding, juridische incasso, minnelijke incasso en meer. Je ziet in één dag wat er in de markt speelt en kunt zodoende een goede vergelijking maken tussen de verschillende aanbieders.Daarnaast worden in een uitgebreid programma van seminars en workshops alle facetten van het veelzijdige vakgebied Credit Management belicht. Dit jaar is "Duurzaamheid" het centrale thema. Kijk voor meer informatie op: www.creditexpo.nl/eventDutch largest business event in the field of Credit ManagementCredit Expo offers a complete overview of the Dutch market for Credit (Risk) Management and related products and services. You will get insight into all possible solutions to manage credit risks, streamline the order-to-cash process and accelerate your incoming cash flow without putting unnecessary pressure on customer relations. Over 40 leading companies will present innovative products and services in credit management software, credit information, electronic invoicing, credit insurance, factoring and outsourcing, fraud prevention, credit checks & onboarding, legal collection, amicable collection and more. In one day, you will see what is going on in the market and can thus make a good comparison between the various providers.In addition, an extensive programme of seminars and workshops will highlight all facets of the multi-faceted field of Credit Management. This year's central theme is "Sustainability". For more information, please visit: www.creditexpo.nl/event

Event Name: FitNation Conference 2023
Description: Innovate, Motivate, DebateA new era has dawned for the fitness industry - one in which technology, innovation, diversity and sustainability will inspire, motivate and spark debate. No longer are we bound by the physical constraints of the here-and-now. It is only our imaginations that can limit us. Join us as we venture beyond these limits. Join us as we explore the future of fitness.Enjoy the day sharing and networking with your peers in the Fitness Industry, from around the globe.

Event Name: Stitch & Bitch Knitting Accountability Club
Description: We meet every 2nd and 4th Tuesday of the month for stitchin' & bitchin'.  Join a wonderful group of creatives of all levels as they knit!  All handcrafters are welcome to join!  This club is for knitters who already know the basics of knitting and just need guidence on new projects.  If you want to learn to knit please sign up for our Beginners Knitting Course!  A ticket must be purchased for every class you want to attend. We do not supply supplies, please bring all supplies you need for your project.Meet Nina CherieNina Cherie is a limited edition home textiles brand with a focus on vibrant color interactions and design. Each piece is created with the intention to bring playful energy into a given space. Handmade in her home studio just south of Boston, Nina creates each piece from start to finish with the help of her knitting machine. Using sustainable materials and careful craftsmanship she hopes that each item be passed down, the same way her Nana's knits have been passed down to her.Nina fell in love with textiles during her second year at Massachusetts College of Art and Design. She was fascinated when she stumbled into the fibers closet of her weaving classroom, she described it to be a "Harry Potter" closet with endless magical yarns scattered on all the tall shelves with a creepy old ladder to reach the highest shelves. This was when she found her happy place. After receiving her BFA she moved forward in full force as a working artist by building her brand and taking custom orders. She hopes to spread playfulness and comfort through all her creations.The Nest is a sustainable fashion collective fighting the toxic cycle of overconsumption and textile waste through decluttering services, a secondhand store, community events, and educational workshops.Together, we inspire authenticity and sustainability by shifting mindsets, encouraging slow consumption, and ultimately diverting textile waste out of landfills.Based in Providence, RI.

Event Name: How to Reset to Your Superwoman's 'SELF'! - Boston
Description: Free Live 2-Day Workshop (via Zoom)A workshop designed for all Superwomen - women managing their demanding career and family life while sacrificing their own needs. It's not surprising that you feel Exhausted and have absolutely No Energy.Have you been living with stress so long that you feel it is controlling your life or has become accepted as your daily norm?Are your relationships impacted by your depleted state regardless of how much you 'people please'?You crave quality time for yourself but don't know how to fit it into your day and when you do find time, you feel guilty about it?Have you tried other methods to cope or manage stress, only to feel more unhappy, totally drained and have no idea how to 'fix' it?Learn to easily RESET YOUR INNER SELF by ELIMINATING STRESS permanently with the simple 4-Step S.E.L.F Method (Stress Elimination for Limitless Freedom).This 4-Step Method is simple to grasp and you will be surprised how easy it is to access! This is entirely Inner work - it is reconnecting to the better part of you and bringing reality to your inner world.Each day in the workshop, you will learn how to implement the four steps into your life - to live from the Inside-Out through:Self Alignment, Self Awareness, Self Love, Self CareThis discovery includes simple suggestions or examples of how to apply these in life. The 2-day workshop starts and ends at the same time each day (3rd weekend of each month - Saturday and Sunday).The workshop is interactive so come ready to participate and share in this safe space. Your participation will help you discover and unlock what your Inner Self already knows - and then apply it for real change in your unique real world.Imagine how good you'll feel living your healthiest best! Your family will love the rejuvenated you - giving your best while feeling your best is so much easier from a restored place than through exhaustion. You will turn heads at work with the energy you bring to your meetings and interactions. Your friends will be amazed with the change and love the renewed time you have to give in your relationships. And, the best part, YOU will have energy beyond what you ever thought possible with more than enough for your own personal desires.With stress elimination your overall best health will be supported - seeing improvements in aches/pains and sleep as well as reduced anxiety and depression.In this workshop you'll leave with:Clarity around the truth, reality and cause of stress.What connection to your SELF really means.Mini Action Plan that will help you start releasing it immediately for increased energy!New friends who may become part of your support network going forward.Join us for this 2-day interactive workshop to start creating your stress-free world! Each session is 2.5 hours and begins at 12PM Pacific. There will be time for a Q+A at the end of each session and we will finish with your SELF Reset.This is YOUR time!

Event Name: Third Thurs: Jared Harél, Max Heinegg, Deborah Leipziger & Anastasia Vassos
Description: In person at Brookline Booksmith! Join us for an evening of poetry with Jared Harél, Max Heinegg, Deborah Leipziger, & Anastasia Vassos. This event is part of Third Thursdays Poetry, a monthly reading series  at Brookline Booksmith.Register for the event!RSVP to let us know you're coming! Depending on the volume of responses, an RSVP may be required for entrance to the event. You will also be alerted to important details about the program, including safety requirements, cancellations, and book signing updates.Livestream!Barring technical difficulty, this event will be livestreamed on our store YouTube channel.Third Thursdays Poetry: SeptemberAnastasia Vassos is the author of Nike Adjusting Her Sandal (Nixes Mate, 2021) and Nostos (Kelsay Books, 2023.) Nostos was named a finalist in Two Sylvias’ and Headlight Review’s Chapbook Contests. Her poems have been nominated for the Pushcart Prize, Best of the Net, and Best New Poets. She speaks three languages, rides her bike, and lives in Boston.Deborah Leipziger is an author, poet, and advisor on sustainability. Born in Brazil, Ms. Leipziger is the author of several books on sustainability and human rights. Her poems have been published in eight countries, in such magazines and journals as Pangyrus, Salamander, Lily Poetry Review, and Revista Cardenal. She is the co-founder of Soul-Lit, an on-line poetry magazine. Her collection of poems, Story & Bone, was published in early 2023 by Lily Poetry Review Books. Her chapbook, Flower Map, was published by Finishing Line Press. Her work appears in numerous anthologies, including Tree Lines: 21st Century American Poems.Max Heinegg's first book, Good Harbor, won the inaugural Paul Nemser Prize from Lily Poetry Press in 2022. His new book of poems is Going There, also published by Lily. His work has appeared in 32 Poems, The Cortland Review, Thrush, Nimrod, and Matter, among others.  He is the founder and editor of Panther Cave Press, a press created to publish writers with a strong connection to Medford, MA, and is the co-founder and brewmaster of Medford Brewing Company. He has taught English in the Medford Public Schools since 1998. As a recording artist, his records can be found on Spotify, Itunes, Bandcamp, and at www.maxheinegg.comJared Harél is the author of Let Our Bodies Change the Subject, selected by Kwame Dawes as the Winner of the 2022 Raz/Shumaker Prairie Schooner Book Prize in Poetry (U. of Nebraska Press, 2023) and Go Because I Love You (Diode Editions, 2018.) He’s been awarded the ‘Stanley Kunitz Memorial Prize’ from American Poetry Review, as well as the ‘William Matthews Poetry Prize’ from Asheville Poetry Review. Jared teaches writing, plays drums, and lives with his family in Westchester, NY.About Brookline BooksmithWe are one of New England’s premier independent bookstores, family-owned and locally run since 1961. We offer an extensive selection of new, used, and bargain books; unique, beautiful gifts; award-winning events series; and specialty foods. Every day, we strive to foster community through the written word, represent a diverse range of voices and histories, and inspire conversations that enrich our lives. Find more at brooklinebooksmith.com!EVENT ACCESSIBILITY This event will take place at street level. If possible, the event will be livestreamed to YouTube. ASL interpretation may be provided (based on the availability of interpreters) but must be requested at least 2 weeks in advance of the event. Seats are limited. Please email us at tickets@brooklinebooksmith.com as soon as possible if you require ASL interpretation, guaranteed seating, or other accommodations. We will do our best to serve your needs!

Event Name: Letting go of perfectionism: High Performing WomenClass/Online/ Providence
Description: In my many years working with high-performing women, I've noticed limiting patterns affecting performance and overall wellness. Some include a lack of self-confidence (e.g., impostor syndrome), putting other people's needs first, perfectionism, and burnout.Some of these limitations are rooted in the context in which we live. For example, women are constantly expected to meet society's conflicting demands: be extraordinary, practice self-care, spend quality time with family, and be good caregivers. How can you feel good enough in an environment demanding more and more?In this 1-hour master class, we will explore perfectionism and identify the keys to overcoming it. Perfectionism is the tendency to consider anything less than perfect as unacceptable. If not managed, it may produce: procrastination, high-stress levels, conflict in relationships, controlling behaviors, fear of failure, and lower performance (paradoxically.)By the end of this program, you will better understand how perfectionism impacts your life and obtain tools to overcome it. You will leave feeling empowered to pursue your goals with greater self-awareness and self-compassion.Before the event, you will receive a Zoom invitation. CLASS CONTENTSDifference between perfectionism and having high standards. Impact of this pattern on personal life, relationships, and work. Perfectionism development theories. Five keys to managing perfectionism. ABOUT MEMy name is Rodolfo Alvarez. I'm a certified wellness and sexology coach working with individuals and organizations like schools, non-profits, and major companies like PepsiCo and McKinsey. I've been in the wellness field since 2010, and my work has taken me across the world, including Chile, Mexico, Canada, and the U.S.

Event Name: 2023 Druker Award & Lecture: David Manfredi
Description: This year's awardee, David P. Manfredi, CEO & Founding Principal of Elkus Manfredi Architects, will be in conversation with Boston Public Library President David Leonard. Following the discussion there will be an audience Q&A. Druker Company President Ronald M. Druker will give welcoming remarks.More about David P. Manfredi, FAIA, LEED AP:David Manfredi works with clients across the country on a diverse portfolio of planning and design projects. Deeply committed to the belief that the quality of our environment directly influences the quality of our lives, he effectively advocates for building and protecting vital, sustainable, durable urban places. At every scale, in every context, David's mission is to create common ground that brings people and communities together. He reinvents tired urban precincts into 21st-century mixed-use environments, the edges of universities from barriers into connective seams with adjacent neighborhoods, underutilized urban areas into diverse innovation districts that support the collaborative imperatives of today's science and technology, and obsolete manufacturing buildings into repurposed hubs of living and working that reinvigorate the urban core. The portfolio of design work is diverse in typology and scale and similar in sense of purpose and commitment to values of sustainability, diversity and inclusion. This diversity of work and commitment to values is manifest in the planning for Boston Landing and the architecture of New Balance headquarters, Boston Bruins and Boston Celtics practice facilities and the Track at New Balance; the mixed-use towers of Seaport Square; the research headquarters for Vertex Pharmaceuticals; the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard; the research headquarters for MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston, TX; the Seaport headquarters for Mass Mutual; the rehabilitations of the Cathedral of the Holy Cross; the former Sears building at 401 Park Drive; and the planning for the Volpe Redevelopment Parcel at MIT. A compelling, sought-after speaker and thought-leader, David presents to business, civic, and professional organizations throughout the country about the value that mindful design brings to the quality of everyday life.David is a Fellow of the American Institute of Architects and an active member of the Boston Preservation Alliance, Boston Society of Architects, and Urban Land Institute (ULI). He serves on the Boston Civic Design Commission, as chair of the University of Notre Dame School of Architecture Advisory Council, on the Board of Trustees of the Boston Architectural College, the Boston Society of Architects Foundation and the ULI Boston Advisory Board. David is a graduate of the University of Notre Dame with Bachelor degrees in both English and Architecture, and the University of Chicago, where he received a Master of Arts.David has been recognized by A Better City with the Norman B. Leventhal Excellence in City Building Award, by the Boston Preservation Alliance with the President’s Award and St. Anthony’s Shrine with the Pope Francis Award.About the BPL's COVID-19 health and safety protocols:Program attendees are recommended to wear masks covering their noses and mouths.Read the BPL's latest COVID-19 guidelines for visiting the library.Program presenters will remove their masks during the program.

Event Name: Credit and Debt Health: Forging a Path to Financial Wellness
Description: Millennial RI and The Money Club, sponsored by BankNewport, invite you to our impactful workshop, "Credit and Debt Health: Forging a Path to Financial Wellness," on August 17th at Booth, 245 Main Street, Pawtucket, RI 02860.From 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm, our experts will reveal the secrets of credit building and offer proven strategies for successful debt management, including dealing with credit cards, personal loans, and imminent student loan repayments. Learn about debt consolidation and refinancing, and how they can play a part in your financial wellness.Ideal for anyone eager to gain control over their financial health, this workshop is your ticket to a secure financial future. Start building a successful foundation with us!Tickets are $10. Limited spots available. Light refreshments will be provided.

Event Name: FLP Tour: 5 Stages Generational Wealth Bootcamp (Western Massachusetts)
Description: Are you the first in your family to start building wealth? Start or continue your journey with us by attending one of our upcoming generational wealth bootcamps!Our Community and Our EnvironmentWe provide an environment of current, uplifting and supportive people committed to supporting you in your journey to escaping the paycheck to paycheck lifestyle, mindset and habit shifting and being accountable to your goals. Most importantly, we believe you’ll find people to forward your personal and professional growth just like you - lawyers, nurses, engineers, burger-flippers, you name it - Coming from a range of diverse ethnic backgrounds and life experiences - wanting to make a difference in the world.Who is our audience made up of?First Generation Wealth Builders (FGWBs) --70%First Generation Wealth Builders (FGWBs) and second generation wealth builders (SGWBs) are First generation wealth builders (FGWBs) and second generation wealth builders (SGWBs) are terms that have been used since 2012 to describe individuals in two different circumstances of building wealth.First generation wealth builders are individuals who have no financial inheritance, no inherited assets and are the first in their family to start and continue the process of building generational wealth in their families. A first generation wealth builder is usually building from ground zero: zero inheritance in financial assets, a portfolio of liabilities and a $0 or negative net worthSecond Generation Wealth Builders (SGWBs) -- 20%A second generation wealth builder, typically is an individual who is one of the few in their family to think about and/or continue the process of building generational wealth. Second generation wealth builders (SGWBs) usually have some financial inheritance or some type of inherited assets from the first generation wealth builder(s) in their family but don’t know how to manage, sustain or grow their inheritance and are looking to learn what their options are and best principles and practices to minimize risks in investing and maximize the use of their current resources while doing so. However, unlike a first generation wealth builder, a second generation wealth builder does not start at ground zero; second generation wealth builders typically start with some inheritance in financial assets, maybe a portfolio of assets and liabilities and a positive net worth, which can range anywhere from $100K - $500K to a multi-millionaire.NuancesFirst generation wealth builders generally are living a paycheck to paycheck lifestyle and/or have no passive income streams with a $0 and negative net worth. However, some first generation wealth builders can have a positive net worth, those usually from their own hard work and no inheritance. Second generation wealth builders, though they have inherited one or more financial assets with a high-level net worth can be living paycheck to paycheck or have a cushion, but typically do not know how to maintain, invest and grow the wealth and assets inherited.Third Generation Wealth Builders and Multi-Generational Wealth Builders --10%These individuals usually have some financial inheritance or some type of inherited assets but don't know how to manage, sustain or grow their inheritance and are looking to learn how to do so.You should join our community if you want to...Learn the basics...✅ change your mindset and knowledge on money to learn accurate and correct financial information to become financially literate (Stage 1)✅ create a financial plan to undo financial damage and  start repairing a solid financial foundation to build on (Stage 2)✅ save and manage money well (Stage 2)✅ explore short-term and long-term investing opportunities / best practices for investing (Stage 2)and learn what the top 1% are doing (advanced finance, business and investing education and opportunities)...✅ own, build and sustain successful online and/or brick-and-mortar businesses from idea to planning to funding and capital to management and sustainability to a full-time income (Stage 3)✅ learn the tax code / best tax practices to keep more of your hard earned money in your pocket / in your family for no matter what you are at in your journey (Stages 2-5)✅ explore and invest in different types of traditional and non-traditional investing opportunities / pros and cons: real estate, stocks, bonds, crypto, nfts, etc. (Stage 4)✅ learn the best ways / explore best practices to grow and protect your financial assets and portfolio (Stages 2-5)AND don't just learn these, but get matched to one or more mentors in our network to work with you at every stages DURING the bootcamp AND AFTER the bootcamp ends so that you can continue to make progress on your journey to building individual and generational wealth.Generational Wealth BootcampRegister for our next generational wealth bootcamp in a city near you! Get a Ticket & Save Your Seat for Our Upcoming generational wealth bootcamp!Get a Ticket & Save Your SeatSubmit Your Finance, Business, Investing & Wealth Building questions.Get informatiion about educational resources, scholarships and grants.Generational Wealth Bootcamp Event Agenda- Open Networking / Shopping / Refreshments / Resource Sign Up- Intro / Welcome / Intention Setting- S1: Guest Speaker (Purpose, Vision and MM)- (Break) Refreshments / Submit Your Questiions on Building Generational Wealth- 5 Stages Breakout and Work Sessions- Reflections, Resource Sign Ups and Announcements- 1:1 Consultation Sessions (if scheduled) and New Community Member Welcome OrientationDon't see a bootcamp being hosted in your city or state? E-mail us at firstladiesofpovertyfoundation@gmail.com to Invite us to your community!* * * Learn more about our partners, sponsors and guest speakers  * *Become a partner, sponsor or speaker: firstladiesofpovertyfoundation@gmail.comPast EventsMondays at 8 p.m. EST - 9:00 p.m. EST - Generational Wealth Bootcamp: Online Entrepreneurship and Digital Real Estate (Virtual) with FLP founder and CEO, Shatoyia JonesThursdays at 4:00 p.m. EST - 5:00 p.m. EST - Generational Wealth Bootcamp: Online Entrepreneurship and Digital Real Estate (Virtual) with FLP founder and CEO, Shatoyia JonesThursdays at 7:30 p.m. EST - 8:30 p.m. EST - All Things Financial Planning, Passive Income, Investing, Equity & Creating Multiple Streams of Income + Generational Wealth Bootcamp Workspace: Question and Answer [Come prepared with questions!] with FLP founder and CEO, Shatoyia Jones + FLP financial mentor Danielle Tucker and guestsOctober 2020-January 1, 2021: Creating Multiple Streams of Income - Generational Wealth Blueprint - Undisclosed Secrets to Wealth Building - 3+ Income Streams Bootcamp - Generational Wealth Formula - All Things Finances, Money, Passive Income and Generational WealthSeptember 23, 2020 7:30 pm Blueprint to Financial Success: We will talk about assessing your money mindset and redeveloping it into the proper mindset for financial independence. In addition to mindset transformation, this workshop covers five core competencies of financial literacy: Income, Budgeting, Saving, Borrowing, ProtectingSeptember 30, 2020: 7:30pm Life Insurance In Action: What's all the hype about? Why is this one of the best kept financial secrets? How will this help your family? How will it help you while your still here? Why the government wants you to have it and even incentive tax laws to make it even better.October 7: Building a Better Budget This is the budgeting master class, no matter where you are in your financial journey your budget will always hold you down. If you've never made a budget before, if you have one and hate it, if you have one that's working, whatever the case may be you will learn how to take it to the next level.October 14: Money Talks- How to talk to your kids about money and what smart habits are crucial for them to learn early on to have a successful financially stable future.October 21: What’s The Deal With Taxes? Why do we pay taxes? Who’s deciding how much you pay? How do I file my taxes? Surprise tax bills? What’s up with the deferred taxes?October 28: Free Resources 101 What resources are available to me? How to find resources in your community. How to create resources in your community. How to share resources in your community.September 2, 2020 7:30 pm The Middle Class is Misinformed on Wealth Building: Have you ever wondered why you know folks who do pretty well for themselves, work hard and live decently but never get rich enough to pass a legacy on? It’s likely because they were taught backwards how to build and pass on wealth. The rich on the other hand seem to only be getting richer because they’ve got the foundation right and get started on the day they are born. There’s lots of factors that separate the two classes but there’s also one proven way to get more for yourself and your family.September 9, 2020 7:30 pm Lessons about Finances for Before You Leave the Nest: All the things you should’ve learned in high school. Your parents may plan to mention along the way and stuff that just eventually comes up. This is a comprehensive check list of your whole financial house for before you leave your parents house.August 19th 7:30pm : Credit vs. Debt: Understanding What It Is and What It Does: Is one better than the other? How can I make it work for me? What impact will this have on my financial future?August 26th 7:30 pm: Risk Management, Insurance and You: We will be answering all of the following questions, and I’ll come up with a resource sheet for folks that will summarize some of the important information. What is risk management?What are the risks?What is insurance? What do I need insurance for? What can insurance do for me?July 8: Understanding your Paycheck: Where are your hard earned dollars going? What kind of benefits are you paying into? Where is all this money going?? How to pay yourself first?July 15: What is My money Story? Everyone is different, but we are more alike than we like to believe. Most people work or have some source of income and pay some sort of regular bills. If you fall into this category, you might have a money story, have some sort of net worth and debt to income ratio and have some time of savings plan (or maybe you need to build one!) In this session, we will go over how to put together your money story and get started writing a more successful chapter to your money story.July 22: Financial Literacy: Assessing Your Mindset on Money with Danielle Tucker - In this workshop, Danielle talks about assessing your money mindset and redeveloping it into the proper mindset for financial independence. In addition to mindset transformation, this workshop covers five core competencies of financial literacy: Income, Budgeting, Saving, Borrowing, ProtectingJuly 29: What do you need to know?An Open question and answer session where you can ask all of your pressing financial questions.July 1: Money Moves for the Young and Single: Why you should get an advisor, build a strong financial foundation and start forming habits that will align you with your goalsJune 3: Risk Management, Insurance and You: We will be answering all of the following questions, and I’ll come up with a resource sheet for folks that will summarize some of the important information. Event Name: Securing Your Legacy - A Roadmap to Estate Planning Excellence
Description: Are you concerned about ensuring a secure future for your loved ones and safeguarding your hard-earned assets? Join us for an enlightening and comprehensive seminar on estate planning, where we will guide you through the intricacies of securing your legacy with precision and excellence.Attorney Bridgette Flores will provide valuable insights and essential knowledge to help you navigate the complexities of estate planning effectively.You'll gain peace of mind knowing that your legacy will be handled with care and in accordance with your wishes. You will leave the workshop equipped with actionable strategies to optimize your workflow, overcome common productivity challenges, and create a balanced and fulfilling life.Who Should AttendYou must be someone who:is willing to invest in themselves and not so proud they cannot learn from othersis wanting to grow their dream/calling/business/practice with more focus and less work is committing themselves to achieve this outcome right nowOn the other hand, if you're someone who is:is not willing to see themselves as part of the problem and also part of the solution is not actively seeking support nowwill not see their own ''stuff'' and only blame circumstances for their lack of success... then this might not be a fit for your right now.Don't let time slip through your fingers – join us for this transformative workshop and unlock your potential to manage your time effectively, supercharge your productivity, and create the life you envision.
